Summary: One of the best properties of Hilton! Best breakfast service, clean rooms, nice size pool, rooms are spacious neat and clean,at reception  It was very quick check in and check out Enough parking for guests $25 a night which is very nominal rate for the location. 10 minutes drive from Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Location and Quiet After Disney
Summary: It is always great to come back to the hotel from a long day at Disneyland.  This hotel has everything you need.  The separate sitting area really is a benefit to families who stay here.  The breakfast in the morning is great way to start the day.  The front desk was very helpful with all questions we had during our stay.  There is a small gift shop if you forgot anything and Target is right down the street.   You will not be disappointed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is little out dated. Bad s from bathroom sink. Beds are comfortable. Breakfast is ok. Location is good for Disney with a shuttle bus. TV service wasn’t good unable to get basic channels. Parking lot has very tight spaces. Lot of outside or maintenance noise through the day and night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My room had a bit of wear and tear. Lightbulb out, big crack in sink, carpet worn. Everything is just aged. Security in room lacks door security, no deadbolt or chain. Sliding glass door to balcony not secure either. Will likely look for newer hotel next time.
Manager Response: Hi Chrise07814IP,  We do not have sliding glass doors to a balcony in any of our rooms here at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. Could it be that you stayed at another Hotel?

Summary: Stayed here for a weekend Disneyland trip. We got a standard King Bedroom suite. The hotel is very nice - beds are soft and rooms are very quiet. There's a 'sturdy' feeling to the floors, too. Water pressure is also very nice (I've stayed at pricey hotels were the shower water pressure is just dribbles of sadness so now I pay extra attention to the water). The hotel itself is RIGHT next to a bus stop that takes you directly to Disneyland so there's no need to uber or lyft. It comes every 15 minutes. A bus day pass is $6 - totally worth it! (PS. The bus app is called **A-Way WeGo**) The hotel serves a standard breakfast every morning and all you need to do is show them your pass or tell the staff your room number. Breakfast consists of the American staples: unlimited bacon,
Room tip: If the vending machine doesn't take your card, the front desk can sell you bottled water for...
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great experience, spacious and modern! Breakfast/HH are included. Shuttle stops at the hotel to take you over to Disney (Front Office team can help w/ great service) or it's just a quick drive. We have stayed at several hotels near Disney, and I would say this has been our favorite.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for a couple of nice. We found it a s good hotel for the price. We were informed that we have to request the room cleaning or towels. Otherwise, they wouldn't do it. They have a free breakfast, but we didn't have it. The parking is extra. The room was spacious and clean
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great friendly employees! Arrived late from a long drive. Sofia at check-in was amazing and always kept a smile and was cool under pressure with the long line.  She helped with a reservation adjustment which was amazing.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is aging and a bit further dated than I recall. Check in was horrible as we waited more than 30 minutes to get through four people ahead of us. The check in is by a door that constantly opens and closes which is not good on a cold windy day.   We were aware that they were not serving rooms unless we asked. One morning I asked to have one of the beds changed and not just have sheets left. They didn’t listen and only left sheets just inside the door for us to deal with.   Breakfast is a joke. We were surprised how many people would fill multiple plates with heaps of food take take them quickly yo their rooms dripping food along the way and in the lifts. Gross and shame on the clientele staying at the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Expensive hotel with a bad/ poor customer service
Summary: I arrived @4 am on December 31, and i was asking the front desk if i could do the early check in and willing to pay any early fees, but Maritsa stated that they were fully booked when i over heard her on the phone that one the guest did not show up and charging them a fees. So i asked her since you have no show can we have that room and ill Pay early fees. And she said NO! But i can come back around noon or 6 am to see if there’s room available. Why would she tells me to comeback if they can see in the system if they have a room available so it means by 6 am they will magically room available? Unbelievable that she says that. Also, i said that i have a dog and she charged me for 75 fee and even when i literally said that my dog is a service dog she didn’t care what i said.  Bad
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stay here and while on vacation you pay full price for your family that you then get to clean your own room! Each day you can empty trash your own trash request towels, coffee, & shampoo!! And even before you check in your room won’t be ready on time so be patient and wait.  They could probably be done time if they didn’t have to spend all the time cleaning rooms that other guest mistake as a vacation and let the daily messes build up!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Do not stay more than 2-3 nights!
Summary: We booked a 6 night stay at this Embassy Suites while visiting Orange County for a 2 day trip to Disneyland and to attend a family wedding. I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member and had saved up a year's worth of my points to book this hotel and decided to go with this Hilton brand hotel due to the proximity to Disneyland, the space to accommodate our group (4 adults and 2 kids), and the breakfast being included. When I used my Hilton app to choose a room to check into, I chose a room on the 14th floor, but when we arrived to the hotel, I was told we were being reassigned to a room on the 9th floor because our room was given to another family. The hotel is a very outdated Embassy Suites that badly needs remodeling. The parking lot is shared with a Hampton Inn and a Homewood suites
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked this for a 2 day, 3 night trip to Disneyland. Recently remodeled, clean, and comfortable. Very friendly staff and great included breakfast, including omelette station. Too far to walk to Disneyland though very easy to get a ride share from this location. Also very close to Target if you need any extra items and has a small market in the lobby with fair pricing. Would stay here again for Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in was very friendly & helpful. They do not offer a mobile room key without visiting the front desk first and they give breakfast vouchers at this location.   The atrium was fun to see for the kids. We were on the top floor and it was very quiet.  In-room coffee is my 5th star earner. It’s not great here. Just those tea bag coffees. They need to upgrade to keurig or lavazza. PLEASE.   The room itself was comfortable. We left too early in the mornings (to Disneyland!) for breakfast. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pass if we expect the normal Hilton hotel standard
Summary: I would not recommend this hotel. They do not clean the rooms daily. In a post Covid world this is simply unacceptable. It is conveniently located, but I won’t return. My room was only stocked with 2 towels, and they won’t clean till day 5
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great stay from start to finish. Staff was very attentive and rooms were clean and comfortable. This was our second time staying at this hotel and we will definitely keep coming back on our trips to Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: From the start it was a terrible experience.   We booked 3 rooms with double beds (we were a total of 10 family members) and we got 3 rooms with king beds a pull out couches.  One toilet ran non stop, one toilet clogged/backed up, the bath tub leaked and caulking was black with mold.  The evening reception was only tortilla chips, salsa, flat bread and hummus - along with old vegetables
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is horrible. I do not recommend staying here. The staff made it seem like have a clean bathroom was too high of an expectation. I book my hotel using a 3rd party website and had to call them for a refund.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Still great for our Disneyland trip
Summary: We stayed in this hotel 12 years ago when we went to Disneyland and it was great - so we decided to stay there again. It still met all of our expectations: really good complimentary breakfast and happy hour, quiet for sleeping, cheerful staff. I like the set up of all room entrances facing the inner courtyard and the glass elevator. Dining is in the courtyard which has a large waterfall water feature - very relaxing. Overall very comfortable and accommodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: worst hotel and workers hands down
Summary: we stayed for 7 days 6 nights, not one day did our room get cleaned, change of towels.toilet paper.  but when we Asked for these things they didn't show the first second or third time, but forth time call for it. then our room had no AC called day one to check on it said someone would be there to fix it never happened. day two nothing day three finally someone showed up at 11pm worked until 2am trying to fix it. when we went to complain the worker said corporate phone number was on there website then hung up the phone on me.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family stayed here for the 3rd time but will not be staying again. The rooms are not kept up. Our room had a leaky shower where the water dripped loudly and constantly , the carpet was stained with some type of red stain , the mattress on the fold out bed was dirty and worn and the bedding was not fresh . The other room we rented had a toilet that ran so much we had to turn off the water at night . The breakfast was  ok and happy hour had a nice selection of appetizers, although we asked for a glass of milk and they said that milk was not complimentary during happy hour which seemed odd . I expressed my dissatisfaction to the hotel when we left and was told I should have said something when we were there but who wants to spend a trip with maintenance people  and complaints?
Manager Response: Dear Bogadas2018,  Thank you for your detailed review. I am very sorry for the issues you encountered in the room during your visit. We do have a preventive maintenance program in place but missed the issue in your rooms when you stayed with us. We try to get in all the rooms frequently but unfortunately, during high occupancy times, it is sometimes difficult to reach that gaol. I understand that it is inconvenient to have Engineering go to the room during your stay. I am glad you enjoyed the breakfast and evening reception, and I am sorry about the comment about Milk being not included. All items on the non-alcoholic beverage station are available, including the milk, and I will review that with the team. I hope you will give us another chance in the future to prove to you that what you experienced is not the norm at the Hotel. Kind regards

Summary: This was the nicest hotel we've ever stayed at.  We came for Disney.  This is a very kid friendly hotel.  My kids loved the lion and waterfall.  The food was great and the tram was easy to take to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Bridget C, Thank you for your nice review. I am glad you and your family enjoyed the Hotel, the lion and waterfall and of course, the food. We look forward to hopefully being able to welcome you back in the future.

Summary: We have stayed 2 times now at this property. 8/2014 and 8/2022. Overall another great stay and we will be back! PROS *very clean, spacious rooms *great complimentary breakfast till 930am w/ made to order omelets, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash brown potatoes, fruit salad, (pancakes, waffles, french toast rotate daily), oatmeal, cereal, beverage station.  *5-630pm complimentary happy hour was also great w/ snacks and beverage station *friendly and helpful staff *close to Disneyland  CONS * We never received housekeeping. There is no longer daily housekeeping and you are offered a 1 time visit. I chose day 2 but no one ever came. I did call the front desk and staff brought extra towels and I had to visit the front desk for toilet paper. We didn't even miss housekeeping but
Manager Response: Dear Soupy1012,  Thank you for your kind review. I appreciate you listing the pros and cons and of course I which there would not be the later (Cons). I reviewed your comments about the housekeeping service with the team and like to apologize that they missed cleaning your room as requested. I am sorry as well that you had experienced a wait at the elevators. All elevators are working but unfortunately there are a few high traffic times when I wish we could have more elevators. On a positive note, I am happy to report to you that the Lion is moving again. It took us a little time to find the mechanism as these items are not as readily available, but he is fixed and not only roaring, but moving again too. Hopefully we will be able to welcome you back sometime in the future for another visit.

Summary: We have stayed at this particular Embassy Suite near Disneyland several times over the past 20 years. One thing that has never changed (& it's a huge problem that I don't see at any other Hotel anywhere), is the narrow parking spots. These parking spots that we have to pay $20 a night for are barely big enough for a 4 Door Sedan to fit & that's if the person to your right & to your left parks perfect (which they never do). I saw so many people park over the line (some did this because their vehicle was too big & some were just lazy or don't know how to park). I took the liberty of walking the entire parking lot & saw only about 30% of the Vehicles displaying their Parking Pass on their dash yet no tow truck showed up to tow these vehicles away, so I guess it's better to lie &
Manager Response: Dear Brian J, thank you for your detailed review. I am sorry that we did not live up to your expectations at your last visit. We are part of an Association that manages the parking area as it serves 3 different Hotels, and we  certainly will review your comments with the team at the next meeting. I shared your feedback about the hotel amenities with our staff to make sure  they are addressed. Staffing in hotels has been very challenging and we are diligently working on building our team back to the pre-pandemic levels and expertise, and we train many new staff members continuously  so that we can hold up and exceed  the standards that you have come to expect of our hotel. Thank you again for your time and feedback.

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be
Summary: Management has let this beautiful hotel go down, the pool was dirty, the jacuzzi was filthy, all the elevators were not working, and the advertised restaurant to dine at was closed, as if that wasn't enough, the complimentary breakfast was nothing more than premade scrambled eggs and sausage under a heat lamp, along with small slices of fruit and of course, coffee and juices.
Manager Response: Dear Road66491035721, Thank you for your review. I am sorry that you did not find the Hotel in the condition you expected. I am disappointed to read about the condition of the pool area and will certainly review that with the team. In regards to the elevators, unfortunately we had to wait for a replacement part for a very long time due to the shortages of these electronics, but all elevators are back in service now. We have had trouble finding qualified staff for the Food and Beverage department but are making strides in hiring and training new team members. I will reach out to you with a private message as well and I hope you will give us an opportunity in the future to prove to you that the hotel is still how you remember it from your previous visits.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and staff but location/ART shuttle disappoints
Summary: This review is to help all the parents of little kids out there. Do not think you can stay here and ride the ART shuttle to and from Disneyland without waiting upwards of 45 min to an hour each way. We found the schedule to be so unreliable and wasted so much time on our trip. The buses themselves are not too full, just not available! If you are heading to Disney in the AM and staying all day then I think this location is a great option. However, we were wanting to take a midday break for naps and cool offs. It just was such a bummer to have tired kids waiting for shuttles. We can't uber with little ones due to their car seat requirements so that's not an option either. The worst wait times seemed to be right smack in the middle of the day when we needed them. early morning and
Manager Response: Hello Cailingr, Thank you for your review and I am glad to read that you enjoyed the Hotel and the amenities we offer. We will be reaching out to ART Shuttle to share your experience with them. I am sorry about the delays for the transportation to and from Disney. Hopefully we will be able to welcome you back for another visit in the future.

Summary: This place is a dump. The room was clean and updated which was nice but that was it. Breakfast didn't have nearly the options that Embassy Suites typically has. The gym was dirty. The pool was nasty. There were piles of towells on the floors when we checked in. We had to wait 2-10 minutes for an elevator every time since 2-4 were broken. Please avoid unless you are getting a fantastic deal. I am a Diamond member and asked for a water bottle and was told it would cost $1. For the first time I ever, I actually e-mailed a complaint and I was given 5k points, so about the equivalent of 1/12 of nights stay. I stayed for four nights at $250/night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was pretty good considering the many challenges they face - understaffed, broken elevators, etc.  I was given a room that was drenched by a mystery leak the first night and the hotel was so booked that I couldn't change rooms. As compensation I was offered "points" or a coupon. Not exactly what I consider fair compensation. I would have preferred to have the room comped for that night. They found me another room the next night and after that things were OK. I stayed a week and the room was cleaned once. Not ideal.  This place is very kid friendly though, and my grand daughter loved the pool. We took advantage of free breakfast every day. Proximity to Disneyland was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Disneyland stay very close to the Parks.
Summary: 3 night stay on a Disneyland Trip. Hotel is less than 2 miles down Harbor from the parks. There is a mass transit bus stop immediately in-front of hotel entrance. We chose to Uber to and from fir $7-8 each way. The hotel breakfast was decent and the menu changed each day.    The rooms were comfortable and great for a family. The hotel did show some wear. Its obvious the hotel turns a lot of guests but it was very clean and comfortable. The elevators were a bit slow. Laundry is available on a couple of floors.   Advice: Ask for a low floor due to elevators being slow.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel might be a bit aged. But the staff is amazing, and the convenience of location to Disneyland with the shuttle stop directly outside is great. Thank you to Charlene and Lillian for going above & beyond to make our stay special and enjoyable. Thank you to Jackie in Housekeeping for going out of her way to assist us with our luggage & holding the elevator for us. Thank you to Lupe at the breakfast buffet for serving our food with the warmest smile, it set such a great start to our mornings. Overall, we had an excellent stay because of the staff's kindness and care. We will definitely be staying here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I liked this property immensely. Family trip to Disneyland this hotel offers close proximity. About 1.5 miles yet very quiet. Disney shuttle picks up in front of hotel twice an hour. Cost is $6 for a one day unlimited pass.  Rooms at the Embasssy are of course really big. I believe 550 square feet with seperate sleeping area. 2 tvs along with a microwave and refrigerator. Nice touch. Parking is $20 a night and we had no issues regarding safety or finding a spot. Service from all employees I encountered were really good. Thank you to Grace at check in for the warm welcome. Breakfast was typical Embassy. Omelette of the day station along  with waffles/french toast and hash browns/sausage. Also yogurt and bagels were readily available. Hotel was clean and in a nice safe location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The greedy owner oversells the hotel and then cancels your reservation and tries to get you to stay in a room you didn't book or somewhere else. I should have booked somewhere else to begin with.  I won't be back.  Overbooking is basically a form of bait-and-switch, which is illegal. Hotels should be fined for these practices. The only reason they do it is for greedy owners to make more money. Well, not from me.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were staying in LA as part of a wider driving tour of the West Coast and have stayed in Anaheim several times previously on similar vacations.  We reserved six nights stay in a 'Larger Suite' through Expedia and got a great deal for a little over $1,100.  The property is easily found when taking the Harbour Blvd turning off Interstate 5. It is set back from the Boulevard along a 300 yd drive and adjoins several other hotels under the Hilton brands, plus a Hyatt.  There is ample parking in the parking-lot, which is shared by Embassy Suites and the adjoining hotels.  There is no barrier-control, so just drive in, find a space and pay the hotel $20 per day for a ticket to display on your windscreen.    Check in was efficient - and as this was at a time when the USA was emerging
Manager Response: none

Summary: I should start by noting there was a time when the Embassy Suites hotels were well above the competition with the open atrium, cooked to order breakfast and two room suites. We have stayed  in them all over the country and at this site, in particular, for many years. Our last visit, just concluded, will be our final one. The hotel really needs an overhaul. The beds and pillows where nearly unbearable and the first night my wife had to move to the sofa. I went down to the desk at 4am and the clerk did allow me to check several other rooms which were just as bad. After a long discussion with the desk manager in the morning, they did replace both the mattress and pillows raising the sleeping to the barely tolerable level. Of interest is that the new pillows were much higher quality
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family has frequently stayed at Embassy Suites for over 30 years and I appreciate the spaciousness and cleanliness of the rooms, as well as the made to order full breakfast. Unfortunately, my stay at the Garden Grove, CA disappointed in the breakfast department. I ordered an omelette with bacon and was told they did not have bacon, only ingredients for Denver omelettes. I accepted this, until they called out that a bacon and cheese omelette was ready for the person that ordered ahead of me. I asked the cook why she had said there was no bacon and she promptly added bacon to my omelette. They had no ketchup available (they said they ran out), but a employee cleaning the dirty tables, went to the back and brought out 2 ketchup bottles and small plastic cups for the guest to
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites in Garden Grive where an employee named Chlora  threatened me,  lied about my dog barking and scared me she is awful and needs to be fires!  I don’t feel comfortable at all and she is horrible woman.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Upon our arrival we were greeted by Collin at the front desk who was kind, knowledgeable and helpful. He is a great asset to the property. He let us know about the hotel and even that our bathroom had been remodeled recently.  The rooms were spacious and clean, a nice living room area, bathrooms were a great size and the shower was simple but stylish, and had great water pressure.  One thing that will keep us coming back is not only the great staff but the complimentary breakfast, the breakfast was well stocked. Delicious and had two gentleman walking around talking with guests, collecting trash and cleaning tables. They were great to have around and there was a manager walking around too giving the workers fists bumps and that was nice to see, it felt like a fun environment to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel to stay especially family together we book a lots of rooms together
Summary: Thanks for Taking a good care of us and I like the breakfast area we have enough time to eat the breakfast last time because then we have to go and do our business so we miss Breakfast we miss you are free drink in the evening too hope you can keep us some incentive when we go next time we should be going soon maybe In august 20 2022
Manager Response: none

Summary: Two star hotel asking for a four star room Rate....  This hotel is DATED,even with a refresh that was done years ago. Furniture is dinged-up or broken the bedding is gray and tattered.The rooms are dark by nature to avoid you really seeing how bad the condition is. They will offer a full service breakfast but not clean your room.  The only reason I am rating it two stars is beacuse house keeping does a fabulous job with what they have to work with.  With other hotels in the area its worth exploring your options.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Starting with the good items. The rooms were nice, with good amenities & clean. All staff we encountered were lovely & helpful. Onto the bad, the air conditioning is not powerful enough to cool the entire suite sufficiently. The common areas were very hot. The bar and grill had inconsistent & unpredictable hours. The parking was expensive. The lifts are very poor, and it was not uncommon in peak hours to wait 10 minutes to get a lift down.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites by Hilton Anaheim South
Summary: Overall it was clean.  No decoration.  Parking cost $20 per night plus taxes and other fees add another $6.  Breakfast is like any other hotel breakfast, nothing special.  As a matter of fact I think is fattening and unhealthy.  Bacon, eggs, sausage(not patty).  I been to Arizona Suite and had way better and healthy breakfast than this place.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: It is conveniently located near amenities and Disneyland.  I travel frequently and have stayed at other locations on Harbor, and this  place was great the first time...I decided to rebook here. This trip was nothing like the first. Not sure if the front desk staff was having a bad day, but don't take it out on the guests - I mean, customer service with a smile would be nice (we shouldn't be made to feel like an inconvenience to your work day).  The happy hour and breakfast were a perk especially if you stay here for work travels. This is solely based on this visit.. Depending on the front desk staff, you may or may not get good service. With COVID, please understand that daily housekeeping is not available, BUT having fresh towels and toiletries upon check in is nice to have
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is very nice and family friendly. It comes with a Big Breakfast bar and a fun coy pond with a lion that roars every 45 minutes. The only few down falls that I had about this hotel was the hidden 200$ fee for protection. Granted it is 100% refundable but was not expecting that upon arrival. And their pool. You would think for California the pool would be nice but it was freezing. My child didn’t even want to go in. We sat in the hot tub instead. But over all it was a nice stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I’m learning as Gold honors members to maybe not expect great service although there should be.  Maybe it’s the So cal underlying attitude of it’s a Dog eat Dog world. I’m saddened I often find myself taking on that mindset when in SoCal. Maybe I have too high expectations but when I think of customer service at better than average hotels I expect better than average customer service. My experience with the hotel is mainly front desk, room cleanliness, and amenities.  So there is happy hour with complimentary drinks. This is TOP NOTCH Offering of the hotel and we took advantage of it. We did sit at the bar as that would be a normal thing to do, we were quickly told by a staff member that we must order food to sit there. I felt it was a “gotcha” moment for him and at that moment
Manager Response: none

Summary: Most of my stays at Embassy Suite hotels are positive. This one was riddled with issues. One thing I love about Hilton hotels is the digital key, I don’t like having to wait in line to check in, it’s very convenient. This hotel is listed as having the digital key, however, after checking in the digital key displayed a message saying I needed to stop by the front desk. Well, that defeats the purpose. I was told they needed to capture my credit card and that it’s garden grove city ordinance. Ok, that’s fine if it’s truly a law in this city, but even after that, the digital key still didn’t work. Annoying, yes, but not a big deal. The person working the front desk when we checked in wasn’t very friendly either, very short with his responses about the key issues. The AC in the room
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was clean, the staff was nice, and the location is great. This hotel shares a parking lot with two other hotels, Buca di Beppo and an ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) pick up spot. It’s also very close to Target and several fast food restaurants. The cook-to-order breakfast was hot and fresh every day. The evening reception was hit and miss with adult beverages being available or not, but there were always fresh vegetables and chips and salsa available along with their soda machines. My kids loved the fish in the reception area too. Parking is $20/night unless you stay several nights and then they may discount it to $15/night. There is a Speed Queen washer and dryer on floors 6 and 9 that are coin operated ($1.25/load). The pool and hot tub are nice and towels are provided
Manager Response: none

Summary: Average at best. No room service, no housekeeping, masks mandatory in public spaces, made to order breakfast was decent but it was the same exact items all four days we were there. I was ignored by front desk employees when my family was locked out of our room, and when I asked to so speak with a manager one of them pointed to him, who was also standing right in front of me ignoring me. We have stayed with them multiple years I believe the pandemic ruined them. Won’t stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been going to this hotel for 20 plus years and the last 3-4 years have really went down hill.  This used to be the absolute only hotel my family would stay at.  This year however will probably be our last stay and will find elsewhere next trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Don’t expect more but be satisfied with a little less than most embassy suites in large cities it felt like a small town embassy suites with not much to offer but the rooms are what you’d expect from embassy suites
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean room and hotel. Very friendly and efficient staff. Spacious and comfortable  room. Fantastic breakfast and delicious evening reception snacks. Just would like a larger bed. Doubles are hard to share.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything in this hotel was great, was able to enjoy all amenities, good food, good drinks staff was great, was able to use gym, was able to go swimming, use hot tub, enjoy some good appetizers and drinks at the bar,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Where to start.  First off, there were no bags in the trash cans, not were there any washcloths.  We had to physically go to front desk to get them.  The Rep Judy went and got them and handed to me, like it was a normal thing.  During COVID and no yay bags?  Then, that first night, the battery went out on the bedroom smoke detector.  Called the front desk and they said they would send someone up within 15 minutes.  No one ever showed, and it continued to beep for almost 90 before it finally shut off.    Talked to the front desk again, about the lack of sleep and the lack of follow up.  It was an excercise in futility as the Rep didn't seem at all concerned.  Basically anytime we contacted them for ANYTHING, they seemed bored and not at all "concerned".  As a disabled person,
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel and rooms were clean. We were welcomed at the front desk and checked in quickly. We enjoyed a hot breakfast every day! We were traveling with family and they put our rooms right next to each other so we could help with grandchildren.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived at the hotel 4 adults 3 children in two rooms.  The hotel because of the Corona does not provide cleaning services except on request and asks to fill out a missing equipment form in the morning. The rooms have been prepared each room for 2 guests.  The first night we asked for blankets, towels and soaps.  It was close to midnight.  We were asked to come down to pick up alone because they have no workers. The next day we left a request for missing equipment as required.  We arrived again towards midnight.  In one room nothing was provided and in another partially.  Again the same humiliating answer even though we left a list.  In general any request for service was answered in the impossible.  Simply the team takes advantage of the corona to reduce service and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not a Place to Stay with Kids
Summary: There are several options when selecting an Embassy Suites near Disneyland— this is not the right option.   When staying near Disneyland you would want to opt for a hotel that understands families. This hotel falls short of that. After a long day at a Disney park, you may find yourself loaded down with bags and a passed out, sleeping toddler. The Front Desk staff was very friendly and explained they did not do daily housekeeping but that they had slips to fill out for whatever is needed.  Since we were traveling with our 19 year old son, I really appreciated that the bedroom had a door on it and we could separate our sleeping space.    The breakfast was great with the made to order omelets and I enjoyed not having to have that added expense of another meal out. We value your honest feedback, and will be sure to share it with our entire team so that improvements can be made to our overall guest experience.

Summary Heading: Room was clean but all else was so-so
Summary: The room was clean and quiet. However , the boxed breakfast was a stale bagel, mealy apple and just ugh. Staff acted like they were doing me a huge favor to acknowledge my existence. Can’t believe this review requires a 200 character MINIMUM.  What is this the SAT’s?
Manager Response: I'm very sorry. We are currently testing a new breakfast offering. Thank you very much for taking the time to share your feedback.

Summary: My husband and I wanted to do a few hours of shopping in Downtown Disney so we chose this hotel because of the closeness to the district. Walked into the hotel, everything clean, sanitizer right in front of the check in desk which had plexiglass shield in front of them. There were two associates at the desk, very polite...got us checked in after making sure we knew all the rules such as face masks over nose and chin every where but your room etc. We got to our room and found a sticker that attached to our door and the door way.(you had to break it to get into your room) that specified that the room had been cleaned and sanitized!  we broke the seal, went into our room and just because I'm super cautious with Covid-19  around I proceeded to sanitize everything all over again!
Manager Response: What a delight to read your terrific review from your recent stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Anaheim South! We’re excited to learn that despite the changes we have needed to make due to COVID 19, our attentive service, new cleanliness standards and proximity to Downtown Disney, left you with such a positive impression. Thank you for your rating and we are looking forward to your next visit!

Summary: I booked with Embassy Suites as I usually have a good experience with all Hilton properties. Sadly, COVID 19 is everyone’s “excuse” under the guise of safety. The manager at this property named Eduardo is a perfect example of a corporate robot who is not interested in welcoming nor taking good care of his guests. The problem I had was that I am staying for 5 nights and I requested housekeeping. He said no and pretty much too bad. He offered to move me rooms but then it is inconvenient for me. The corporate website states that housekeeping can be requested by the guest and scheduled accordingly. Eduardo wouldn’t hear of it, even when contacted by the Diamond desk on my behalf. I’ve even attached a picture containing the housekeeping policy. Now that Disneyland and most other
Manager Response: We wish to extend our sincere apologies for your poor experience, as what you have described is not at all reflective of our high standards of service. Due to the Pandemic, upper management has made the decision to temporarily discontinue our daily Housekeeping service to keep both our guests and team members safe, and we apologize for the miscommunication and the inconvenience this may have caused.  We value your feedback and will be discussing your concerns with the appropriate departments, as guest satisfaction is always our top priority. Please reach out directly to the hotel should you have any further comments. We hope to have another opportunity to regain your trust and improve your impression of us!

Summary: We needed to get away and this is our go to hotel for Disney (even if it’s just Downtown Disney). I’m very nervous about the pandemic and the employees made us feel very safe. Room and grounds were clean. Never had to share an elevator (would have waited for the next one but still it was nice to not have to) Check in was friendly, quick and painless. Only real difference was breakfast (made me sad to see it all dark and lonely every morning) and no housekeeping unless you schedule it (which I’m ok with). They hand out boxes every morning. Some mornings it’s a breakfast sandwich others it’s a breakfast burrito. Good size filling box. Definitely will be back when we need another Disney fix/getaway.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place has the rudest staff and it’s dirty /disgusting inside. Their air conditioning was broken and it was 100 degrees inside so I asked for a new room, this upset them apparently, because they kicked me out.!!! I’ve never been treated so poorly in my entire life. I’m going to be warning everyone I can not to go there because they are awful.
Manager Response: It's truly disappointing to hear about your recent experience, and we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We would like to speak with you further about your concerns in a more productive forum and ask that you reach out to the Hotel Management at the hotel directly. Guest satisfaction is our goal and we will be discussing your feedback as a team to see where improvements are needed.

Summary: The front desk staff and management of this hotel are absolutely horrendous. They are use to being able to disregard their guests because they primarily deal with tourists and convention attendees. Pre-Covid there was high demand for rooms in the area because of the proximity to Disneyland but when I arrived they charged an exorbitant fee for parking for an unsecured empty parking lot and were rude and unresponsive. They offered none of the normal services this brand normally offers. There are too many good properties available at good prices to stay at this property. When I explained at check in I was in a hurry to to make a Zoom meeting I received no response and only a blank stare. Even though all my information was on record and I should have had access to a contactless
Manager Response: We regret that your stay wasn't as you expected, and I appreciate you taking the time to share your comments. Guest satisfaction is very important to us and I apologize if that wasn't your impression. We have had to make some adjustments to our normal services due to State and Local guidance, and we apologize if that was not communicated to you prior to your stay. We also follow our local ordinance in terms of check in which requires us to request an ID and Payment to be collected on property which is meant to help protect our guests, and we apologize if this made your check in less than satisfactory.  Should you have any further questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to us directly. We hope you'll consider giving us another chance to offer you a truly exceptional getaway!

Summary: flew in just before everything closed down because of the health crisis. The staff was professional and awesome. Cant wait to return and finish our vacation. Awesome service. Will book again. Breakfast rocks
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is very clean. The complimentary breakfast in the morning is always good. I’ve been staying at this hotel since I was a child, now I am able to take my own daughter here. My favorite hotel around Disneyland!
Manager Response: Your wonderful comments made our day! What a beautiful thought that your precious memories of the Embassy Suites Anaheim South are now being shared with your daughter. Thank you for allowing us to continue to help your family enjoy special getaways and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: This is perfect for families traveling to Disneyland! But be sure to budget for paying extra for parking AND even more for the shuttle to the park! The free made to order omelettes are great- but it can get crazy down there so make sure you leave enough time to make the park right when it opens!
Manager Response: We're so glad to hear that our terrific location and delicious breakfast allowed you to enjoy a four-star visit to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South! When you book your next visit. please be sure to check our website for special value-added offers. We appreciate your wonderful review and helpful comments and we hope you'll return soon for another memorable getaway!

Summary: Great place to stay! A bit pricey but fair for the area and the service is excellent. My only quip is that I couldn’t get the WiFi to work correctly. It wasn’t a necessity to me so I didn’t ask for assistance, but just something to be aware of!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your five-star rating! We're delighted that our terrific staff made such a positive impression on you. When you return, please allow us to help you access our WiFi. We hope to welcome you back soon to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: Great, newly remodeled rooms for a great price. Convenient shuttle to Disneyland. Love the complimentary breakfast! Outstanding hotel staff - very friendly, responsive, and helpful. Have already booked our next visit.
Manager Response: Learning that we exceeded your expectations is wonderful, and we appreciate your fantastic five-star rating for the Embassy Suites Anaheim South! Thank you for the kind praise for our beautiful accommodations, handy shuttle, delicious food, and exceptional service. We're so excited to welcome you back for another memorable getaway!

Summary: We have stayed here many times before and we enjoyed the remodeled room. The staff was kind and helpful. The breakfast was good and plenty of food to choose from. We used the Disney shuttle which was very helpful.
Manager Response: How wonderful to learn that you enjoyed your recent visit, and that our beautiful accommodations, exceptional service, delicious food, and handy amenities exceeded your expectations. Thank you for the five-star rating. We'd love to welcome you back to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South for another memorable getaway!

Summary Heading: Manager extremely Sick Checking us in.
Summary: The hotel was nice and clean but my experience arriving completely ruined my stay. When we arrived a staff member was non Stop coughing walking around the lobby area and back behind the front desk. He was clearly very ill as he was sweating and his coughing fits were only seconds between. With a child who has respiratory issues I was very concerned. Not to mention this is right when a huge pandemic of a new virus is going around. What is a simple cold to someone can land my son in the er. Other parents with respiratory kids know this feeling and being this is a hotel that is a popular stay for people going to Disneyland with children  I would think the staff would have some care for people’s safety and not let their employees work when they are clearly so sick. I did speak up as
Manager Response: We take the health and safety of our employees and guests very seriously, and sincerely apologize that on this occasion you were left feeling uncomfortable due to our staff member's condition. We follow strict protocol on issues of this nature, and appreciate you bringing your experience to our attention. We will be reviewing your feedback internally with our Management Team, and ask that you reach out to us directly at the hotel if you have any further questions or concerns as we would like to assist in any way possible. We thank you for your time, and hope that you will allow us the opportunity to restore your trust by making the remainder of your stay a more enjoyable, seamless experience.

Summary: Room wasn’t ready when we arrived, shower was awful, intermittent scalding hot to ice cold, stains on the comforters, minimal cleaning done when room serviced during stay, LOUD construction 8:30-5 every weekday, with no mention at booking or on website. Staff was extremely unhelpful and offered little to no customer service. With all of the problems, all we asked for was to leave one hour past check out, which was scoffed at by front desk personnel. As Hilton Diamond members, we expect more. Definitely will not be returning to this hotel.
Manager Response: It is disheartening to learn that several aspects of your recent stay fell short of your expectations. We would like to sincerely apologize for the difficulties you encountered with your guest room's shower and for the lapses in housekeeping you mentioned, as what you have described is not reflective of our high standards for cleanliness and comfort. We also regret that you dealt with noise disturbance, as we strive to keep noise levels within the hotel to a minimum so our guests can enjoy a restful stay. We value your honest feedback, and will be sure to share it with our entire team so that improvements can be made to our overall guest experience. We hope that you will allow us the opportunity to restore your confidence with a future visit that is seamless from start to finish!

Summary Heading: Overpriced, Loud Elevator Noises, Bedroom Door Would Not Shut
Summary: We booked directly with the hotel because their description was two rooms and a booking site said one room, the direct booking was much more expensive (we thought because it had two bedrooms), turned out it was the same room type just more expensive.  The bedroom door wouldn't close, the door rubbed in the frame.  The elevator noise was too much and could be heard in the bedroom every time the elevator moved.  The parking fee seems unreasonable, especially considering the very tiny and limited parking spots.  The hotel shuttle is not free to the parks.  I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: It is truly disappointing to learn that your recent visit with us fell short of your expectations. We would like to clarify that the room you booked was our upgraded larger king suite, the room available on the third-party site is our standard suite. We regret if this wasn't communicated with you. Your feedback will be discussed internally to ensure any concerns are addressed, as complete guest satisfaction is always our goal. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and hope to have another opportunity to improve your impression of us!

Summary: Issues after issues.  Room keys did not work first time. Went down to get them programmed again. Only one key worked after 2 trips to front desk. Called hotel before making reservation if the pool is heated and they said yes it is. During the stay went to the pool and turns out it wasn't heated. Elevators broke down during stay causing delays. Water was turned off for a half a day. Dryer in the laundry area wasn't working properly. Breakfast was terrible quality. Thought made to order would be a good one to have but only if they could use better ingredients. Worse quality than motel 6.
Manager Response: It's truly disappointing to hear about your recent experience, and I appreciate you bringing this to my attention. I would like to speak with you further about your concerns in a more productive forum and ask that you reach out to me at the hotel. Guest satisfaction is our goal and we will be discussing your feedback as a team to see where improvements are needed. We hope you'll allow us another chance to leave you with a better impression!

Summary: This hotel is very clean and undergoing a renovation which did not impact my stay at all.  Location is great for the convention center, short 5-7 minute walk.  Staff was friendly, breakfast was excellent as always for an Embassy Suites.  Really enjoyed my stay.
Manager Response: Robert, your review for the Embassy Suites Anaheim South had made our day! Thank you for letting us know that you were pleased with our terrific location, delicious dining, and helpful service. We appreciate your five-star rating and we'd love to welcome you back anytime!

Summary: We stayed here for one night due to having an extra night we needed a hotel for; we had an underwhelming previous stay here in 2018 but due to us enjoying Embassy Suites in the past we wanted to give them another chance.  Unfortunately our experience wasn’t great, and in fact was probably the most inconvenient it could have been for a single night stay.  We had a regular one bedroom king suite, booked well in advance. When we arrived in the room it was clear that the air conditioning was broken and blowing hot air. We immediately informed the front desk who said they would send maintenance. As it was our first night in the area we went to the supermarket in the hope that it would be fixed upon return.  When we returned around an hour later, maintenance hadn’t been, so we called
Manager Response: Wayne, I'm dismayed to read that your recent stay fell short of the high standards for which we aim, and I appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns with me, I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you in a more productive forum and ask that you reach out to me directly at the hotel so I can learn more details of your visit. Regarding the deposit, upon checkout, the funds are released by the hotel and it may take your bank a short time to complete the function on their end. As a team, we will be reviewing your feedback to ensure that these items are addressed going forward, as complete guest satisfaction is always our goal. We hope you'll consider giving us another chance in the future to offer you the exceptional experience our guests have come to expect from us!

Summary: Great stay at a great property. Room renovations did not impact stay at all. Room was clean and well appointed, staff was extremely friendly and food was fantastic. Next time in town, I will surely be back. Thanks Embassy team!
Manager Response: How wonderful to read your terrific comments about your recent stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South! We're thrilled to know that our beautiful accommodations, helpful service, and delicious cuisine impressed you. It's our pleasure to offer our guests a five-star stay and we can't wait to welcome you back for another memorable getaway!

Summary: booked this hotel because of the proximity to Disneyland. The shuttles were run down and noisy but it beat walking each way.  The room was clean and we slept well each night. A fan in the bathroom would be a great addition since it fills with steam very quickly
Manager Response: Sandra, it's terrific to learn that our wonderful location and handy shuttles allowed you to enjoy a fun vacation. We're glad, too, to hear that our restful accommodations pleased you. Thanks for the feedback about the bathroom, and we hope you'll visit us again soon at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: Hot water shoddy, but renovated room nice. lot's of plugs, nice furnishings. AC didn't work so well. Front desk is manned by automatons, not friendly efficient problem solvers, very transactional in nature and make you feel like you are an impediment to their processes.
Manager Response: While I'm thrilled that you appreciated the comfort and convenience of your freshly renovated guest room, I sincerely apologize that the service you received from our front desk staff fell short of your expectations. We aim to provide friendly, helpful service at every opportunity, and I will be addressing your feedback with our team to ensure that those standards are being met consistently. We hope that you will return soon to enjoy a much-improved experience!

Summary Heading: Noisy Elevator at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South
Summary: Staff didn't give a rip when I twice asked if something could be done about one of the elevators making a loud noise throughout the night. This went on for 5 nights with nothing done about it. I even asked if they could shut down the noise elevator after 11pm, they didn't. The hotel was booked solid, so they didn't care even though there were other guests that reported the noisy elevator.
Manager Response: We regret that your stay wasn't as restful as we would hope, and I appreciate you taking the time to share your comments. Guest satisfaction is very important to us and I apologize if that wasn't your impression. Please reach out to me directly at the hotel, as I'd like to learn more about your concerns. We hope you'll consider giving us another chance to offer you a truly exceptional getaway!

Summary: Nice suite at a great price. Near everything. Staff was courteous an on point. Room was clean. Complimentary breakfast was better than expected. My daughter enjoyed the animatronic lion and fish in the pond made our experience tranquil.
Manager Response: It's a thrill to read your wonderful review, and we're so excited to learn that you enjoyed your recent stay. Thank you for your terrific praise for our beautiful accommodations, convenient location, attentive service, and delicious food. We're glad our unique lobby made such a positive impression and we hope you'll visit us again soon at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: We love the Embassy Suites! The rooms are very large with beds for 6 people, however, I do wish the beds were Queen size instead of full. The complementary breakfast (cook to order omelets!) is wonderful and the evening reception had some good snacks for the kids. It's a bit far for walking to Disneyland, however, they offer a shuttle for a fee. Very clean and spacious!
Manager Response: We love your review! Thank you for taking the time to let us know that our delicious breakfast, spacious accommodations, and helpful shuttle allowed you to enjoy a five-star experience. We appreciate your five-star rating for the Embassy Suites Anaheim South and we hope you'll be back soon for another memorable getaway!

Summary: We as a family love this hotel.  We have been going here for over 10 years now.  They just finished refurbishing the rooms so they are beautiful and new.  The breakfast in the morning is amazing.  It fills us before our trip to Disneyland so we only have to do one meal there.  Can't say enough good about the friendly staff... Very helpful and kind.
Manager Response: Seeing families enjoy themselves and make lasting memories is a great thrill for us, and we appreciate your wonderful five-star review for the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. Thank you for sharing your lovely praise for our beautiful accommodations, hearty breakfast, and exceptional staff, too. We all hope you'll be back soon for another memorable getaway!

Summary: Great value, good shuttle service and if you enjoy breakfast and cocktails, this is the best spot around for overall value. Plenty of restaurants and stores around the property as well for last minute shopping etc.
Manager Response: We're so excited to hear that you were pleased with your stay and that our terrific value, handy location, and helpful amenities allowed you to enjoy a five-star experience. Thank you for your wonderful review and we hope you'll visit us again soon at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: Location very close to Disneyland with a shuttle to the park when you stay here. Attend a conference and experienced the beautiful property, staff, excellent location to shopping and restaurants. Food for event was catered it was fabulous breakfast and especially the buffet lunch were over the top. Plenty of parking for the conference & hotel guests I parked by the pool (was jealous of the people enjoying it). Wonderful Southern Cali location and weather. Will return when out of state family come for spring break & Disneyland so we can enjoy the property and stay in their rooms
Manager Response: We're so glad you were able to enjoy our beautiful hotel when you visited the Embassy Suites Anaheim South for your conference. Thank you for letting us know that our terrific staff and delicious cuisine exceeded your expectations! We, too, wish you could have relaxed by our beautiful pool and it will be our pleasure to welcome you back when your guests come to town!

Summary: The hotel staff are very helpful. The room cleanliness needs some work as our bedsheets were dirty. I like the atmosphere the hotel provides. The breakfast is always good with lots of variety.   The shuttle to Disneyland is a plus.
Manager Response: We're thrilled to hear that our exceptional staff, welcoming ambiance, delicious food, and handy shuttle allowed you to enjoy a memorable getaway at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South! I will share your feedback with housekeeping, so we can be sure your concerns are addressed. Please come back soon so we can work to earn that fifth star!

Summary: Favorite Disney Hotel that never disappoints! Beautiful open design. Staff is always friendly and helpful. The free breakfast buffet and the complementary evening cocktail gathering are welcome bonuses!
Manager Response: How wonderful to read your terrific review, Mark! Thank you for letting us know that our stunning lobby, attentive service, delicious food, and exceptional value continue to exceed your expectations. We're humbled to have earned the honor of being your favorite hotel in the area, and we're looking forward to welcoming you back soon to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: All the staff was very friendly,  nice clean quiet rooms, with comfortable beds and a excellent free breakfast to start each day .  Myrna and Alex who staffed the happy hour made us feel like we have been coming there for years. They were really nice people and I hope that the management recognizes their exceptional customer service.
Manager Response: Our staff is truly passionate about providing excellent service, and we are always delighted when a guest offers such wonderful praise. I will share your feedback with Myrna and Alex, as I know they will be elated to hear that their efforts were appreciated! It's also terrific to know that our relaxing accommodations exceeded your expectations. Thank you for your five-star review of the Embassy Suites Anaheim South and we hope you'll be back soon for another memorable getaway!

Summary Heading: An Enhanced First Visit to Disneyland
Summary: We chose Embassy Suites because we've never had a bad experience and we had a great deal with our AAA Membership. This hotel met expectations and then some. The staff really helped us enjoy our first visit to Disneyland. The shuttle really helped with transportation and the complimentary breakfast helped us save some money on Park food. We will be staying here for all future visits.
Manager Response: Ashlee, what a delight to read your terrific review from your recent stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South! We’re excited to learn that our attentive service, helpful shuttle, and unbeatable value left you with such a positive impression, and we’re honored to have been chosen to host your first Disneyland vacation. Thank you for your five-star rating and we are looking forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: For the money best value in the area
Summary: I have been going to the NAMM show for over a decade and always stayed a little closer. This year I decided to try this hotel. Even though it was a little farther from the conference center it was worth it in every way. My breakfast was included, complimentary happy hour, bigger rooms and friendlier staff. My new hotel every year.
Manager Response: Fred, your wonderful review of the Embassy Suites Anaheim South is music to our ears! We're so excited to learn that you allowed us to host you this year for the show and that our spacious accommodations, exceptional service, terrific value, and delicious food exceeded your expectations. When you share your terrific praise with us, you're singing our song! We're already looking forward to next year, and welcoming you back for another relaxing stay!

Summary: Have stayed here more than once. Clean, great value, great staff, great breakfast, great location. Very relaxing to come back to after a very long day in Disneyland or California Adventure, or both! Minutes away!
Manager Response: Returning guests are very special to us and we're so excited to hear that our beautiful accommodations, wonderful service, convenient location, and delicious food continue to exceed your expectations. We can't wait to welcome you back to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South again soon!

Summary: First time at this property. Stayed at the other Embassy North. That was a great stay. This one was ok. This was a family hotel with alot of kids. Breakfast was fine. Staff not friendly serving food. Front desk was ok. Again catering to the disneyland people. Will stay in the north again.
Manager Response: While it's wonderful to know that you enjoyed a four-star stay and that our delicious breakfast pleased you, it's disappointing to hear that other aspects failed to exceed your expectations. We appreciate the feedback and we'd love to have another chance to offer you a five-star experience at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary Heading: Nice family-friendly hotel; watch out for resort fee
Summary: My family has stayed at this hotel many times over the last decade and it is very convenient to Disneyland.  The shuttle costs on;y $6/pp but runs every half-hour and is generally on-time based on our experience.  Like most Embassy Suites, the breakfast is good and all you can eat so it's good for families.  The omelette cook kept the line down adn the front desk staff were attentive.  On receiving my bill, I noticed a charge labelled as "Suite tax" on my bill (14.5% of the room charge) and thought it was odd that some tax authority had a special tax for suites.  I asked the front desk and they admitted this "tax" was retained by the hotel, effectively a resort fee as they indicated many local hotels charged.  I checked a future reservation I had at this hotel and noticed this
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to share your wonderful comments. We're thrilled that our helpful shuttle allowed you to come and go easily, and that our hearty breakfast helped get your days off to a great start. However, we are disappointed that our staff failed to explain our "suite tax" correctly and I apologize for any confusion. We do not charge a resort fee or a higher tax based on room type. This is an Occupancy Tax and the amount is determined by the city. This is an industry-standard and our team should have communicated this with you better. We hope this will not detract you from visiting us again as we'd love to welcome you back to Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay with family
Summary: I’ve stayed at Embassy before and I love their accommodations. We visited to go to Disneyland for a few days. They have a complementary breakfast, a heated pool and waking distance to restaurants. The staff was as amazing and friendly
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty and for taking the time to share your wonderful review! We're excited to hear that our terrific value, delicious food, fun amenities, unparalleled service, and handy location continue to exceed your expectations. We appreciate your five-star rating and would love to welcome you back soon for another memorable getaway at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: Warm reception, great complimentary breakfast.  Nice evening reception with complimentary drinks and snacks.  There is a Disney concierge desk to help with any questions or concerns, they were very helpful. The shuttle to Disney was a nice and convenient experience as well. An overall Great Experience!
Manager Response: How exciting to hear that your visit with us allowed you to relax and enjoy our terrific location, delicious food, attentive service, and wonderful value. Thanks so much for sharing your lovely praise and we'd love to welcome you back to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South anytime for another memorable getaway!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Had stayed at this property 5 years ago and it was getting "tired" but service and location brought me back. I was pleasantly surprised that the rooms were updated (at least ours was on the 12th floor but apparently they are not finished all floors yet). The staff were all very accommodating and friendly, the breakfast was very good and well stocked even though they were very busy. Guest room was very modern with updated furnishings. Was very quiet with no disturbances.
Manager Response: We're so excited to learn that you were so impressed by our terrific staff and wonderful setting that you allowed us to host you again! Thanks for taking the time to share your comments. It's great to hear that our beautiful guestroom refresh pleased you and that our staff continue to exceed your expectations. We appreciate your kind praise for our delicious breakfast, too! Please come back soon to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: This is a great place for large families and groups. The rooms are very spacious, clean,  and comfortable. Breakfast is included, and the shuttle to Disneyland picks you up right out front. Everything is very convenient.
Manager Response: We want to thank you for taking the time to share your wonderful and helpful review of the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. It's terrific to hear that our spacious accommodations, delicious food, terrific value, and helpful amenities exceeded your expectations. We'd love to welcome you back soon for another memorable getaway!

Summary: Very good location because there is a shuttle stop on premises.  The configuration of the suites works out well for a whole family to stay comfortably.  The breakfast is convenient for quickly getting to Disneyland early.
Manager Response: We're always excited when a family allows us to host them for an exciting vacation, and it's wonderful to learn that our spacious accommodations, handy breakfast, and helpful shuttle exceeded your expectations. Thank you for the five-star rating for the Embassy Suites Anaheim South and we hope to welcome you back soon for another memorable getaway!

Summary: Friendly; easy access to the freeway. Nice staff. Gym needs to be expanded though. Overall this hotel is a very value -- the manager's receiption is a nice added touch and their omlette bar for breakfast is terrific!
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us to serve you, and for taking the time to share your wonderful review. We're thrilled that you enjoyed our handy location, terrific value, delicious food, and friendly service. Your feedback about the fitness center is appreciated, and I will pass along your comments to the team. Our goal is to offer our guests a five-star stay, and we hope you'll be back again soon to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South for another exceptional visit!

Summary: The room was right across from the elevators, I was using my 70,000 points for a night stay and we got to hear the elevators all night long.  Bacon was really awful at breakfast.  Not a bad hotel, just did not live up to my expectations.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent stay. I regret that your experience fell short of the five-star standards we aim for, and I will pass along your feedback to the team so we can be sure your concerns are addressed. We hope you'll visit again soon so we can work to earn another star or two!

Summary: Staff was rude. This place is overpriced and the least they could’ve done is been nice to our family during our stay. Won’t stay here again. Location is good since it’s close to Disneyland parks but honestly wouldn’t recommend it here.
Manager Response: I am dismayed to hear that, despite our terrific location, your stay fell short of our high standards. Please reach out to me directly at the hotel so I can learn more about your concerns. Guest satisfaction is our priority and we hope to have another chance to improve your impression of us!

Summary Heading: Location was okay but other hotel are closer and this hotel is out dated
Summary: You do have to pay a parking fee and the shuttle they provide is 6 dollar each way to Disney land and there is other hotel closer to Disneyland and food restaurants .. this hotel lobby is nice but rooms are out dated
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. While it's wonderful that our beautiful entrance pleased you, I regret that other aspects of your stay failed to meet your expectations. We hope you'll return once our exciting guestroom refresh is complete!

Summary: Customers service is not a priority... Family trip to Disneyland and last trip. Go spend your money and find out and add 20 a day for far parking. You pass to many hotels, with better service and cleaner rooms.
Manager Response: It is disappointing to read that your experience with us fell short of the five-star standards we aim for. I would love to speak with you further about your concerns and ask that you reach out to me at the hotel. We hope to have another chance to change your impression of us!

Summary: During our stay there was a fire and the PA system did not work and no one notified us to evacuate. It wasn't until we heard fire trucks and saw people standing outside that we evacuated room. We could not hear the fire alarm in our room or any announcement if there were any. Once outside, no one from the hotel told us it was safe to go back into the hotel. The hotel staff had no idea how to handle this emergency situation and it was a concern for our family's safety. Thankfully we were ok but the hotel needs updating to their fire alarm and PA system and training for the hotel staff to know what to do in these type of situations.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention. When emergencies occur, it can be frightening and disconcerting, but I want to assure you that our systems are fully compliant with local requirements and our staff participates in regular training on the policies and procedures. Guest safety is our utmost priority and we, too, are thankful that the issue was resolved quickly and without further incident. If you would like to speak with me directly about your concerns, I encourage you to reach out to me at the hotel. We hope you'll allow us to welcome you back for a relaxing getaway that is reflective of our typical five-star standards!

Summary: There was a fire in one of the suites and no one in the hotel knew what to do or evacuated anyone.   When we were finally evacuated by neighbors we stayed outside and no one let us know when to go back in had to figure all this out ourselves. This hotel needs to be and what to do in these type of situations Especially when traveling with your family you should feel safe
Manager Response: Please be assured that the safety and security of our guests is always our priority and our staff participates in regular training on hotel policies and procedures in case of emergencies. I apologize for the inconvenience and confusion, and I would welcome the chance to speak with you directly about your concerns. Please reach out to me at the hotel. We would love to have another chance to offer you a truly relaxing, hassle-free getaway!

Summary Heading: Don't ask to use the luggage racks
Summary: Upon checking in my wife had the luggage cart ripped out of her hands as a staff member told her "this is mine".  There we no offer of another cart of option to get out luggage to the room.  They were very unkind and not helpful.
Manager Response: Caring for our guests is our top priority, and I am dismayed to hear that you experienced an unusual lapse in our typical warm hospitality. I would like to hear more about your experience and ask that you reach out to me directly at the hotel. we hope that you'll allow us another chance to restore your faith in us!

Summary: Please wait to stay here until they are done with the updates. Parking is horrible and our room was falling apart.It was certainly clean and they feel is very nice. The bell staff was freindly but they were the only people that engaged with us.
Manager Response: I regret that your stay fell short of the five-star experience we aim for. I would appreciate the chance to speak with you about your concerns and encourage you to reach out to me directly at the hotel. We'd love another opportunity to show you the exceptional hospitality for which we're known!

Summary: This is our go to hotel when we visit Disney, and we visit Disney A LOT. Breakfast is the best around, especially if you have kids. We had a king corner room, so much space. Only issue is parking, it's $30 a night and their parking lot seems to be shrinking and it can take a while to get a spot.  If you find a good one don't leave it.
Manager Response: Val, it's a special thrill for us to welcome returning guests back to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South and we're elated to know that our delicious food, spacious accommodations, and terrific location continue to exceed your expectations. Thank you for sharing your fantastic five-star review and we are already looking forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary Heading: Nice BUT has so much more potential.
Summary: Tis location is nice BUT has so much more potential. Especially in the common area with the waterfall . Mre couches, lounge chairs. Comfortable seating with cocktail tables.Hope to see improvements the next visit.
Manager Response: While it's wonderful to know that our terrific location pleased you, we regret that we were unable to win you over completely. Thank you for sharing your feedback and we hope you'll allow us another chance to leave you with a better impression!

Summary: Special kudos to Alex, Antonio, and Myrna at the hosted evening reception.Extreme friendly, courteous, and helpful. They collectively are great. Also the staff at check in were fantastic and extremely helpful.
Manager Response: The best praise we can receive is for our exceptional staff, and we are elated to know that you felt well-cared-for. I am eager to share your comments with the team, especially Alex, Antonio, and Myrna, and we are all hoping to welcome you back soon to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: Stayed many times at this Hotel.We know about the remodel but it never bothered us at all.. Our room was not ready.. We had to wait not long John the Front Desk Manager was terrific. helped us with parking and food at the Hotel due to room not ready.. Super great customer service.. Pauly and Godwill are so great.. Helped us with our bags since my wife had recent foot surgery.. Omelet Chef is amazing, hot breakfast is so good.. We love staying here.. Thanks John, Pauly and Godwill
Manager Response: How wonderful to hear that you enjoyed your visit and that our exceptional staff and delicious food exceeded your expectations. Our team enjoys finding special ways to care for our guests. I will be sure to pass along your compliments to John, Pauly, and Godwill, and we all hope to welcome you back soon to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South!

Summary: Very nice place to stay. Check in time for us was at 430pm. when rooms were ready. Rooms were very clean. Shuttle was a little expensive to Disney plus parking at hotel was 20 a night.  Breakfast was amazing cocktail hour food was ok
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful feedback for the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. It's wonderful to hear that our spacious, sparkling accommodations and delicious food stood out as highlights of your stay, though we regret that the shuttle and parking services fell short of your expectations. We appreciate your five-star rating and would love to welcome you back anytime for another memorable visit!

Summary: Great hotel.  Clean, comfortable, good breakfast choices, close to Disney if driving.  Close to other Orange County attractions including beaches and Knotts Berry Farm.  Would definitely stay here again in the future.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to let others know about your wonderful stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. We're thrilled to hear that our handy location, beautiful accommodations, and delicious dining exceeded your expectations. Please visit again soon!

Summary Heading: Okay for a Family Budget ... but run down
Summary: Very surprised to see how much the hotel has been run down.  Everything is out dated, warned down, and the staff is not very friendly.  But for a cheap hotel for an entire family, it may just do the trick.  Feel free to check in online, but you'll still need to go to the front desk to provide your credit card ... so what's the use?
Manager Response: Although it's great to know that our terrific value was a plus, it's disappointing to hear that other aspects of your stay failed to meet your expectations. I will share your feedback with the team and we hope you'll visit again when our exciting guestroom refresh is complete. Please allow us to welcome you back soon!

Summary: Hard to believe that this is a Hilton property, as it does not reflect their typically good hotels.   My first stay here was 15 years ago. It was great then, Sadly, the decor is still the same.    The things that did change -- parking is $20, taking the shuttle to Disney is $6 and the food and drink are much worse than before.
