We love that you enjoyed the perks of using the HHonors app as well as our proximity to all area attractions. Thank you for sharing your experience, we certainly hope to welcome you back for another great stay soon.

Summary: The location of the hotel and the price during convention time make this an excellent choice for business. Of course, there is the expected family traffic especially in the morning and dinner time created by the Disney properties. The shuttle services were available, but not quite dependable during this stay, but cabs were always available. It's a clean hotel and the rooms are comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback from your recent stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. We are conveniently located near many area attractions, including the Anaheim Convention Center. While many choose other forms of transportation, we offer direct, on-site shuttle service as you mentioned. It is regrettable if you encountered any delay, however. We hope you'll consider another stay during your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: I've always loved this hotel, a favorite of ours while visiting Disneyland. Cleanliness, food and complimentary reception-not to mention some really great restaurants nearby. Always first on our list-
Manager Response: How wonderful to read that you enjoyed the clean accommodations you expected during your family trip to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. It was the pleasure of our entire team to ensure you enjoyed your stay and appreciate that you took the time to mention our evening Manager’s Reception. We are honored to be your preferred hotel for future Disneyland vacations and hope we get to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: Wonderful stay.  Excellent customer service, rooms, pool,weight room are well maintained and clean.  The breakfast buffet offers a variety of food.  Great value especially if you are going to Disney for the day.  Our teenaged sons had a blast at the pool and workout room.  The shuttle to disneyland is  a plus only $20. round trip.  Drops you off by the front gate.  Will stay there again.
Manager Response: It was our pleasure to welcome you while you were in Anaheim and provide you and your family with a comfortable, enjoyable guest experience at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. Thank you for sharing all that you found pleasing at our property, including our breakfast buffet, convenient location and shuttle service. We hope to welcome you back next time you’re headed to Disneyland.

Summary: At a recent trade show in Anaheim this was the option we chose ,a good walk- 10 mins to the convention centre each day - .Good accommodation .Breakfast not superb but ok . internt slow but usable - overall ok
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing about your recent stay. It was our pleasure to provide you with spacious accommodations while you were in town for a trade show at the nearby Anaheim Convention Center. We’re thrilled you found our location to be convenient. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South.

Summary: I recently stayed here for a convention. Stayed 4 nites. Room was very comfortable and fairly quiet...complimentary breakfast and "reception"...was not great but did the htrick. The staff was very very friendly and helpful!
Manager Response: Knowing you enjoyed a great stay with us at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South is a huge compliment, thank you.  The convention center is just a short distance from our from door and our location is perfect for any events.  As you mentioned, we feature complimentary breakfast as well as a nightly Manager’s Reception.  If there is ever anything you may need while staying, our associates are happy to assist.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel. Front desk Service needs improvement
Summary: I stayed here on January 26th. The room was great and most staff were very helpful. However, the front staff was unable solve my room tax waiver request although I was staying on the government rate for a meeting nearby. I won't be able to stay here again on government business's because of this.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing impressions of your stay with us.  We are glad you found your overall experience to be positive, but we must apologize if you encountered any billing issues.  Please know that our billing department can help and we urge you to reach out directly to resolve any outstanding concerns.  We hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Right around the corner from Disney
Summary: Enjoy a two room suite and a complimentary breakfast before heading over to Disneyland. VERY convenient to the Convention Center as well.  Suites and large and clean.  The hotel has a great staff- on their toes and helpful. I was on a business trip and there must be something truly magical about Disney- all the children were very well-behaved.
Manager Response: Convenient to all of the area attractions, helpful service and comfortable accommodations.  We are delighted that your stay with us was such a positive experience.  Whether here for business or leisure, we hope to ensure that each guest enjoys what we have to offer, including our complimentary breakfast to send you on the way each morning.  Disneyland is truly a magical place and we hope you get the chance to enjoy it someday. We would love to welcome you again to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South.

Summary: Fire alarm & 2 am first night. Loud party booked in conf room until early morning. Bed bugs on pullout bed; my son was covered in bites. No attempt to resolve or rectify issues. Terrible stay. Terrible hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for reaching out to us and for sharing your perspective. We strive to ensure that our guests’ stay exceeds expectations and deeply regret that that any aspect of your encounter was not completely positive.  Please know that the cleanliness of our hotel it is taken very seriously by all members of our staff. If any report is made, we have strict protocols in place that are quickly implemented to verify and resolve any concern.  Even though no reports were made and upon further investigation after reading your review, we have no record of any pest issues.  Please know that we would like to gain more insight and ask that you reach out to us.  We value your patronage.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel central to Disneyland
Summary: As grandparents we took our son, his wife, and their 2 children, ages 7 and 9, to Disneyland for 4 days.  We chose this hotel because of proximity to Disneyland, suites instead of regular rooms, easy and inexpensive transportation to the parks, complimentary hot breakfast, and reputation.  It was a WISE choice and we were not disappointed in anything EXCEPT the speed of the elevators.  We wanted one of our rooms to be a fireworks view since we knew the kids wouldn't last that long in the park all of the days.  Problem was that there were NO FIREWORKS on 3 of our 5 nights there!!!  Not the hotels fault but after paying extra for the room it was a huge disappointment.  If I had it all to do over again I'd choose rooms on a lower floor so I could use the stairs instead of time
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed an overall positive stay with us at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South for your getaway.  Disneyland is one of the greatest destinations and our location makes getting to the park easy while our many amenities add true value to any family’s stay.  The daily fireworks display as seen from our windows can be a treat, but we regret if you were disappointed a few nights that were missed or if you were inconvenienced in using our elevator.  As a Disneyland Good Neighbor Hotel, we strive to help our guests with whatever they need to enjoy the theme park, but we must apologize if you found the service lacking in any way.  We do hope that if there is ever anything you need while staying, you will let us know so we can make your time with us even better.  Thank you for sharing your comments.

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights to visit Disneyland. We had a room on a high floor with firework views. Unfortunately it rained and there were no fireworks, but still it was a great view.  Free breakfast and free 2 hour evening reception where drinks and snacks are free from 5 till 7. The gym was good, there is a business centre for checking emails and printing.  Tickets for Disney are available in the foyer and there is a shuttle bus for a small fee. Parking is $8 or $10 per night. There are plenty of places a short walk away for food. We caught a taxi to the Ducks NHL game and back. It was fairly close and only cost a few dollars.  I would definitely stay here again. It was convenient, quiet, and had everything we required. Good value.
Manager Response: It is so great to know you appreciated both convenience and value when staying with us at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South.  Disneyland is such an amazing attraction and we are proud to offer our guests family-friendly accommodations so close to the park.  As you have mentioned, we feature complimentary breakfast dining as well as a Manager’s Reception with snacks and beverages to end your day.  Our Disney Desk provides one stop shopping for Disney related information and tickets.  Your review sounds like you had the ideal getaway in the area! We look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: We recently visited for six nights on a vacation. Here’s what we liked about it: * Upon check-in you get a goody bag with candy bar, pretzels, and bottled water  * The suites are large and have nice lighting * There’s a separate bedroom with a full-size mirror on the bedroom door with a bright light for putting on makeup, a big makeup table and mirror with a cushioned chair for putting on makeup, and a wardrobe and dresser for your clothes * There’s a bar outside of the bathroom with ample counter space, a sink, microwave and a fridge (tough to find both in hotels now!) * The living room and dining room has a big dining table with four chairs, a comfortable couch and chair  * Nice view with large picture window in the bedroom * The bathroom is spacious with lots of counter space
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share such a comprehensive review of your time with us.  We are delighted to know you enjoyed so many aspects of your stay, including our well-appointed suite accommodations. It is our hope to provide our guests with a relaxing time filled with conveniences. With that being said, we regret if some aspects of your encounter were not more to your liking or if you experienced any inconveniences.  Despite how many guests stay, we hope to provide full service to all, but we do apologize if you faced any delays or maintenance issues.  Your comments will be shared with everyone.  It is our hope that you will consider another visit.

Summary Heading: Don't look for an upscale experience
Summary: The all-suite hotel experience was supposed to be the highlight of this stay. However, my suite was disappointing: the living room overlooked the internal side of the hotel (same for all -- there is no light) and looks definitely unattractive (brown, chalet-style tones)  The bathroom featured very standard equipment and the ventilation was incredibly noisy.   Expect an army-style breakfast. This is a  self-service buffet that gets incredibly busy (expect queues) after 8AM. For 3 days in a row the available food was cold (bacon, sausages, eggs). You will help yourself through giant containers of milk, cereals, and you will eat in coloured / plastic bowls and dishes.  The internet connection (for a fee) was unreliable and all my colleagues experienced the same issue. I was able to
Manager Response: All guest feedback, positive or otherwise is truly appreciated.  Please accept our sincere apology if our hotel was not as you had expected or if you encountered any issues with Internet connectivity.  Our guests are always encouraged to share any concerns at the time of their stay and it certainly seems as if we missed the opportunity to provide you with the best possible encounter. We will be certain our team is made aware of your comments as we are always seeking ways to improve. Thank you.

Summary: I really like embassy suites, i remember my parents would do staycations when we were little to an embassy suites near us. This particular location is rather small and does not offer an indoor pool like most locations.   The complimentry breakfast was sub par and left much to be desired. The "free" coctail hour was cool but the drinks were not very good. It is much more worth it to head to target one block over and pick up some boos and snacks.  The rooms were very nice and the cleaning was always done on time and every day. I really dont have any complaints about the room or service.  They offer a shuttle that operates every half an hour on the 15 and 45 from the hotel and on the 00 and 30 from the park. If i remember correctly it was $5 bucks for adults and $3 for children for
Manager Response: It is nice to know that our brand has been part of many childhood memories! We are here to provide the best possible guest room accommodations and service while staying with us in Anaheim. As you mentioned, we offer the convenience of shuttle service to and from Disneyland. Our complimentary breakfast dining as well as our Manager’s Reception in the evening is designed to start and end your day in the best possible way, but we regret if you did not enjoy our all of our choices.  We hope to welcome you back again, thank you for sharing your review.

Summary: If you do not want to have a surprise do not cahs pay for the shuttle because they are going to charge it to your room even if you already have payed for it, even if your bill is in $0 after the trip you will realize that they will charge for this in your credit card.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your concerns.  As you mentioned, there is a nominal fee for utilizing our shuttle service.  We regret any confusion and want to thank you for allowing our associates to resolve this for you during your time here. If we can help in any additional way, please feel free to reach out. It is our hope that you will stay with us again.

Summary: This was one of the better Embassy Suites I have stayed at. The staff was very helpful, I had a few packages sent and they easily handled them and helped me out taking them to the room. There are complimentary breakfasts every morning and free drinks at happy hour 5-6pm. The location couldn't have been any better. If you want to get away from the Disneyland bustle but remain within distance, this hotel is the perfect choice. About a mile walking distance to Disneyland but they have shuttles going there about every 30 minutes or so.   The rooms where very comfy, the bed was very soft and cozy and the bathrooms were clean and up to date. I highly suggest this hotel if you are staying in the Anaheim area
Manager Response: We love that you find the location of the Embassy Suites Anaheim South to be the perfect choice when visiting the area. Thank you so much for sharing all that you enjoy, from our comfortable guest room accommodations to the service you encountered.  We feature many amenities to make sure that our guests are treated to the very best, all the way to a complimentary breakfast buffet in the morning.  Our location is just minutes from Disneyland and we feature shuttle service for your convenience. We hope you plan to come back and stay again soon as it would be our pleasure to welcome you.

Summary: Visiting Anaheim for a trade show and picked this hotel for it's location, Rooms was very nice, Bed was amazing, Super quiet, Lobby and Atrium very well kept. The gym and pool area were also very nice. Happy Hour, Breakfast all included. Close to Disney too, if your there for that!
Manager Response: Our location is perfect for all visits to the Anaheim Convention Center as well as the area theme park attractions! It is our pleasure to welcome you, business or leisure to our hotel.  We are so glad you enjoyed our comfortable, peaceful accommodations as well as our gym and pool areas.  From Happy Hour to Breakfast, we realize that dining is an important part of any time away from home.  We would love to see you again at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South.

Summary Heading: Very comfy, great breakfast, excellent maid service
Summary: We had a very nice visit to this hotel. The room was large, clean & comfy. Easy parking. Excellent breakfast buffet w/omelete station. Excellent maid service. This hotel was no more than a 3-5 minute drive to the Disneyland entrance, which was very convenient. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: The Embassy Suites Anaheim South is the closest Embassy Suites hotel to Disneyland! We are truly grateful to know you valued your stay so highly and that it inspired you to share your kind feedback.  Our associates work hard to ensure that each aspect of a guest’s encounter is fulfilling and we will share your comments with our team.  We hope your return visit is soon.  Thank you.

Summary: The pro of the hotel was the price $120.00 a night. The con, far from Disneyland. $5.00 per person per day for shuttle service. The wait for shuttle seemed long. Room was large and clean. Would stay there again.  Full breakfast buffet. Great coffee
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your appreciation for the value you found at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. We are delighted to know that your encounter here would prompt another visit.  Fueling for a full day of exploring the Disneyland Resort attractions is so important and our breakfast options with fresh coffee are designed for just that.  We do regret, however, if you were inconvenienced while waiting for our shuttle.  As you have mentioned, we do charge a nominal fee for the service and it is available every 30 minutes.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back again.

Summary: Good Place to stay while visiting the "Happiest Place on Earth". The prepared breakfast made for an easy transition to the Disneyland experience. The Shuttle to the Park was also quite convenient, in fact my kids (Ages 19, 22) went back to the hotel for a quick swim midday.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just recently went on a family vacation to Disneyland. December 28th to January 4th. We go approx. every 2 years, and we always stay at Embassy Suites. As a family of 5, it is tough to find a hotel in the area that can accommodate. The staff is always friendly. They offer an outstanding complimentary hot breakfast buffet, (which can save a family of 5 a considerable amount of money over the course of a stay). The Managers reception in the evening is also a great perk. Leave early for the park in the morning, head back around 5:00 PM to have a couple at the reception, then back off to the park for the evening, it’s a great break in your day. As I read other reviews, I have to wonder, anyone that has a complaint must have VERY high expectations of a family hotel. Yes it can be
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is clean, has an accommodating staff, and provides an outstanding breakfast for guests.  It's proximity to Disney and the shuttle service enable you to relax and enjoy your trip and not worry about transportation.  I would highly recommend for families planning a trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Arrived on December 30th 2014.  We go to sleep and the beds in our two rooms were similar to the roach motels in Santa Ana slum area.  I went to speak with the hotel manager and head of house cleaning.  I asked them how old were the mattresses and what was the policy of buying new mattresses and the models/brands. Neither of them knew what the policy was for replacing old mattresses even though they have over 10 years working at the the hotel.  This leads me to believe that they never change the mattresses and or buy good ones.  Also there was a dirty towel and garbage in out trash container.  The manager apologized and I appreciated it but I will never stay there again.  The beds are something you would expect for a motel charging $75 per night.  If you want a nice night sleep
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay. We appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry for the issues with your room during your stay. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again in the future.

Summary: This is the 2nd time I stay at this hotel and have nothing negative to say about my stay.  The staff is friendly and professional, the room was clean, the hotel is easily accessible, with sufficient parking, even at midnight.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Embassy is adequate, but certainly doesn't live up to the expectations I have for this chain. Our room was on the top floor, away from elevators as requested, and was very nice and quiet. Breakfast was good, although I still find it odd that they have 'hot' breakfast and no warming utilities thus often the food was just barely warm right as they opened. My primary complaint is the cleanliness of the common areas, on our second day someone had spilled what appeared to be Cheetos on the hallway carpeting, which by the 4th day had still not been cleaned up and people had crushed it up leaving a long trail of orange powder on the carpeting... to me this is inexcusable! Further, the gym was a joke for such a large hotel. There were 14 floors, I'm not sure the total room numbers
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would recommend anyone who stays at this hotel verify with the front desk that you are above the 3rd floor as the ambient noise will penetrate your room easily. Check to make sure your room is clean, specifically in the sleeper sofa. Make sure to locate the stairs for access to the ground floor as the elevator seemed to close multiple times and with large amount of people, you may find it very difficult to get an elevator. Expect low quality drinks and snacks from the Manager special. This location is great for Disney visits, however, the price vs value doesn't add up, especially after a long drive and then a day at the park
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the issues that you experienced during your stay. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: Able to book online easily.Close to Disneyland.I was able to buy Disney tickets and shuttle tickets at hotel.Convenient,fast,excellent service. I have a big family so big rooms and complimentary breakfast was great.Great value if you have a family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice hotel. Good staff and friendly. Room was huge for family of 4!  Very, Very quick housekeeping pillow & towel service. Breakfast was ok. Would have liked a bit more variety. It was cold at breakfast because of guests leaving front door open.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Roomy and comfortable, the Embassy provides an A1 experience for families within a short shuttle ride of Disneyland. The separate bedroom suite insures privacy with the ability to separate out sleepers. The bathroom is really spacious with good water pressure.

Summary: Firstly - the price was right - book with Disney Travel and the 2 room suite was plenty for a family of 5. The hotel also has free snacks every day around supper time, and its location is close to good restaurants (we like Buca de Beppo Italian, Red Robin, and La Casa Garcia - Mexican). It's also close to a Target (to get snacks, etc. to take into the park). Summary Heading: Except for check-in, this was great!

Summary: I've been to a number of embassy suites around the world but this one stands out. They cater to those traveling to visit Disneyland. The lobby is decorated with Disney and seasonal. Great breakfast for all ages 5. Lots of bathrooms on the ground floor 6. A heated pool 7. Lots of parking 8. Walking distance from Disney   Dislikes:  1. Room arrangement was awkward 2. No locks on bedroom doors 3. No safe 4. Old batteries in controllers  Though there are a few dislikes the positives greatly outweigh the negatives. Summary Heading: Good for business, great for families
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for five days while attending a conference in early December.  It has all the attributes of the Embassy Suites chain:  huge central atrium, suites divided into two rooms, free breakfast, and happy hour.  This particular location could use a bit of updating in the lobby, but the rooms are very comfortable, the beds have nice linens, and there are ample towels in the bathroom. The place is popular with families attending Disney, and with business travelers. The difference here is the staff:  pleasant, helpful and efficient.  When I asked for a quiet room, they put me on the top floor, away from any noise.  I found it a comfortable and pleasant place to work for the time I was in Anaheim.

Summary: A short distance from Disneyland with easy access transportation shuttles--- you can purchase tickets right in the lobby. I've been here sever times-- always a good night sleep, clean and a good value.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for a Disneyland Vacation

We weren't pleased with our initial room assignment and they were able to move us right away without issue.  The room was comfortable and consistent with other Embassy Suites that we've stayed at.  The pull out bed could stand to be a little more comfy but that's kind of the nature of those beds.  We were located right next to the elevator but the room was still generally quiet.  It was clean and everything worked.  The breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold items. We were there during the week and it generally wasn't crowded.  If I had to complain about this hotel it would be about the fees.  Parking, Disneyland

For the entire week this elevator was out, and it sounded like it would be some time before management would get it fixed. Sounds like a small thing, but with the majority of the visitors leaving for Disney at the same time in the morning, it caused delays of up to 15 minutes (I clocked it!) waiting for an elevator to arrive. This helps a lot with budgeting.  It's also not far from Disneyland and there is a $5 shuttle bus.  Would stay here again.

Summary: Pro's: -The hotel rooms are very spacious and clean -free cocktail hour is a very nice perk after a long day at the convention center or the theme park -breakfast buffet included in room rate which is convenient for morning -staff was very attentive and polite   Con's: -internet not free in the room OR the lobby which is a rip-off  -the breakfast buffet could use some work - the coffee is awful so plan ahead to make a stop at a really coffee stop on your way out, and the fresh fruit selection was disappointing - a bit noisy ( but that is to be expected with so many families with small children staying to go to Disney)

A couple of times we ended up having to stand, but it was a very busy time of the year for Disneyland so understandable.  The morning breakfast that is offered was great and even opened 30 minute before the posted time, which was helpful for us catching an early flight back home.  The only thing that wasn't so great was the on-site restaurant.  The food was mediocre and expensive for what it was.  The service was nonexistent at about 8pm ,and they double charged us. Summary: Great complimentary breakfast and fitness center, but suite was in bad need of a facelift/renovation. As a whole, Embassy Suites does a good job of providing a decent value, but make sure to request a newer room, or you may be unpleasantly surprised.

Summary: My wife and I hosted an 18th birthday party for our daughter on 11/18/2014 at the hotel, and as such booked 3 rooms for my wife and I and our children. I requested for early check-in on at least one of the rooms so we can have enough time to get ready for the party which starts at 6pm. Imagine my surprise when I called on the morning of the event, and was told that I can check-in on all three rooms at noon instead of the regular check-in time of 3 pm. The hotel boasts of good-sized rooms, comfortable beds, a TV in the living room and another in the bedroom. As soon as you step out of your hotel room, you get a great view of the atrium. Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay when in Anaheim area
Summary: The Hotel was very clean and attractive, the rooms large and comfortable.  The staff was very helpful and kept their cool, even when there was a system-wide computer shut-down for nearly two days. This was not the fault of the local hotel, and they dealt with it admirably.  The breakfast bar was very good, with lots of choices (even personalized omlets.) The evening reception snacks were all on the 'hot' side (spicy), and the inexpensive offerings at the grill were very good. The shuttle to Disneyland was comfortable and very dependable, but the drop off point in the park was pretty far away from the main gate and there was a $5 per person/per day charge.   All in all, very pleased with our stay.

Summary Heading: Away From the Crowds but Close to Disneyland
Summary: We had an opportunity to stay at this property and we were not disappointed.  The bellman at the front entrance greeted warmly and made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived.  The reception desk staff was efficient and quick, the room clean and ready for us when we arrived.  The Disneyland kiosk in the lobby was well informed and helpful.  The front desk was well informed with regard to the local traffic (we arrived the weekend of the Disneyland Marathon) and helped us avoid major delays.    We treated ourselves to a room with a view of the Disneyland fireworks (somewhat obstructed) and enjoyed being able to sit on the bed and watch the fireworks from the comfort of our room.  All and all a very pleasurable stay.

I got a late checkout which was very welcomed. On the downside, you must pay to get wifi.

Summary: Always a great family stay.  Great area, close to Disney.  Managers reception and breakfast are always easy and lots of variety. Suites are very nice and clean, mostly quiet!  Its a kids hotel so if not wanting lots of children choose another property!

The free breakfast was a really nice option as it they have options like omelets made your way along with sausage and bacon and there were other items like cereal and such. Summary: We stayed this last weekend as a family.  We just stayed one night to get away from home.  We booked a one bedroom suite and asked for the upgrade for the fireworks view.  It was well worth the money.  This was the first time that my grandchildren enjoyed fireworks because normally they are too loud for their ears but the view was perfect.  You can't see all of the fireworks, Disney does some low ones, that cannot be viewed but it was a great show.  Thank you so much! Service was great as well, thank you!  The breakfast staff was wonderful.  I know that most people eat the eggs and other hot items which are wonderful but they can probably make the Danish and muffins  a little more appealing. This was very much appreciated as my boys had not slept the night before and we were all exhausted from our trip.    My son went for a swim almost immediately.  He shortly returned, complaining of "burning rubber" fumes in the pool area and a resulting severe headache.  He ended up taking a nap and it was better afterwards.  But he said he told an employee about the fumes and the employee didn't seem too concerned.

Summary: This is a really nice hotel. Opt for a suite high up for a view. Large rooms and toilet. Complimentary evening drinks and a full breakfast including a chef preparing your omelette . Parking 12USD per day. Walking distance to almost everything in Anaheim.

Summary: Excellent place to stay with family/kids.  The hotel staff was extremely friendly.  The rooms were clean. The housekeeping service, when needed was quick and efficient. Summary: The worst thing about this hotel is the reservation process. They didn't disclouse how much they would charge until after I was there swiping my card and when it declined they revealed they were charging more the advertised price. After speaking with on of the supervisors the situation was resolved but I still hate the fact that I went through that very embarrassing experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fresh, Clean, Inviting - from the minute you step out of the taxi or shuttle you are greeted with a smile and helping hands.  This hotel never disappoints me, if I am here for business the staff is professional and makes sure our needs are met in a most professional manner, when I am here for pleasure it feels fun and comfortable.  Clean - convenient - well cared for! Glad to stay here!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for 7 days as a family of 3. There can't be a better all around place to stay. Great breakfast 6:30am to 9:30am. Shuttle directly to Disneyland every 30 minutes and right on time. Shuttle not shared by other hotels, so it's a quick 5-10 min trip. End your day/begin your evening with a great manager's reception. Great food & snacks and unlimited cocktails/beer with no wait. Don't forget the great pool area with hot tub, open till midnight. Good little gym. Walk to Target, Outback Steakhouse, Joes Crab Shack, Red Robin, Subway, ice cream, etc, etc. 5 minute drive to Angels Stadium. Short drive to Huntington Beach and John Wayne Airport. Great great staff. Since we stated a week, no charge for parking and internet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: HILTON and all of Hilton properties need to remove the motion sensitive thermostats in the room! Bring back the paper boy. And Embassy Suites needs to upgrade the quality of alcohol at their evening reception
Manager Response: Brent,  We are sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of amenities you deserved during your recent stay. We apologize that you were not comfortable with the temperature level in your room. If you return to our area, we hope you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: This hotel certainly knows how to look after families visiting the many theme parks and attractions in the area.    Our 2 x doubles with sofa bed suite, whilst it initially seemed a bit dated and dark on first view, was very comfortable and provided just the right solution for our family of 4 including 2 teenagers.  We enjoyed the generous offering of free breakfast (including hot selection and cooked to order omeletes) and evening drinks and nibbles each day. Sorely needed for the full days at Disney parks.  The pool and spa are delightful. Wonderful to be able to use the $5.00 per person shuttle to go back and forth as many times as you need per day to recharge (a free shuttle like the one for the outlets would be excellent!)  The staff are very knowledgeable and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay while visiting Disneyland!!!!
Summary: Extremely close and an excellent value for Disney travelers.  Complimentary breakfast is great for the kids and the shuttle is available every 30 minutes right outside of the hotel.  This hotel was recommended to us by a family that frequents Disneyland and always stays at this hotel.  Due to the service, the location and the accommodations I would have to agree and recommend this hotel for every family traveling to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stood at this hotel with my family in July, and all I can say is AMAZING!!! Staff on point, location great! Rooms totally comfortable for families. I recommend all the way. Front desk staff (Lilian and Alan) my favorite! Great job and thank you so much!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just average, but the room set-up is good for families
Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights with my family while visiting Disneyland.  When traveling with my elementary school aged kids, I prefer to stay, when possible, at Embassy Suites, Homewood Suites or similar hotels because the suites have doors that separate the main bedroom from the living area where the kids sleep.  That is my number 1 criteria and I am willing to make sacrifices elsewhere.  And you do have to make sacrifices at this hotel.  The room was clean, but the decor was tired and dated.  I am not a picky eater, but the breakfast buffet was sub-par.  The bacon was so fatty it was inedible.  The fruit was under-ripe and hard.  The pastries were bland.  All that said, I would return to this hotel for the sole reason that it offers my preferred room set up at a competitive rate.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Overall good, but needs attention to detail
Summary: I stayed here for one night while I was in the area on business. It is a fairly standard Embassy suites, i.e. evening reception with free drinks, all suite rooms with a separate sleeping area and the cooked to order breakfast. The hotel looks great from the outside and the atrium and lobby are clean and bright. This hotel is located on the 'hotel mile' and clearly caters to the Disney crowd and looks to be kid friendly. I was on the top floor and as others have said, it is very hot in the communal areas at the top of the building. The room was a lot cooler but unfortunately this was at the price of a very noisy A/C unit. In addition the hotel uses the infernal Inncom thermostats that are supposed to detect when someone is in the room, or not. Unfortunately they don't work and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at many different hotels, but the Embassy Suites South is a beautiful hotel with the most excellent breakfast in the entire world!  There isn't a free shuttle to Disneyland, but it's not quite so far that an ambitious family couldn't walk it.  Also, they are excellent with free parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: From check-in to check-out, the customer service provided by the Embassy Suites staff in Garden Grove, CA was truly a world class experience.  The accommodations were excellent, and overall experience ranks at the top of the list. We especially like the security of the hotel, and closeness to Disneyland. Overall rating:  FANTASTIC!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Let me start by saying this is a place for FAMILIES! We were there with our family which includes our 1 1/2 year old grandson....so all of the crying, screaming kiddies didn't bug us! ( We had one too!). I would never stay here with my husband for a quiet retreat!   Pluses- Big rooms......really nice breakfast buffet.....close proximity to Disneyland...also across the street from Target in case you forget something! They sell tickets to the park in the lobby. The rooms were clean with comfortable beds.  Minuses- SLOW elevators...some people took the stairs because they were tired of waiting! Ask for a low floor so you won't have to make multiple stops on the way up or down. Long lines at the buffet for omelets .....we only tried once to brave the line, and the omelet was really
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here with the family for a trip to Disneyland. The location was perfect for a short hop over to the park. The staff members were friendly and efficient.  Indoor pool was very dark, fortunately the day was perfect for the outdoor pool.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The suite were very clean and spacious with a kitchen facility. complimentary breakfast, snacks and drink everyday between 5:30 till 7:30. close to Disneyland and orang outlet. many restaurant, shops and Target within a short walk distance. tickets desk available to enter disneyland. kids love the hotel so much.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Embassy suites is the perfect place for anyone in need accommodations for families of 5-6. There is plenty of space in their all-suite rooms and the free breakfast each morning makes things easy. The location is a stones throw from the Disney parks, downtown Disney, Angles Stadium and many fine restaurants. They do however charge for both parking and WiFi.  If you feel ambitious you can walk  to the parks (about 1.5 miles)
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our 2nd visit to this hotel in 6 years. It is an ideal location for a Southern California vacation.  Without a vehicle, there are shuttles that take you to and from Disney ($5/adult, $2/child per day). There are restaurants nearby and a Target across the road to stock the mini fridge.  With a vehicle, you are 45 mins from Dodger Stadium, an hour from Petco Stadium, 40 mins from LEGOLAND, 10 mins away from the Honda Center and Angels Stadium, and 10 mins from the Pacific Coast Hwy where you can head south and choose from a number of beaches to suit your style.  If you stay put, the buffet breakfast, atrium and swimming pool make a great place to kick back and relax. A family friendly hotel.  Can't wait to get back...
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for groups and a lion that roars!
Summary: I stayed here with friends for a birthday celebration on the 12th floor. Great for groups! We had conjoining rooms. It's a great location with shuttles to Disneyland, though we did not use them. Parking's free until 12:00 am, and then you'll need an overnight permit, which I'm told is $12/night but personally did not use. They have cocktail hour in the afternoon where guests can enjoy free snacks and alcoholic drinks with a tip! Great breakfast buffet in the morning. I didn't get to interact with the staff as much, but I found the stay pleasant with clean facilities. The pool isn't too big. The suites with sofas come with a pull out couch, which isn't too comfortable with the springs but enough for extra sleepers. It gets really busy here during the summer, so rooms get reserved

Summary: The Embassy Suites Anaheim South is a nice looking hotel.  The rooms are great and have a separate bedroom which is the reason we booked this hotel.      I gave this hotel a two star because they have terrible customer service.  After two days of below average customer service I went to the bar to order a mojito.  The bartender then tells me how I am making his job difficult in ordering that drink.      My friend and I were in town participating in the Disneyland Half Marathon and we were hoping to order food from the bar the night before the race to make sure that we have enough to eat in the morning.  When I asked the servers if I could order a fruit cup and yogurt to take up to the room they argued with me saying that it wasn't breakfast time and those items are only free at

Summary: Great location; minimal noise during this stay even though there were a lot of families with children.  Everything was quiet enough by 10 pm.  Breakfast was pretty good.  Staff was WONDERFUL - really understood the term "customer service"!  Thanks!

Summary: This is the place to stay if you want atmosphere, quality, and the typical Hilton family treatment. Nice size rooms, great staff, and not having to hunt for a real breakfast in the morning is such a time saver in the morning.

Summary: They give you the run around and never helped solve a billing, computer issues are not my problem but I am left paying over the contracted rate and they were condescending and not helpful. They appeared to disregard my concerns. Did not return my call for days and said I took to long. Sorry, I can't help you was their answer. If they can't then who can? They don't know.  Very frustrating!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share feedback on your recent stay with us. We’re very sorry to hear you experienced an undesirable level of customer service. We appreciate you alerting us to this issue. We hope you will give us the opportunity to make it right if you return to our area in the future.

Summary Heading: Fabulous choice for Disney Park visits
Summary: We stayed here in late July while we vacationed in Los Angeles. Most of visit was spent at the two Disney Parks. The hotel was comfortable and clean and attractive. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were high quality and tasty. We took advantage of the ability to buy the park tickets and park shuttle bus transport at concierge desk. Shuttle came frequently enough to make it convenient to travel to and from the parks. Hotel was a bit crowded at times and would overload elevator with guests, but we were on vacation so not in a hurry, sometimes chose stairs down (lower floor). Hot tub was nice as well. Highly recommend this hotel as an alternative to the official Disney resort. Much more value for your money.

Summary: Friendly and accommodating staff. The property was clean, quiet, and we very much enjoyed our stay! We would highly recommend the hotel! Breakfast is top notch....yummy omeletes and a wide variety of other items.

Summary: Stayed for five nights . Had really nice stay. We had two double beds for family of three. We managed fine but if you are six feet tall like my husband the double bed is small for two adults. The elevators are very busy on weekends so if it lands on your floor get on, it may not stop again for awhile. Staff are friendly and accommodating, the fresh fruit and eggs cooked to order are great. They have ART shuttle to Disney we just parked at Disney.

Summary: The staff here have your best interests at heart.  Whatever they can do to make your stay better, they will do.  They offered an extra mattress to make the pullout more comfortable, they accommodated us when our travel plans changed last minute and made the entire stay very stress free.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Been back to this hotel many times and each time I give it a 5 out of 5.  Despite high expectations I continue to leave this hotel satisfied and with the intent on coming back again.  PROS: The hotels exterior is immaculate and a welcome sight after a long drive, and the interior atrium extends the welcome indoors.  If you have never been here before you will be delighted to find a safari-themed atrium in the center of the hotel, complete with waterfalls and a lion that comes to live once in a while.  If you are here for a Disneyland trip then this is like an extension of Adventureland to start and end your day.   The staff were all very friendly.  There is a general store on the entry level that has all kinds of things from toiletries to energy drinks to souvenirs.  The hotel

Summary: We are members of the hilton family and we choose to stay at this property as my children like their breakfast the best.  I would say for this hotel does a fantastic job for the amount of guest they have each and every day.  We found everyone very pleasant and helpful when it came to purchasing the shuttle passes for Disney and any other information we needed on the park itself.  I think the only things I could mention is we were on the 14 floor and it was a bit warm.  The beds are only double beds and they were not very comfortable.  The room size is great and very clean. Will stay again.

Summary: Stayed at Embassy Suites Anaheim -South for a quick getaway. All was perfect. Morning breakfast was really good and the staff went out of there way to do anything you need. Front desk people were very friendly and check in was quick. The suite was spotless as were all the public areas in the hotel. The place was busy but not pushy.  Well run hotel. Will foresure return.

Summary: This hotel is nicely maintained and has a great free breakfast.  They also offer free happy hour which is another plus.  There's a paid shuttle that takes you to Disneyland and there's plenty of restaurants and near by shopping.

Summary: I stayed here on a recent business trip and I was very impressed. The staff was very helpful and friendly.  The included breakfast and manager's reception was very good.  And most importantly the rooms were very clean and spacious.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary: Great Hotel.  Very clean and updated.  Plenty of room for family and great breakfast!  Will always stay here for trips to Disneyland in the future.  Easy shuttle ride to Disney parks with lots of shopping and restaurants close by.

Summary: Sorry I couldn't keep my mouth shut. Myself and kids stayed at this hotel because we've stayed at many embassy suites around the country. Usually stays are comfortable and stress free. Summary: Great hotel! However, this Hilton, like many others near Disneyland, artificially inflates their room rates with a "parking fee". I travel on business so I don't really care but I see many families coming to this area for a vacation. The bottom line, if they don't have a gated parking lot, then tell them you do not have a car. They will say you can get towed but I have used this ruse more times than I can count. They never tow anyone. I am not the only one who ignores the parking fee. I have seen hundreds and hundreds of cars without the "parking pass". No one gets towed. Can you imagine how the reviews would look if they towed cars because someone forgot to put the pass in the window. This can save the average family $150 over a week.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our 3rd stay with this particular Good Neighbor hotel.  The hotel was booked in early January for our June stay. Our last trip there was during Christmas week, 2010, and the crowds that week, paled in comparison to what we encountered during this trip. The place was crowded and finding a place to sit for breakfast was quite the challenge!  Normally we would be 10th floor or higher. This trip, we were on the 4th floor and we were thankful for the stairs and the lower floor! Our room was right outside the elevator and it was a never ending wait for thw elevators...so there were a few times

Breakfast is bad - tasteless fruits, overcooked eggs and very greasy bacon. Yak!! There are only two elevators for the whole hotel, which is not sufficient - we ended up waiting really long for our elevator during "peak" hours. We did not like it. Summary: I visited the hotel for business in July. It is pretty much the typical Embassy Suites in most regards but does get tons more families with young kids than the normal Embassy. Since it's close to Disneyland just expect to hear them running up and down the hallways of this 14 story property. I was doing work in the lobby area for a few days and the hotel restaurant/ bufet area was not an extremely comfortable temperature. Most of the time hotels are on the chilly side for me but this property actually felt a little hot and stuffy in the main areas.

Summary: this is a great hotel to stay at when traveling with kids. My grandparents started this tradition when I was a child. We love that it is a suite so there is a room for kids to watch the t.v. and the adults to watch another. We love the microwave, frig and dining room table. The breakfast bar is great! We are not big drinkers but if we are back at hotel and feel like a drink in the evening it is great to have it available. I could go on and on. We just love this hotel!

Summary: We stayed 8 days at this hotel and we had a great time. The rooms were always very clean and nice. The staff was very nice and helpful. Even when the internet password didn't work they told me the would refund the charges and they did. I would stay here any time I return to the area.

Summary: Everything was top notch.  You can even park your car for free whilst using there shuttle service to the theme parks, such as Disneyland.  The afternoon/early evening drinks and snacks, along with the breakast ( I recommend the made to order omelette bar ) were very well done.

Summary: This is pretty much on par with an Embassy but slightly less due to high traffic of Disneyland clientele. The breakfast was good but come early or give yourself about 45 min for a leisurely breakfast during peak times between 8:30-9:30 am. The shuttles were good and on time. Summary: Good place to stay as family of 6.  Breakfast was good(not Great but still good).  Great Disneyland place with Disney rep right on site.  Offer a shuttle to Disney but more costly than Disney parking if 3 adults want to use it.

Summary: This beautiful hotel is about one mile from Disneyland. The Corner room on the ninth floor had wonderful views of the city and the fireworks of Disney. The shuttle to Disney was great with friendly drivers and great hours.  I would recommend this for a Disney stay - tickets available in lobby.  Beautiful hotel.

Summary: We chose to stay here since we couldn't get a room at DLR. That being said, we really enjoyed the stay here. Summary Heading: Wonderful stay in the middle of Orange County
Summary: Most travelers are familiar with Embassy Suites, their large rooms, free hot breakfasts, and evening social.  This property is no different.  Centrally located in Orange County, a very close drive to most major attractions, shopping and beaches.  The property is very clean, service is prompt and polite, and the check in/out process is very quick and efficient.  My only complaint is a mix up in the quoted rate online, versus the actual charge.  When I questioned the manager, an adjustment was quickly made.  The only other things to note is that they will "hold" an additional 25% on your credit card until you check out, and it takes 3-5 days for the credit to go back on your card, so budget accordingly.  Also there is a parking fee, where some of the other hotels do not charge.

Summary: Stayed over 4th of July weekend. Room was clean/breakfast was great/shuttle service to the park was right on time/ restaurant food was ok/service staff were pleasant/good place to stay if visiting Disneyland.

Summary: My first choice for lodging is Embassy Suites.  I was in Orange County and selected this particular Embassy because of location. Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disney and other attractions

Summary: My family and I are Embassy Suites fans. We enjoy staying at their hotels. So we decided to try this hotel for one night with a one day trip to Disneyland. After some discussion and availability of rooms, they agreed to give us the AARP rate. Thus the arrival experience was not what I expected.  The family was pleased with the room. The beds were good and the room was clean.  The Manager's Reception that night was relaxing and enjoyable.  Cook to order breakfast was what we expected--very good.  With a one night stay, we didn't get a chance to really experience the

This hotel gives you plenty of space, larger sized fridge, two large TVs one for each room, table to eat meals at, awesome linen very clean and close to Disneyland. The breakfast was average, but the waterfall, coy ponds, and layout of the breakfast area was fun for the kids. This hotel is very much a Disneyland hotel - and has seen lots of very heavy traffic. The elevators are exceptionally slow, and the ice machines are only on a few floors, so getting ice can be a hassle..

Summary Heading: Considering Joining the Cult of Off-site Disney Vacationers
Summary: Pros:  Very Friendly, helpful staff; great breakfast; room was located next to an elevator and heard very little noise from other guests or lobby; spacious, clean room; beds that were so comfortable I contemplated skipping the parks and staying in bed all day; hotel was clean and welcoming; housekeeping efficient  Cons: Elevators crowded at peak times (mornings especially) and slow (recommend a lower floor and using the stairs if possible); shuttles ran consistently but small size of transportation meant a long wait after Disneyland closed for the night (recommend driving to Toy Story lot and using the bus system there -- very painless and cheaper for some families/groups).  We only used a lightweight stroller (no diaper bags, etc.) for this trip, so our solutions worked fine

We regret the inconvenience you encountered with your original reservation being made for the wrong hotel and then being changed to our hotel but for the wrong date; however I am glad we were able to accommodate you when you did arrive. Every guest is very important to us and please know that we value your business and hope you return as we look forward to being of service to you in the very near future.

Summary: This was our second stay at the Embassy Suites on a trip to Disneyland.  Generally we stay at our timeshare but it was a last minute trip. One of them closed without any issues and the other was wrought with inefficiency and another agent who, I know this will surprise you, lied his butt off creating a problem for my buyers and for me. Manager Response: none

The staff was friendly and we enjoyed being able to purchase our Disneyland tickets in the lobby.  It was upsetting that, even as a Hilton Diamond Member, we had to pay for on-site parking even though the lot was completely full.  We ended up walking over from a neighboring hotel's parking lot.  There were events at the hotel that took up the space in the evening.  I wish the hotel had a free shuttle to Disneyland.  The prices they charged seemed high.  It ended up being cheaper for us to drive to the park ourselves.  Another negative was the breakfast.

Parking was $12 per night, about average for the area, but there was plenty of parking spaces unlike some of the other hotels closer to Disneyland. Manager Response: none

A great vacation hotel choice.

Summary: Good value for the price. Complimentary breakfast included with good selection. Won't be disappointed. Close proximity to Disney properties. Good access to Interstate and freeways. Was here on business but saw plenty of families staying at the hotel.

Summary: First trip to Disney with 5 yr old and 2 yr old.  Embassy delivered on the hotel room! The hotel seemed full, but not loud.  It was ready early, clean, and a perfect space for our family. I didn't feel it was dark or dated as others have mentioned.  More traditionally decorated than modern. They altered their cleaning schedule for our kids nap schedule and quickly responded to a couple requests we had.  The breakfast was good, hot, and never empty.  Kids loved watching the fish and turtles while we ate.   We used the shuttle to Disney for $5/person (our 2 year old was free).  The shuttle was on time and there was an extra one available when the first was full.  The ride was quick - 10 minutes, with no other stops.  It would be too far to walk for most people, I'd think -

Summary: We showed up early to buy shuttle passes and use the Disneyland Kiosk hoping to avoid lines at the "park". Liliana Mata met us at the front counter and was super nice and very helpful! She was even able to find us a room ahead of check in. The shuttle service was nice, those in the "park" were able to come and go as needed and take a break. As per usual ( the reason we stay at ES) manager's reception and breakfast were suberb! We had family from out of state visiting and Embassy Suites made their vacation memorable. Thanks!

Summary: Checked in for a stay while visiting the Disneyland Resort. The room itself was clean and in good shape, though the decor is a bit dated (the wallpaper border up near the ceiling should really be changed - it's straight out of the early '90s). I noticed some of the wallpaper in the bathroom of room 716 is starting to peel off the wall. Speaking of walls: They're kind of thin. We heard a lot of toilets flushing, showers running and cell phone ringing throughout our stay. Bring earplugs if you want to get decent sleep.   The room itself was adjacent to the
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Embassy Suites is not worth the money.   the breakfast  is below average. the  Rooms are old and small for a family of 5.  spend a little more and stay at a more upscale hotel.  After all you are spending a lot of money for a wonderful adventure at Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here recently while in Anaheim Forman Angels game. Hotel is conveniently located to the park. Hotel was very busy with lots of families tha appeared to be visiting the Disne parks nearby. This caused for jammed elevators especially in the morning, but tha would be my biggest complaint. Good breakfast and service...even during the busy times. Rooms were nice and spacious and the pool and hot tub were a nice treat at the end of a long day. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary: We stayed here when taking our 7 and 11 year old to Disney and an Angels baseball game.  It is the perfect location for both.  They have a shuttle that runs every 30 min. to and from Disney (you do have to pay an additional fee to use it but it is worth the money).  They have a great breakfast every morning FREE.  I would go earlier to eat it is less crowded.  They also have a happy hour every evening with snacks and drinks also FREE.  The kids loved having the spacious rooms and the pool and hot tub that was open until 12am.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel with FULL Service Breakfast!
Summary: We enjoy the Full Service Breakfast and Manager's Receptions at Embassy Suites.  Unfortunately, after we checked in and parked our vehicle, we were 1 minute late to the managers reception.  The attendants did not give us any grace.  Such is life.

Summary: This hotel serves the needs of a family that is visiting the disney and area. The breakfast buffet in the morning provides a good start for the events of the day. It offers a disney shuttle that starts @ 6.45am and comes back to the hotel @ 1am. Business room, pool, Jacuzzi, fitness room act as entertainment @ the hotel. The manager reception is very good considering it is free. You have to pay for Internet, nowadays many other hotel chains offer it free. Hilton is behind the times. Overall it is worth staying @ this hotel despite some annoyances.

Summary Heading: Josephine at the front desk was the bomb!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay , challenging parking lot

Did not like the suite tax or parking fees but what can you do.

Summary Heading: Excellent services provided by desk staff
Summary: Look for Steven H at the Embassy Suites check in desk nearest Disneyland on 11767 Harbor Blvd Garden Grove, CA 714.539.3300 for exemplary service and customer care. The summer season can leave the staff at heavily traveled hotels harried and frazzled, especially at locales close to mammoth international destinations like Disneyland, but such was not the case with Steven. He took time to manage my reservation as this busy location with aplomb and resiliance. I'll be back again for both business and family visits.

Summary: Our family of 5 stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland in the process of moving from Hawaii to the East Coast.  This hotel was very accommodating for our excessive luggage and carry-on bags.  The bell man was friendly and helpful with our bags.  Hotel includes free hot buffet breakfast each morning and happy hour with drinks/snacks in the evening.  Room was spacious and beds were comfortable.  We stayed in a suite with 2 double beds, pull out sofa bed, living room area, table and chairs for meals. Big bathroom too.  We ate dinner in the Serengeti Restaurant and Carlos was very attentive and friendly.  Reasonably priced food and good selections for the whole family.  Within walking distance to Disneyland, lots of restaurants and shopping.  We walked to and from
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Anaheim - South after a bad experience at one of the hotels closer to the Disneyland theme park encouraged me to move to a different hotel.  I was in Anaheim with my girlfriend to spend a few days at Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure.  I was pleasantly surprised when I moved to this hotel. I believe my appreciation of the amenities of this hotel was enhanced after experiencing a much smaller hotel with far worse accommodations.  This hotel is located about one mile away from Disneyland (located on the same Blvd.) The shuttle service is highly reliable, running every half hour and with more or less door to park entrance service. The shuttle busses were large and never crowded when we used them, both during the daytime as well as evening
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. We are very glad we were able to turn your trip around into an enjoyable visit with your friend. Thank you for recommending our hotel and great comments.

Summary Heading: Find a Different Disney Hotel for Your Family
Summary: We upgraded to the deluxe fireworks package with complimentary breakfast.  It was definitely not worth it.  The hotel is aging.  The staff rarely answered the guest services phone in the first 10 rings.  We were forced to evacuate down 11 flights of stairs for an early morning fire alarm with no direction, organization, or explanation -- while the upper 3 floors remained as did people in the lobby eating breakfast and the staff.  Little kids in PJ's being crowded down the stairs in bunches with running teenagers - not exactly safe.  We were given no compensation for that wake up call.  Towels and wash cloths were forgotten.  Breakfast was fair but crowded and a skip after one time.  We will stay closer to Disney next time or at least in a nicer facility.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We appreciate you taking the time to give us this feedback, as we are always looking for ways to improve our guest services. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your time with us, especially with the fire alarm. Our entire staff strives to provide our guests with the highest quality service, and we are truly sorry that this was not the case during your stay. Your concerns will be brought to the attention of our management staff. We would love the opportunity to make it up to you, should you choose to stay with us again. Thank you for sharing your thoughts. We hope to welcome you back again in the near future.

Summary: I stayed here with my husband and 14 year old son for a trip to Disneyland.  I wanted a hotel with suites close to Disney.  This is a very nice hotel.  We had an early flight so we were able to checkin early with no problems.  Staff was also very nice.  My main concern with hotels is cleanliness.  We stayed in room 1111, so we had no problem with elevator noise.  The room was very clean and had a refrigerator and microwave.  We had a king room with a tv and my son slept on the pull out sofa sleeper, which he said was comfortable and he had his own tv.  My only problem with the room was the toilet kept clogging, but the engineer took care of it right away.  They have a very nice atrium where we ate our FREE breakfast.  The breakfast was just okay with choices of cereal, scrambled
Manager Response: Thank you for your Tripadvisor review. I apologize for the issue with the toilet but glad to hear we took care of it right away. I hope the next time you stay with us you do get a chance to relax to the sounds of the waterfall in our atrium and enjoy a complimentary beverage during our Evening Reception.

Summary: We have stayed at many Embassy Suites but this one is the absolute best ever.  That is not to say there were a few quirks but overall, it is a great hotel.  It is beautiful with the typical suites that are so nice.  What made it better than any other ES we have stayed at is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and a great manager's reception with more food options than we have ever seen.  Along with the typical popcorn, chips and salsa, they had fresh vegetables and dip, pizza, tacos, etc. to munch on. Also as there were five of us staying in one room, housekeeping gave us an ample supply of shampoo and soap for all of us. The only negative thing is that we noticed the hallways weren't vacuumed often and if you come to breakfast late, the line can get extremely long

Summary: We have stayed at all the Disney properties at the Disneyland Resort.  This hotel was at least an equal.  The complementary breakfast was also easy on our vacation budget.  The staff was friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

Summary: There is something about the vast and open Embassy Suites lobby that makes me feel at home. They have an inexpensive Disneyland shuttle that you can ride on and off all day.  I highly recommend it.  The drivers were always courteous and the chilly air-conditioning felt great after being in the hot CA sun! There was also Disney movies playing on the TVs inside the shuttle.    Our room was huge and spacious and included a dining table for four.  The free (and quite impressive) breakfast
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great hotel, with a close location to Disney Land. They offer a nice menu for room service, very elaborate free breakfast every morning, and a wonderful free happy hour every evening with free snacks and drinks. Definitely recommend.

Summary: Another excellent stay at the Embassy Suites. Breakfast and Happy Hour was a nice touch!! Clean rooms and pool area. Friendly staff all around. Paul at Concierge is great help if you want to go to Huntington Beach for a day!

Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel again on our last trip to Disney.  We stayed for 3 days and overall had a great stay. And last, on previous trips we'd been irked by the slow elevators.  They seemed to have figured that out because the elevators
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay here was fantastic!  I am super picky about cleanliness and our room was very clean. The bed was comfortable.  We got a n/s facing room so we could see the fireworks and we had a nice view every night at 9:30.  The breakfast was fantastic. Summary: I was excited to stay here for my 3 day trip to Disneyland with my 3 kids. I paid in full in advance so I got a great rate and was minutes from Disneyland. We enjoyed our stay very much until the last day when I received my check-out statement that had a $150 charge for loss and damages. I could not imagine what this could be for. We didn't break anything, we were not loud or inconsiderate guests. I called customer service to ask what the charge was for and he said he didn't know and I'd have to talk to a manager who wouldn't be in for 2 hours. We were leaving to drive home to Lake Tahoe so I didn't call back right away. The next time I called I was told the charge was for "smoking" in my room. I told her there was NO WAY that was possible and perhaps they got the wrong room.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your concerns with us. Our hotel has a non smoking policy which we support as well as most guests do. We would like to discuss this further with you. Please feel free to contact me. Again, thank you for your comments.  Jim Durslag General Manager

Summary: Great hotel to stay near Disney!  Vary clean from front door to room.  Great rooms - spacious, quiet, and CLEAN!!  Staff very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast and shuttle service awesome!!! Can't go wrong staying here for the $!!!!!!

Summary: Poor availability of  hotels brought me to the Embassy.  The hotel gets very rowdy after Disney closes around 10:30. Otherwise stay clear of the Embassy on Harbor, especially during the summer months.

Summary: This is an outstanding hotel option for gluten-free families wishing to visit Disneyland and other area attractions, including nearby beaches.
