It's about a mile away from Disneyland, however, for $5 per person, per day, there is a hotel shuttle that picks up every half hour and drops off every half hour and worked like a charm.  The hotel was clean, the breakfast buffet was typical, but just what we needed to start our day out.  The staff we encountered was friendly and helpful.  My only complaint was that when we were trying to figure out the shuttle schedule, no one really had an answer as to when the last shuttle picked up at Disneyland.  We must have asked 3 or 4 different people, including the person working the Disney desk, and they all had different answers.  It would be very helpful for them to have this information for their
Manager Response: none

Summary: THis is a great choice of hotel.  If you are looking for a great place to stay while visiting the DIsneyland area, look no further.  The made to order free breakfast is a great addition to the decent rates and location.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very fun and festive place to stay
Summary: This is the second time we stayed in this hotel and were again pleased.  The staff was very helpful. The breakfast and managers cocktail hour really made it a value!  Very close location to Disneyland Parks.  We were able to fit 4 adults and 2 kids in a standard room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly staff, clean hotel, nice pool, large rooms, good breakfast. Offers quick shuttle to Disneyland (maybe 5-10 minute ride). If the shuttles were crowded, the next was only 15-30 minutes later. Close to various resturants.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great for the kids. Free breakfast saves us so much money. The value is excellent. Our bathroom smelled a bit like cigarette smoke and the carpet needed cleaned but overall I was happy with our stay. We will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for our anniversary. Upon arrival, we received excellent service from Steven H. He went over and above to accommodate our wishes for a room upgrade.  The beautiful room was exactly what we were looking for.  For 23 years, Embassy Suites has been our choice of hotel brands to celebrate our anniversary.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Once or twice a year we head down to Disneyland and I usually bid through Priceline and get whatever hotel I get.  This time I booked Embassy Suites straight away.  I had very high expectations coming in because of such a great stay we had about seven years ago and I was eager to see if it was as good as I remembered and I have to say, it was just as good, maybe even better.  The Pros: This hotel has a certain quality that you are hard pressed to find around Disneyland for less money.  The common spaces of the hotel are luxurious and the atrium in the center has an Adeventureland-ish theme that is really neat, especially for the kids. There are waterfalls and rivers with fish and turtles.  There is an animatronic lion that comes to life every so often and roars and looks around.
Manager Response: Thank you for the outstanding review on TripAdvisor. Our entire staff strives to earn these 5 out of 5 star reviews and we are so happy we were able to deliver an excellent guest experience that you were expecting in both our product and service. We hope to continue to be your hotel of choice for your Disneyland trips.

Summary: This hotel was really nice and inviting.  The staff was wonderful and the morning breakfast was excellent!  I also loved the king suites as my kids had a seperate room from us, which was very nice.  Bucca de Beppo is right out front which is a great restaurant and very cheap compared to Disneyland food. Shuttle was very easy to get to Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: They have the Embassy Suites formula down to a tee.
Summary: We stayed here for our Disneyland trip. Thank you  for providing exactly what your company states it will.  We chose his hotel chain because of the living room area (mommy and daddy need quiet time), the managers reception (because who doesn't deserve his after a long day at the park?), and the breakfast. We recently stayed at another Embassy Suites location nearby and it was awful. This experience was great. A leak developed in our room in the middle of the night, they responded quickly and were actually apolegetic for the incident. We knew that this could not be prevented by the hotel but we do appreciate that they cared about our guest experience.  The staff is incredibly friendly from the housekeepers nd maintence to management and front desk.We have made this location our
Manager Response: Thank you for your taking the time to write your review. I do apologize fof the inconvience that occured with your room and do appreciate your understanding and assistance in allowing us to resolve it quickly. We look forward to having you back as our guests when you do return to the area. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: Checked in tonight, travel weary with two kids in tow... Stephen was informative, efficient and professional. Went above and beyond... a reason to return... room service stated 30 minutes and delivered in 15! Way to uncompromised and over deliver.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I visited this property with my husband and three children for six days while visiting Disneyland. This hotel is a bit over a mile down Harbor Blvd from Disneyland, and thankfully there is a shuttle that is there every 30 minutes or better. The staff, especially the breakfast chef, were exceptionally courteous and helpful. The breakfast had several hot buffet items, omelettes cooked to order, and could accommodate food allergies, i.e. gluten free pancakes and potatoes. There is a manager's reception every night with free drinks, mixed drinks, wine, and beer for adults, and sodas and juice for the kids. My daughter enjoyed a Shirley Temple every night as they put grenadine in their drink station. The room was very comfortable, and the separate living room with sofa bed helped the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Always a pleasure being there at a Embassy Suites. Never anything bad or horrible to say about them. The staff is always helpful and kind, never shrugs when asked to do something. Definitely worth the money. Its a great place to stay especially the day before you visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Noisy and Chaotic-Beware Tour Groups With Loud Kids!
Summary: My wife and I were looking forward to a weekend getaway. We thought this was the hotel for us. Wrong! Despite what the hotel management states on Trip Advisor they often have large groups of children in organized tours staying in the hotel and the hotel  staff and security dept. do very little to control the noise. We had to wait a long time to get an elevator, could not sleep because of hundreds of children talking loudly, even screaming,  and running through the halls until all hours.  The complimentary breakfast the next day was monopolized by hundreds of kids and their chaperones from the time it opened. I might add that the professionalism of the staff could use much improvement as well. We packed up and checked out of the hotel a day early and found a lovely hotel in
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate your review about your stay at our hotel with your wife. We sincerely apologize we were not able to provide the experience you were expecting for your getaway weekend. While we do often have groups visiting, we do our best to ensure noise is not an issue and encourage guests to let our staff and security know of any situations. Your feedback will help us to continue to work to provide the best stay possible for all guests. Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for a Disney excursion
Summary: Comfortable place to stay for a trip to Disney.  Breakfast was good and comfortable amenities at the hotel.  My only comment was that wish that the wifi was available for all devices instead of paying separately per device used.  Also the sof was sagging and had seen better days. Overall good value for what we paid for.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were participating in an event at the convention center and the hotel is conveniently located near the convention center and Disneyland.   The staff is great, the rooms are spacious, and the breakfasts provides a variety of good food.  We had lots of teenagers with us on the trip and the hotel staff was very kind, patient and understanding.  They kept the hotel quiet while meeting the various needs of the teenagers.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel was good, but had one big issue
Summary: The hotel was nice overall. The bed was great. I slept very well. The breakfast was awesome and I used it everyday. The evening reception, another story. Nothing except for soda was free. The food, the drinks, everything had a charge to it. This explains why NO ONE was at the evening reception for my entire stay of 5 nights.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. I am not quite certain where the miscommunication occurred as we do offer the Embassy Suite brand standard amentiy of complimentary beverages (alcoholic beverages incuding beer, wine and spirits and non-alcoholic beverages) and light snacks each night between the hours of 5:30pm - 7:30pm. Along with the complimentary drinks and snacks, we have recently added an appetizer menu has that has been a big hit for those guests that are looking for a big taste for a minimal price during that time. I do apologize that you did not get an opportunity to enjoy our complimentary services during your stay.

Summary: This is the perfect hotel for your Disney experience. The entire staff was friendly and professional. The rooms were very clean and roomy. The breakfast included is a great way to start the day with plenty of choices for all. We had a flat tire and the staff was more than helpful to help us find an open tire place on Sunday morning. It was a short and easy ride to the Disney area and there is also a shuttle available. (for a small fee) There are plenty of restaurants in the area for late dinners, etc. The pool was very clean and refreshing after a hot day of Disney. There are plenty of clean towels down by the pool. There is a managers reception nightly with snacks and drinks. (even alcohol if you chose) This hotel definitely added to our entire Disney experience and we will be
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great breakfast, good location and an overall above average hotel
Summary: Stayed at this hotel as part of a convention and had a good experience. The hotel was clean, had an accommodating staff, was located close to Disney, outlet shopping at the Orange, the Anaheim Convention Center, the Crystal Cathedral, many restaurants and a short drive to beaches and other area attractions.  The all suite hotel was decently decorated (I have seen much better decor), the rooms were fairly spacious and included two flat screen tvs, microwave, mini fridge, wet bar, table for six, and a pull out sofa. The adjacent bedroom was a touch on the small side.   An enormous plus of the hotel was the morning breakfast with made to order omelets and a complimentary evening reception with cocktails and snacks.   The outdoor pool area was on the small side but had nice lounges
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good place to stay with your family. Great breakfast and managers reception. Shuttle bus takes you to Disneyland for a fee. Make sure to check if any major events are going on during the time you stay as that could affect the atmosphere.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best place I have stayed in California
Summary: I took a group of students to California for a conference and the hotel staff was very helpful making sure all accommodations were perfect. A student had his birthday and the head chef (Rick)made a cake to help this student celebrate.
Manager Response: Thank your for taking the time to write your review regarding your recent stay with us. We know it can be stressful being in charge of a group and we are glad we were able to help it go smoothly for you. We are fortunate to have Chef Rick on our team and happy we got a chance to help in celebrating your student's 17th birthday.

Summary: We enjoy this hotel and enjoy staying at this location since this hotel  became an Embassy Suites. I love the fact that if there is ever an issue, the staff will take the time to resolve it. The hotel and the  rooms are always cleaned and maintained.
Manager Response: The staff here at Embassy Suites Anaheim South would like to personally thank you for taking the time to provide us with the positive feedback regarding your visit. Our primary concern is for all of our guests to have an exceptional experience. We are happy to share this internally with our team to reinforce our service culture. Thanks again, and we look forward to serving you for many years to come.

Summary Heading: Great way to start a Southern California Vacation
Summary: My family and I stayed at Embassy Suites in April of 2013. It was a great visit! The location is about a mile from the Disney parks which was great.  The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff was very great and accommodating.  There is a shuttle that runs to and from Disney for an additional small fee which was fantastic! ($12.00 for 2 adults and one child). The furnishings in the room were a little outdated but otherwise this was a wonderful stay and I would recommend staying here to anyone looking for a great stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: They made it so easy for us! We checked in got 2 free hours of Drinks and snacks, we were able to purchase our Disneyland tickets there, woke up had the best Breakfast which gave us every option possible (Free) and then we utilized the shuttle to Disneyland.  And that night we were able to get a break from the kids cause they have seperate living room with door to bedroom. We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We found this suite hotel of high value and equally high quality.  The rooms are spacious, clean, well appointed and very comfortable.  The complementary breakfast and evening reception were both excellent.  The food was plentiful, varied and of high quality.
Manager Response: Thank you for the outstanding review on TripAdvisor. Our entire staff strives to earn these 5 out of 5 star reviews and we are so happy we were able to deliver an excellent guest experience to you. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Exactly what we were looking for... Our son loved it
Summary: We were on a family trip centered around our 4.5 year old son and Cars land at DisneyLand.  This hotel is exactly what it needs to be.  It was clean, quiet in the rooms, energetic in the courtyard (fun for the kids with the water falls and lion).  It's not a luxury hotel, but it isn't supposed to be.  The staff is wonderfully pleasant and accommodating.  We forgot to pull the Do Not Disturb sign a morning.  They didn't make up our room, which is fine... We forgot, but they quickly brought up a big stack of fresh towels when we called down.  Parking is $12 a day, which wasn't my favorite, but if you are flying in to there're a, I would definitely recommend renting a car to get around... Too much to see to stick with shuttles.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great staff, great food, great accommodations our stay was short but we enjoyed every minute, we would advise anyone going to the Disneyland area to stay here it was close to ESPN Zone Downtown Disney and all the restaurants you can think of and get this soon their will be a Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles across the street by the end of the summer of 2013
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic value for money and great location!
Summary: I've always been a fan of Embassy Suites, and this hotel again fortifies my fan-dom. The location is fantastic, and for booking through their website and getting the internet rate of $145/day for a suite, this suited us perfectly. We had one son, age 12, who had his own room and sofa bed with his own TV, and he loved it. Especially love the free/included breakfast and the free manager's reception.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at this hotel while visiting Disneyland. I stayed during spring break and the hotel was FULL of high school bands, however it was not an issue. The full complimentary breakfast is always a nice touch at Embassy properties, as is the free internet. I was welcomed with 2 bottles of complimentary water at the front desk because I am a HHonors member. The staff was very attentive. The rooms were large and comfortable. The only negative would be the lack of elevators. It took over 10 minutes the first time I needed to come down the elevator and almost 10 the second time. One elevator was out of commission, and according to the person I met in the breakfast line, it had been broken for his whole stay. The other elevators were simply overloaded and overworked and could not
Manager Response: none

Summary: The food at breakfast very much a let down.  All the bread options were either stale or rock hard.  The breakfast cereal containers crushed the cereal to crumbs as you tried to empty it in your bowl.  The bacon was a big mess of burned, overcooked, dry bacon that was all clumped together making it so it was impossible to take any less that a clump of whatever the tongs could get a hold of.   On each morning I made an effort to get apple juice for my daughter, but each dispenser on each day had an issue with the juice to water ratio.  The juice was almost entirely water with only of tint of apple concentrate.  The omelets were the most disappointing.  I do hate to complain about the omelets because the server who was creating them for our stay was friendly, polite, very quick and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Many many kids screaming all night. Elevator noise all night. Hotel booked solid so could not get another room.  Near Disneyland so I suppose the screaming kids are to be expected. Rude parents can't control or quiet their kids. Nice hotel but would not recommend because of noise.
Manager Response: We appreciate your time in writing your review. I’m sorry we were not able to provide you with a satisfactory experience during your recent stay. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we appreciate your feedback about the noisy neighboring guests. I have shared your review with our security team to ensure we are providing the best assistance during higher traffic times. We hope you will consider staying with us the next time you are in the area.

Summary: Would definitely stay at this Embassy Suites again when visiting the Disney parks.  It's located within walking distance from Disneyland/CA Adventure but there's also shuttle service available.  Can't beat the complimentary breakfast.  There's also an evening reception although some of the food choices were not complimentary.  First time I've been at an ES property where they offered snack choices for a price.  Prices were reasonable though.  Kids loved the pool and our room had a view of the fireworks (although for some reason the Park canceled fireworks the night we were there).  Highly recommended for families; very kid-friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I went to Anaheim for a busness trip (to take a review class and a test for RNC) and combined busness with pleasure. The hotel was just right thing to do that. The location is in the middle of everything. I walked to Disneyland (little too far, if you are in Anaheim just for Disney park visit and have kids with you), I also walked to the Orange outlets (good walk too). I walked everywhere! If you are renting a car, you will not be regreting staying in this hotel. I was staying in the room 1217 on 12th floor. I had two rooms - living and a bedroom. The bedroom was away from the hallway and this fact was very favorable in eleminating noise from the hallway and elevator. Breakfast was included in price and was good (not excelent). I also liked complimentary afternoon drinks. Every
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesome Hotel with fabulous service and close to Disneyland!
Summary: Great hotel with super clean facilities. Free breakfast and booze in the evening, what more can I say!! Rooms are huge and extremely comfortable, especially for the price.  Stephen H. At the front desk was super helpful and started our stay off with a huge smile.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently spent four nights at this hotel and the overall experience was good.  The staff was friendly and courteous and the room was clean and well maintained.  I enjoyed the cooked to order breakfast, but have to admit the first morning I tried and omelet and it was terrible.  The rest of the breakfast was fine and when I tried the omelet again, with a different chef, on the weekend it was much better.  There was a problem with the elevators on more than one occasion and it always seemed to happen at the worst time, when everyone was headed to breakfast.  My four year old grand daughter loved the turtles, the fish, and especially the lion that roars every half hour. I attended the managers reception twice and it was very nice.  The fold out had no fitted sheets and was pretty
Manager Response: none

Summary: After years of staying at the Candy Cane Inn and a couple of glorious reviews, the love affair ended after a horrendous experience there that threatened to ruin my daughter's birthday. We handed the key to the front desk and left for the Embassy Suites because it was Spring Break and no rooms available anywhere. Lucky for us, while I was searching on the internet no availability at the Embassy Suites turned into a room with a view of the fireworks at Disney and we grabbed it. OMG -- I wish I had known about this place earlier! We travel EVERY YEAR to Disneyland for my daughter's birthday. If only I had known about: the rooms with wall to floor ceilings facing Disney so you can watch the fireworks in the comfort of your room after having had a hot shower and putting on your
Manager Response: Thank you for the outstanding review on Tripadvisor regarding your recent stay with us. One of our top priorities is to provide an exceptional stay for all our guests and we are thrilled to hear we did just that for you, especially since you were celebrating a magical time such as your daughter’s birthday. We would be honored to be your hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland and to continue having each year be her best birthday ever!!!!

Summary: I have stayed at Embassy Suites for business several times, but this was our first family trip. We were extremely pleased with our overall experience. Our room was huge and nicely appointed. The free breakfast and manager's reception were wonderful. Go for the omelettes at breakfast and avoid the "extra fee" snacks at the manager's reception. You are better off having a snack and enjoying the complimentary beverages before heading back to the park or the multitude of dining options in the area. I was particularly pleased with the service and perks of being an HHonors member - it is free to sign up and the benefits we received (larger suite, free wireless, no charge for parking, welcome package) were greatly appreciated. The pool area was nice - nothing special, but a pleasant
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'll start with the good.  Check in was good.  Friendly staff, fast and efficient in getting us in.  We arrived at about 7:15.  They mentioned the managers reception was still going on.  The kids loved the turtles and koi and waterfalls and we grabbed some popcorn and munchies and a couple of glasses of wine.  It was a nice welcome.  Then we went up to the room, it was very spacious for a family of five.  We had what seemed like two separate rooms.  One was with a pullout couch and the other a king sized bed.  There were also two flat screen tvs, which was great!  And a mini fridge for storing food!  However I had asked beforehand to not be ner elevator and we were right beside it.  It was noisy until about midnight, but not the end of the world.  We went to Disneyland for two
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience on Tripadvisor. We appreciate the positive comments and apologize that we fell short in providing outstanding service in every aspect of your stay. Your comments will be shared with our managers in order to improve in those areas. We regret we were not able to provide you with the breakfast you expected. Our complimentary, cooked-to-order breakfast is comprised of a variety of hot and cold food items, but we are constantly looking for ways to improve the guest experience, and as a brand, are looking at additional items we could include. We hope you will stay with us again if you are ever back in the area to see the changes.

Summary: Great rooms, breakfast buffet and happy hour. Within walking distance to Disneyland.  Clean lobby and pool area. Able to take shuttle right outside if you don't want to walk.  It does cost extra but worth it if staying more than 1 day.  You can purchase tickets in the lobby.
Manager Response: Thank you, Lisaloy76, for your positive comments about your recent stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South.  We are glad you were able to enjoy some of the amenites we provide to all our guests. When you vistied our evening reception, I hope you got a chance to enjoy the new appetizer menu we offer during that time. The steak tacos are a guest favorite. Hope to have you back again with us real soon.

Summary: Firstly, provided are Nicely appointed, spacious 2 room suites. Perfect for a family needing a mini fridge, micro and dining table. Very clean and the linens seemed to be in great shape, lots of pillows on bed and no noise air and heat units. Beautiful decor in the lobby.   *There is a made to order breakfast which doesn't open until 7:30 am which is AFTER early entry hours to Disneyland. The breakfast was average. Better than most but it fuels the tank. A line forms early and in order to get "made to order" you will wait most days. There are tickets available for Disneyland in the lobby directly across from check in.    *There is a shuttle bus that comes by for $5 a person round trip per day. There are other stops on the list of stops but Embassy seemed to be the most popular
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pretty much what you would or should expect
Summary: The hotel was relatively well located, but a bit far for walking to Disneyland. It is overrun by kids, which isn't necessarily a problem, but a lot of parents pretty much let their kids run wild in the hotel.  Our room was pretty worn, but the layout was good.  Breakfast as well as the manager's happy hour was welcome.  The shuttle bus is convenient, but there are too many riders to get on and you either have to get there 20 minutes before the bus comes or risk having to wait another half of an hour.  We ended up getting a cab about half of the time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel when we went to Disney Land--good rooms with a living room area.  Breakfast and nightly snacks and happy hour is included.  Shuttle took us everyday to the parks--for a small fee.  The atrium was a nice place to hang out!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent one night at the hotel while visiting Disneyland.  The location was great, although a little hard to see from the street as it is set back.  Staff was just great and very friendly.The rooms were spacious and clean. The only issue we had was that the parking was very full and late at night it was very difficult to find a space. However, we will stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Average embassy suites, management needs some training.
Summary: We had some issues on arrival with our reservation. The front desk person was friendly but the manager wasn't helpful, barely made eye contact with us and basically walked back into her office without resolving anything.  The next day our keys didn't work after a long day at Disneyland and the front desk suggested it was de-magnetized by a credit card but my husbands didn't work either. That was fixed quickly but the other issue with this hotel is the elevators and just having to go back down to the lobby was a pain. I know others have mentioned it but the elevators are a real mystery. There are two elevators on each side of the hotel but they take forever for some reason. The morning we left, we waited around 10 minutes! After waiting in lines for almost everything at
Manager Response: Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced.  I assure you, this is not typical of how we run our hotel and all information will be passed on to the appropriate department managers. I realize you mentioned that you would not stay with us again, however, we would sincerely like another opportunity to win back your good faith in our hotel during a future visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary: We have stayed twice at this hotel and both times we have enjoyed our experience. The hotel is quiet, has wonderful restaurants nearby, and is a good value. Both times we have taken advantage of the breakfast. All of the employees are friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love this hotel. Fantastic staff, great location (20 minutes walk to Disneyland), well appointed rooms, and free breakfast. Clean, with good Wi-Fi (free if you are Hilton Gold or Diamond)  The only downside is the lack of restaurants on site, but with so much choice only 10 minutes walk away its not a real issue. Parking at $12/night can be expensive, although we were never charged.  We used to stay at the Residence Inn but no longer. Back again in November this year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The convenience of staying at this particular hotel while visiting Disneyland can not be matched.  The staff was friendly and went out their way to make sure that we could be accomadated to  what we needed.  I do admit that the breakfast did not have too much variety but knowing that it would be hot and fresh is really important to me for my family. Not having to look to just eating cold cereal and yucky carbs is especially nice, after all it is my vacation too. The managers reception was a nice break in the day and allowed some time to relax and unwind before heading back to the park for the evening and it is worth making time for it during a hectic park day. I would not hesitate to stay there again!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Front desk and housekeeping were very good. There was a strange sort of noise in our first room. An alarm of some sort. The maintenance guys could hear it but could not find it so they moved us to another room. Breakfast was outstanding! The manager's reception was nice. Get there early! It fills up quick.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very nice and clean, but there is a daily parking fee of $13.
Summary: Clean and spacious rooms, but the two beds are full size beds so two adults could not sleep comfortably.   The complimentary breakfast is very nice and bigger than usual embassy suite breakfast areas so waiting for your food does not take long. Daily parking fee of $13.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this location for business and it was during spring break so there were lots of families staying there with their kids as it is very close to Disney.  The hotel was quiet and I found my room to be very nice.  The breakfast was good and they even have signs with stop lights telling you when the busiest times are for breakfast in case you want to avoid those times.  Great stay....no complaints at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Breakfast, very nice hotel, long walk to Convention Center
Summary: I liked this hotel, stayed there during a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. It is a refreshing walk in the morning , but after a long day on your feet, it is kind of a long walk back to the hotel. The breakfast is excellent, rooms are clean, wi-fi seemed to be a problem with those from my company who tried to access the internet. They need to fix that. Having a "business friendly" hotel with spotty internet access is no good.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nervous from other reviews...but GREAT property!
Summary: So we were planning to do all things L.A. - from Anaheim to Laguna Beach to downtown and Hollywood and I was also looking for a hotel that would feed my 3 kids every morning so I could do all of this on a budget. I read some of the other reviews and was a little nervous, but booked this hotel... I am glad I did.  The breakfast every morning is really really good. You have the staples of eggs, bacon, sausage, bagles, muffins, toast, and cereal and each day it's either pancakes or waffles. In addition, the chef will make you any omelette you desire or eggs the way you like them. It does get a little crowded, but honestly, there is more than enough room at any of the times breakfast is served.  We stayed on the 3rd floor (which I HIGHLY recommend) because at certain times of the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are fortunate to be centrally located to all the Southern California has to offer and our complimentary breakfast and evening reception is a great added value. Glad we were able to be a part of what sounds like a great vacation you had with your family.

Summary Heading: We had a great time here
Summary: Well I must start by saying that this is my second attempt to submit a review of this hotel- for some reason my first one was never published. Hopefully it wasn't because the review was too complimentary and deemed not real - as my comments were genuine and heartfelt. :( I have been to Anaheim many times, and also stayed at Disney properties both in California and Florida. In Anaheim, this was definitely our best experience so far.   The hotel lobby has a great African theme -which is fun.  The atrium's centerpiece is a lion that roars every half hour, which was fun. As well there were pools with faux rock work that were filled with Koi fish. Only concern there was that people would throw change into the water - this cant be good for the fish - and I cant recall seeing signs
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time....again.....to write a review from your stay. We appreciate you wanting to make sure your experience was shared with others. I am glad you were able to enjoy all the great amenties we offer. I am sorry to hear you were not able to visit our pool but hope you do so the next time you stay with us as we just resurfaced the pool and refinished the deck and it looks great.   Thank you again for your review!!!

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites near Disney land (approx 1 mile from)
Summary: This is a great family hotel as I expect from all Embassy Suites - nice roomy rooms, comfortable beds, nice breakfast and a nice lobby with WaterFall.  This is a fantastic property for families trying to stay near Disneyland and not pay the Disney hotel prices.  There is a paid shuttle ($5 appox) to take you to and from Disneyland on the premises.  They hotel staff was extremely welcoming and friendly and very much appreciated.  DO be careful however of loud elevators - see below on tips for Choosing a good room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Embassy does cooked to order breakfast everyday, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, cereal (hot and cold), french toast, yogurt, fruit, juices, coffee and tea.  All you can eat.  They also do a nightly reception with popcorn and other snacks and drinks, both nonalcoholic and alcoholic. Shuttle to Disneyland for $5 is a bargain.  Also lots of great restaurants within walking distance.  A workout room if you need it after a day at the parks, swimming pool too.  Beautiful waterfalls and Savanna setting, with the lion roaring every 30 minutes.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was only staying there 1 night, we didn't get to use the restaurant or any other facilities so this review is based purely on the room.    The room was large, with separate bedroom, livingroom and bathroom.  The livingroom had a seating area, dining area and food preparation area with sink.  I found the rooms to be very comfortable and quiet (we did have a room at the end of the corridor though).    As for the rest of the hotel, the decor is just fantastic, the water features, the jungle like feel, the glass elevators.   Finally the staff were extremely polite and efficient.  I was also able to buy tickets to the Disney Parks from the booth across from reception at the discounted price I'd seen online.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Noisy and suites are in need of updating
Summary: My family and I stayed at this property in February 2013 for a visit to Disneyland.   When we checked in, we were given 2 bottles of water which was nice, although the person behind the counter was not terribly friendly.   I was also surprised when we reached our room because the couch and chairs look old. The bathroom and living room areas need updating badly. The pullout bed in the couch was covered with one sheet (no top sheet) and the sheet was too small for the size of the mattress. No extra pillows, sheets or blanket was provided even though our reservation was for 3 people so we had to wait for housekeeping to deliver the needed linen, pillows and blanket. One area of the carpet was damaged. Overall, the room looked a dingy and outdated (except for the flat screen TVs).
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at our hotel. I appreciate your honesty in reviewing your experience; we look for reviews to provide insight into our hotel and our guest experience is an area we are always actively examining. Your feedback regarding the noise and breakfast times will be taken into consideration as we work to improve. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: We visited this property at the end of February for a quick trip on school vacation. We travelled with our 2 and 5 year old and selected this property because it offered one bedroom suites - a necessity for our family. The property is located about 5 minutes away from Disneyland and offers a shuttle service. We opted to use our rental car and, therefore did not use the shuttle. The room was clean and spacious - perfect for a family of four. We did notice that the security locks on the door were very low - low enough that our two year old was able to reach them and unlock it. We noticed this comment in other reviews and assumed that it was only an issue in handicap-equipped rooms, but this was not the case. Due to the setup of the hotel - a large atrium in the center and
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was attending a conference at this hotel so for convenience I figured this was the place to book my stay.  I must say that the staff - front desk, housekeeping, restaurant, conference room - were all very courteous and attentive.  My room was clean and smelled fresh.  The complimentary breakfast was good, but go for the made to order omelette as the scrambled eggs on the buffet table was dry.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an odd review to write because overall we were pleased with the hotel, they just simply assigned us a "bum room" which they should not assign to ANYONE unless maybe the whole building is booked and there is no other choice. They allowed us to check in early when we arrived around 10 am... we ran our stuff up to the room which looked fine, then off to Disney we went for the rest of the day. Manager Response: I’m sorry we were not able to provide you with a satisfactory experience during your recent stay. Compared to that hotel, the king-sized suite at the Embassy Suites seemed depressingly dark and small when we walked in.  It is decorated with those dark brown-and-orange patterns that would make even the newest, cleanest room look kind of shabby and dirty.  The sofa in the living room seemed particularly dingy and saggy.  The bedroom looked better, but -- because the suite seemed rather dingy at first glance -- I inspected the bed and headboard very
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to express your comments. We are happy to say we have recently completed room renovations on some of our floors and will have all floors completely renovated at the start of next year as well as a renovation to our restaurant. We sincerely hope you stay with us again the next time you are in the Anaheim area to experience the new rooms.

Summary: I've stayed at this location multiple times and I've never been let down- The Rooms are huge and give you lots of space.  Thing that are nice about the location of the hotel is it's close to target so you can pick up drinks and snacks . Fridge is in each and every room I've stayed in. Also each and every morning they serve hot breakfast. It's not cheap stuff either they have  a selection of eggs,bacon , juices , pancake and also have a late night manager drink which was nice after a long day at the parks.   I've stayed at both location, Embassy suites north and south. And South is better of two property.   Easy way to get to Disneyland parks. They've now switched from Art to private shuttle which is great news. Old art shuttle use to take 1 hour or longer. and sometimes didn't
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to write your review. We appreciate you staying with us each time you are in the area and are glad you were able to enjoy the amenities we provide to all our guests. We agree we are in a great location close to convenient stores and lots of great restaurants. Thank you again for your review and hope to see you staying back with us real soon.

Summary: When we got to the hotel they had one our room reservations wrong. When I tried to explain the front desk guy was not helpful. My husband went down and asked to see the manager and it was immediately corrected. It was better than what we expected as we had a view of the Disneyland fireworks. The hotel chef worked with my husband to give me a 50th birthday cake on the morning of my birthday and then they did not charge us for it. I will stay at the Embassy Suites any chance I get and will recommend them to any one I can. They were very good to us.

Summary Heading: Great location, nice rooms, very good breakfeast
Summary: This is a standard Embassy Suites hotel. Rooms are well appointed and large. Nicely furnished. Clean. No sign of bed bugs (as others have bemoaned). Food was good. front desk was very helpful. Overall, a good stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has great front desk staff and great service. I love the Embassy Suites chain, but this location is great since its close to Disneyland and you only have to pay a small fee to take the shuttle. I love the breakfast and cocktail hour. It's a great hotel. We had a great view of the Disney fireworks from our room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. The team members here love the Embassy Suites chain just like you do. The love working for a brand that has such great value added amenities for guests and strive to provide matching customer service to get that 5 star review you gave us. Thank you again!!!!

Summary: We took a couple of rooms for three generations of our family, in town for a wedding. The rooms were a good size and the breakfast buffet was especially good for all ages in our party. The dining area was really nice with tables arranged around a series of Koi Ponds in such a way that you were not on top of the next table. The atrium area was safe for our children to use on their own and for them to go down to breakfast on their own as they can be seen from any floor.

Cons: * Air conditioning is extremely noisy.  We had to have it off most of the night, which made the room stuffy and hot. * We were in a Deluxe King Suite.  These are the "best" rooms in the hotel.  Unfortunately, they are by the elevators, and you can hear the elevator machinery running all night.  We were told there were quieter rooms of the same size in the hotel. * Rooms are appointed with low quality furnishings...mostly wood-grain formica.  Looks tacky. *  Sofa-bed has poor quality bed linen. *  Breakfast is mostly unhealthy.  The raising bran, for example, is mostly sugar. *  Workers seem dissatisfied with their

Summary Heading: Bedbug bitten and managers didn't care!
Summary: My family and I usually stay here 4-5 times a year.Everytime we stay at a 4-5 star hotel I check the rooms for bedbugs,cause that's my expertise as a career. On feb,12,2013 we checked in with our children for another fun Disney vacation.This 1was  was far from the truth.After the first day I noticed some bites on my hands,did not think anything about it. 2nd night I woke up to watch some t.v and noticed blood covered pillow case and bites on my head nd blood on sheets(slept on pull out so family would be more comfortable)  I woke up next day took pics and and found blood stains on walls by electrical outlets,boexsprings and mattress of pull out,and on sheets.Went to speak to manager Mi Jo Brown,she was very rude and uncompassionate to my situation.Asked her to refund my my money
Manager Response: Prior to your review, hotel management informed you of the findings from a licensed extermination company that there were absolutely no sign of bed bug activity in the room you stayed in. Please feel free to contact the hotel if you need further clarification.

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disney (pool inoperable at the moment)
Summary: We just spent 5 nights at this hotel and we were pleased. A mere fraction of the DLR hotels, and with free breakfast and evening Happy hours. The rooms are typical for Embassy, and the staff was helpful. no bells and whistles, but none are needed when you spend the whole day at Disney. The pool is undergoing construction but they let you swim at the 2 hotels nearby. Elevators are loud, we we in room 827, and had a perfect view of the DL fireworks.

Summary: We arrived at the hotel on February 14, 2013 around 9:45pm. We checked in and went to our room. The room had a myriad of problems. We had three children with us and just needed to get to sleep.   The first two issues were found pretty quickly. There was 1 sheet for the hide-a-bed. No fitted sheet. No flat sheet. Just 1 big sheet. The lamp was broken and the light bulb was bent out of the socket. Due to the late hour and having to drive another 6 hours the next day, we decided to go to sleep. In the morning, we woke up. The sheet on the hide-a-bed was covering red stains on the mattress pad.   I took pictures and went down to the front desk. I showed the pictures to the gentleman at the front desk. He told me he would waive the $12 parking fee. I asked to speak to the manager. He

Summary Heading: Exceptional facility for both business and pleasure.
Summary: Beautiful lobby, restaurant and lounge area. So quaint with waterfalls, ponds, fish and the lion that awakes every half hour. Complimentary drinks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. The two room suite was much roomier than most with views into the middle of the hotel and outside. We could see the Crystal Cathedral from our room. The staff was wonderful. The meeting/banquet rooms were very well attended to throughout the day. Overall amazing experience, this will be the first hotel I think of staying at in this area again.

Summary: We booked a five night stay here during the week of New Year's Day.  We've stayed at this hotel four times previously, so we're very familiar with the hotel.   We are also Diamond Hilton Honors members.    The great things about our stay:  The breakfast staff is fantastic, as always.  The staff cleaning up the tables and refilling the food are friendly, and efficient.  The omelet station is manned by a very talented chef, who has a fun, quirky personality.  Not enough people were tipping him though--he's going out of his way to provide a great service--tip him!   I utilized the hotel gym every day of this trip, for the first time, and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the equipment, and by how clean it is.    The not-so-great things about our stay:  The animatronic

Summary Heading: Good bang for the buck family hotel near Disneyland.
Summary: Just got back from a Disneyland trip last weekend and we stayed at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South for 3 nights. I booked the hotel as a package through Costco. It is no different from your typical Embassy suites room that offers good value which includes: 1. A decent sized room/suite which is perfect for a family of 4.  2. Breakfast is free, buffet style with omelet cooked to your preference. 3. There is an outside heated pool that is long enough to do lap swimming and it also has a small workout room.  Cons: 1. WiFi is additional charge.  2. Beds are a little soft for me. I prefer nice firm beds.  The hotel is 5-10 minutes drive from Disneyland. It's a little too far to walk especially with kids. They have a shuttle that runs regularly during the day which costs $5 per adult

Summary: I have been to business meetings and training courses at various hotels with this being my first review. The staff here was very attentive, polite, and genuine. The facility was clean and pleasant. The location is on a prime spot with several eating establishments within walking distance. I did not lodge here this time but have in the past. This is definately a place I bring my family to knowing that we would well taken care of.

Summary: Little children who are adventerous can leave room, because of low chain and quiet door. We caught a little child boarding the elevator alone. Block door or don't have that kind of child sleep in the hide a bed by door.

Summary Heading: Nice place for families headed to Disneyland
Summary: This is a nice hotel with wonderful rooms. Clean and comfortable, the corner suites cannot be beat for the views and the peace & quiet. The service here is extraordinary and the proximity to Disneyland is a plus if you are traveling with youngsters. (You'll appreciate the reasonably priced Disneyland shuttle.)  I wouldn't much consider it a great property for business folks as it is really packed with young families. Lots of energetic kids had overfilled the pool and taken over the hot tub. The manager's reception (chips and salsa, snack mix, etc.) was pretty packed every night and the business center was full of unattended teens on all of the computers and on their cell phones. Breakfast was pretty common stuff, typical of an Embassy Suites Hotel.   This was our second stay at
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, breakfast good, rooms nice
Summary: Especially if you are travelling with family, these larger rooms are very nice to have.  The hotel is clean and comfortable, included breakfast every day is a good value and done as nice as I think they can.  If I have any negatives they are small, the hotel now charges $12 per day to park a car, which cost me $24 X 9 because we had 2 cars between our three rooms, and the elevators are often very busy and a little slow, especially in the morning!  Otherwise, great location, easy drive to Disneyland or shuttle bus (also extra charge), or a fairly long walk but do-able, good choices for dinners close by.

Summary Heading: The staff made my wife feel like a princess.
Summary: My wife and I came to Anaheim for the Disney experience.  She was elated with the room quality and the way the staff catered to our every need.  My wife was disabled and in poor health, but the staff made everything so easy for her that she hardly needed any of her pain medications.  I am so grateful to the staff at there.  The concierge gave her the grand tour of the facility and made sure she was aware of all the things available to her.
Manager Response: We are elated to hear that we were able to make your wife's Disney experience wonderful for her. One of our  priorities  is to make sure those vacations to the Magic Kingdom are just that.....magical.   Thank you for your review and for staying with us.

Summary: I prefer Embassy Suites hotel and like this one too. Very friendly staff. I was there between Christmas and New Years and understand this is a very busy time....yet, the service was still very personable. Great location if you are there for Disneyland stuff.The 'Managers Receptions' were impressive where they offer the snacks and drinks. Highly recommended for families. Only negative thing is they charge for parking.

Summary Heading: Good for families, awful for kidless grown ups.
Summary: This place is nothing like other Embassy Suites I've stayed at. If you want to pay for parking, pay for wi-fi (I haven't had to do this in at least 5 years,) pay for the shuttle to Disneyland and listen to children screaming at all hours of the night, this is your place. The price is deceiving because they nickle and dime you. The shuttle cost more than taking a cab. Maybe on a higher floor you can sleep past six am, but I stayed on the fourth floor and was woken up bright and early by screaming kids having breakfast every single day... and don't forget the animatronic lion that roars. The paper thin walls let me actually discern conversations from the rooms next to mine.. and don't forget the screaming kids in there too. They say non-smoking but I picked up a cigarette butt
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. I am sorry your first visit to our location was during the holidays as it is a busy time of year in Anaheim. We do hope if your travels bring you back to our area that you give us another try. We would love to back as our guest and regain your confidence in our hotel.

Summary Heading: Great experience every day for the week I stayed there

I wish I could remember some of their names.   Our bellboy was the most helpful person there whos never failing good naturedness while going about his work set the tone for the stay. The rest of the staff was great too. The omelete bar was fantastic and the chef become an institution of himself while turning out delicious omletes as fast as you can order them.

Summary: Family of four stayed for 4 days and the did the "disney thing" No complaints at all....staff are great  Shuttle bus works and keeps to time  Rooms clean comfortable.....stretcher bed um um um perhaps not the best option  Well worth it and will come again

Summary: This is the second time we have stayed at this property.  The staff are still exceptional and are very guest oriented. The pool is still nice - but the hot tub is small and was not the cleanest. The shuttle to Disneyland was fantastic.  Picked you up literally outside the front door and the drivers were very helpful.  But note - this is not part of the ART (AnaheimResort Transit) its a private hotel shuttle.  So make sure you buy the proper passes. The 'Managers Receptions' were not

Summary: I have  to start by saying this was the first trip ever where I felt completely comfortable with my kids at a hotel. I never once was made to feel uneasy because they were there. Having 3 boys (6,8,14) and we do not get vacations very often, they get pretty wound up when we do. This hotel was VERY family friendly.  Even with it being Christmas week and it felt like just about every family across the country was in this hotel, everything ran very smooth, the staff knew what they were doing and just did it, including the front desk, breakfast, janitorial, hostess, door man ( I was greeted with a big HI every entry and exit).  Also with it being very very busy, I never waited on anything...check-in (maybe 5 minutes), breakfast (maybe 2 minute), check-out (0 minutes). .  I loved the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed in this hotel in December 2012 with my mom and 2 kids for 2 nights, and it was fantastic! The beds were really comfortable, and the room was really nice and updated. The complimentary breakfast was great, although the lines do get long during peak times. It was really nice to have a mini kitchen as well, we could easily have spent an entire week there. It was a little pricy, so I don't recommend it to anyone who doesn't plan on actually taking advantage of all the ammenitites, there are cheaper hotels in the area fine for just sleeping. But if I'm ever in the area for awhile and need a nice hotel, I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place for family trip to Disneyland
Summary: I live in Southern California but I'm about an hour from Disneyland so we frequently stay here with our kids when we visit the parks.  While there are advantages to staying at one of the Disney resorts, they are typically a lot more expensive than the Embassy Suites.  I have tried several of the hotels around Disneyland and this is my favorite.  I like it because the rooms are large (actual suites) and you get a good free breakfast to give you energy for a 15 hour day at the mouse house.  The city has a shuttle that stops here but after using that once, I now drive to the park - the one time I used the shuttle we waited around an hour for a shuttle back.

Summary Heading: Good value for the Disneyland area
Summary: We spent four nights here between Christmas and New Year's, a very busy time of year in the Disneyland area. We were pretty satisfied with the Embassy Suites. It seemed to be well prepared to deal with the influx of holiday visitors. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful when we asked for area information.  Pluses: --Great shower, lots of hot water --Good breakfast, lots of selections (but arrive early and wear your jacket, at least in December) --Reasonably quiet, although the Embassy Suites design with the central atrium is always a problem. This hotel has a water feature (running artificial stream) that supplies some helpful white noise. --Comfortable king bed --Friendly staff --Shuttle leaves every half-hour during the day for a dropoff at Disneyland.  Minuses
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here from 12/25 to 12/31.  Was surprised at the $12 per day parking, what a rip off!  The other Embassy Suites North doesn't charge for parking.  Also the shuttle is expensive, $5 per person, but you can use it all day, if you want to come back to the hotel to rest from Disneyland.  The lines for the made to order hot breakfasts can get long, but I guess it was because of the Christmas holidays.  They have a manager's reception where you can get free drinks, popcorn, chex mix and buy pizza by the slice for $3.  Rooms have a refrigerator and a microwave and there is a washer and dryer on some of the floors.  Overall we were satisfied, but wish they didn't charge for parking and felt that was a total rip off.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for visiting Disneyland and California Adventures

Summary: First, the service here was excellent. The staff took great pains to be sure that I was happy with my experience. I was called by the front desk to ask if I was content. The second floor has a partially obstructed view due to palm trees. The fireworks display is literally right behind the palm trees. I asked the front desk for a higher room but they did not have one, as they were all booked.   A hotel close to Disneyland is a problem if you do not like a busy place. Summary: We've stayed twice at this hotel and have had excellent experiences both times. The staff is friendly & helpful. We love the free breakfast and the manager's reception --aka free happy hour. I'm not a drinker but the Margaritas and Mai Tai's were yummy! The rooms were very clean & spacious. Besides all of the aforementioned, I really loved the atrium with the roaring lion. It makes for a very fun hotel. It is a little bit away from Disney but there is a shuttle that buses back and forth often. The only issue I found that someone may have is that the room we were in this time (424) was very close to the elevator & we could hear it going up and down --if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room away from the elevator. Summary Heading: A great kid friendly hotel for visiting Disneyland
Summary: I am really glad we stayed here!  We were here for 4 nights to visit Disneyland.  The rooms were nice and had enough room for our family of 4 (two kids under 10). The mattress on the sofa sleeper is typically thin, so our oldest was not interested in sleeping on it.  Our youngest was small enough that they did not notice it.  The rooms were quiet.  I barely heard any noise from our neighbors, only when something hit the wall once or twice. Summary Heading: Second time around and just as great as the first!

Leslie at the front desk was awesome!  Every breakfast was fantastic!  Eggs made to order by a friendly and courteous chef who politely keep the lines in order as to expedite the process.
