I got a really good deal on the room including breakfast.  The room was very nice and clean.  The breakfast offered was excellent for a complimentary breakfast including oatmeal which is my favorite breakfast food.  It was only a short walk from the Hyatt Garden Grove which was very convenient for me.  I would recommend this hotel for families in the area for business or leisure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked through Hotels.com and thought we got a great deal considering all of the advertised extras and the proximity to Disney Land.  King Suite room was perfect for our family of 4 (6 yo and Infant).  Breakfast was adequate and evening snacks were nice too.  Shuttle to DL was packed in the am and some were often left behind, but one left every half hour, so no big inconvenience considering the price tag. Staff was great and helpful, especially when we we're done with DL and wanted to do something else. There's a Starbucks in the Hotel next door, and a Target in the next block.  Lots of family friendly restaurants in the near vicinity.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worth the shuttle to the park
Summary: We stayed her just this past week. It was about a mile away from the park, so we took the shuttle ($5) for each day that covered to and from the park. I think my toddler was less. What we loved most though was the full breakfast each morning. We weren't hungry again until 2pm. They offered everything from scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast, pastries and toast, oatmeal, and cereal. You could even have a made to order omelet. I'd definitely stay there again. It was a perfect set-up for my small family of four.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A very nice place to stay with the grandkids
Summary: We stayed four days at Embassy Suites in Anaheim. We were in town, of course, to see Disneyland. The staff at the Embassy Suites was excellent. The room was nice, on the plan of most Embassy Suite rooms. The bed was comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean and the sheets were fresh.  I did not feel weird about taking my shoes off and walking around.  The only thing u would say is the floor in the cafeteria needs a good scrub and the drain needs to be cleaned out....moldy food is not something you want to look at while eating breakfast.  However the breakfast itself was good and the managers reception was a nice treat!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The first time the lion roared, the grandaughters eyes got hugh!  On a rock outcropping in the diningroom was an automated lion which lifted it's head and roared hourly.  Fun.  I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel.  Newly remodeled, clean, effecient, and all the staff were friendly and helpful.  Our Disneyland experience was made all that much more enjoyable by our stay at Embassy Suites.  Breakfast was great.  Fresh and tasty.  We enjoyed the happy hour the one nite we weren't in the Park.  The bus was really convient...door to door all day long.  Would stay with them again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your reveiw. It is special to be able to walk around the hotel and see the children's faces when Miehana, our ion in the lobby, roars and to watch them wave good bye to her when they leave.

Summary Heading: Gluten Free welcome at Embassy Suites
Summary: We are a family with Celiac and food sensitivities. As a mom with two young children, traveling is especially challenging. Last week we took on Disney and chose the Embassy Suites Anaheim South for accommodations due to the fact the rooms have kitchens. Much to our surprise, we were met by the Executive Chef  who welcomed us with a gluten, dairy and egg free meal. It was amazing! The next morning he even made us special gluten free pancakes! Disney can include Embassy Suites Anaheim South in their list of happiest places on earth! Thank you!
Manager Response: We understand how stressful it can be traveling so we are absolutely thrilled we were able to help with your specific needs while on vacation. Our chef takes great pride in his work and is dedicated to continuing his education in the culinary field. Thank you for your review and comments.

Summary: We stayed for 4 night's and really didn't want to leave. The staff are incredible, they cant do enough for you. The managers reception is brilliant as is the huge complementary breakfast. We ate at the hotel every night as it was so reasonably priced. Its conveniently located with a Disney shuttle that pulls up outside the main entrance. The rooms are fantastic, large, clean with a Very comfortable bed. Don't think about it. If you're going to Disneyland, this is the place for you! We can't wait to return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have stayed at this hotel many times with kids...really works for us!  Spacious rooms, close to Disneyland whether walking, shuttling or driviing.  Fun atmosphere, pleasant staff and excellent breakfast to get the day started right.  Breakfast, Disneyland, back to pool/hot tub for recharge...Disneyland for nighttime!!  Dinner here was fine also.  Will return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really convenient location - if you do not want to use the shuttle provided by the hotel at $5 per day, go to the Residence Inn a couple of doors down and get the 3 or 5 day ART pass for slightly less. The ART shuttles run just about the same as the hotel shuttle does and takes you closer to the actual gates of Disneyland - less walking for those of you who are stroller-bound or walking is difficult. The breakfast was healthy and filling - line ups could be large if you don't get down early, but the food was good. The bed in the bedroom was comfy (so says my travel companion); the sofa bed was far less comfy but ..... it's a sofa bed!!! The staff was helpful and friendly. Very close to Target, clothing and shoe shopping, the liquor store and several great restaurants.  Overall a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice stay of 6 nights for our family. Found our room to be very clean and roomy. We had a room with bed and a pullout couch. Housekeeping did a really good job of keeping the room nice during our stay. Found all the employees to be friendly and very helpful with any questions we had. The breakfasts were much better than we expected with something for all tastes. The omelettes were really good. A shuttle bus takes you to disneyland from right in front of the hotel.We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again with no hesitation. A very nice place to stay for a family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Let me start by saying the hotel is clean and the staff are freindly.  Like other Embassy Suites a nice breakfast and cocktail hour are included which adds value. What supprised me when we arrived was the fact that they charge $12 per day for parking. On top of that they do offer a shuttle service to Disney Land but that is another $5 per person. This definitly took away from the overall value of this hotel. When we stay again I will be looking for a hotel with a free shuttle service and free parking. On top of the $12 per day parking, my rental car was damaged in the parking lot (which I understand is not the hotels fault). I really would prefer to have a hotel disclose all charges up front rather than hooking a guest with a good price then adding other charges such as parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a blast staying here!! The free breakfast in the morning was amazing and wonderful when you have 3 kids and 3 adults it saved us a ton of money! It was fun going down there to eat then hopping on the shuttle to go to Disneyland :) we always made it back for the managers reception!! Open bar for two hours and snacks! So so fun!! I will defiantly be staying at Ebassy Suites again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: we stayed At this hotel when we went to Disneyland. Hotel offers a cheap shuttle to the Park and an amazing buffet or cook to order breakfast included every morning. Manager's reception every night with free drinks and snacks for the whole family.  Rooms are spacious with a separate living room with a pull out hide a bed. Only thing that bothered me was the fake lion in the hotel that roared every half hour or so...was a bit noisy during the night when you were trying to sleep.  Parking stalls were also very tiny for the price you paid for it every day. Other than that...we would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Little bit out dated. Rooms were clinically looking. Noisy elevator. Breakfast was good, managers reception was okay, but the floors around the indoor garden were uneven. Your table could be sloping, and your drinks tilting. People were very friendly, but the 1 mile to Disneyalnd is stretching it. Make it 1 1/2 miles at best.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South several times. We should have written a review already! The employees are very kind and helpful. The rooms are quite large and have microwaves and fridges. Their breakfast includes everything you need to start your day and the waterfall and the lion in the breakfast area are nice extras. We even saw the Disney fireworks from our room on our recent stay which was something we weren't expecting. I would recommend this hotel to anybody visiting the Anaheim area. The location is excellent.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Unbelievable service from Executive Chef Rick Garcia!!!!
Summary: I have stayed at several properties in Anaheim before.  But what made this hotel stand out among the rest was Executive Chef Garcia and his staff at the hotel's restaurant. I have a son who has severe food allergies.  We bring his meals with us whenever we eat out.  Since this was his first time out of the country, I was worried about what he could eat.  After I booked the stay at the hotel (which includes buffet breakfast), I called them up to find out what my son could eat for breakfast given his allergies.  The hotel operator took my number down and said that the chef would call me back.  Ya right! I thought to myself. I didn't think hotels did that.  But Executive Chef Rick Garcia did SO MUCH MORE than that.  He came up with menu ideas for each day we stayed at the hotel -
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed in this hotel many times. My wife and I bring our kids here, or come with friends, or groups of family. We are Annual Pass-holders at Disneyland and visit many times a year. The staff is always courteous, go above and beyond to take care of the guests, and there are many perks such as the Business Center, pool, and our favorite, the breakfast buffet.  When you are traveling you want to eliminate hassle and time consuming tasks and having all of your guests be able to get breakfast at their own leisure during the mornings is fantastic. And this is no continental breakfast. There is something there for everyone. All hot, fresh, and cooked to order including omelettes. And if you are health conscious like me you appreciate the fruit, yougurt, toast, and cereal.  One
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose this hotel because we had a great experience in 2007, and I have to say, it's just getting better all the time! The comfy rooms, the breakfast buffet with made to order omelets, the sparkling pool, the huge towels... all these are amazing. But their crown jewel has to be their staff! We met a young bellman named Miguel who happily lugged a vanload of stuff up to our 12th floor room, and then demurred when I tried to tip him, saying my husband already took care of it. The next day he was at the desk when I was buying tickets for the shuttle bus to Disneyland, and he must have noticed I was sweating pretty freely in the heat. I went out to the stop to wait for the bus, and he came out a minute later with six (6!) packets of premoistened towelettes for me! We all used them
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the second time we stayed here for our visit to Disneyland.  The location is great becuase it's close to a Target, Walgreens and numerous eating places.  The shuttle service the hotel uses to DL changed from our last stay and we didn't like it as much.  It was more expensive ($5/per adult per day and $2/per child per day) and they don't offer multi day discounts.  The shuttle going to DL will pick you up in front of the hotel at 15 and 45 after the hour.  The drop off at DL is close to Harbor Blvd so it's a longer walk to the gate.  (The other shuttle dopped you off/picked up closer to the gate).  I have a young child so this made a big difference.  The pick up location is the same with the shuttle arriving on the hour and 1/2 hour going back to the hotel.  The shuttles
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly staff, beautiful interior decoration, very convenient for a family vacation in Disneyland.  A very quiet hotel, as it is not located directly on a main road. The hotel shuttle to Disneyland, though not free, is very convenient and recommended to be used. The pricing is a bit high, considering the basic fee, the non free Internet charge (which is being charged per device connected and not per room) and the shuttle price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites the night before checking into a Disney resort.  It was beautiful, clean, and the staff very pleasant.  The price was less than the Disney Good Neighbor hotels and much nicer.  I wouldn't recommend staying here if visiting Disneyland is your prime reason for being in the area since it is too far to walk.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect, if you don't have to sleep on sleeper sofa
Summary: The hotel was wonderful with one exception ill get to later. It was close to Disneyland, would not walk it though. The lights take forever so it would take a long time. The hotel is nice, clean, the breakfast was great. Staff very friendly and even room service noticed we used a lot of towels and left us more which was nice.The only issue I had was my husband and I slept on the sofa sleeper and the mattress, or shall I say spring board was horrible. I felt like I had spring in my back the whole night and got absolutely no sleep. Considering how tired you are after a full day/night at Disneyland all I wanted was a good nights sleep to be energized in the morning, and I didn't get it. So I was not happy about that, but thank goodness I had two extra blankets (for viewing fireworks
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Most AWESOME hotel in the area!!
Summary: WE LOVE Embassy Suites on Harbor!!!!  I have been a Disney fan for as long as I can remember and when I had kids and found out about Embassy Suites on Harbor it made Disneyland just that much more enjoyable!!!!  I haven't been to Disneyland in about a year but every time I go back, we are recognized and welcomed back to the hotel with a smile!!!  We are planning another trip December 26th-28th for my son's 6th birthday (he's a New Year's Eve baby!) and I am truly excited to be staying at Embassy Suites again :)  The twinkle my son gets in his eyes when looking at the fish in the Koi pond and the anticipation of waiting for the Lion to roar, the amazing breakfast that we get each morning and the fun times we spend in the pool, the cocktails my husband gets in the evenings and the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for our 4 day trip to Disneyland.  The "free" breakfast" is disgusting - yellow stuff to which they add water, stir and call scrambled eggs and brown stuff, again just add water and call sausages.  The rooms were clean, absolutely no complaints about them.  The shuttle?  On our early morning we waited for the shuttle and it didn't come!  The staff had no explanation but we had to take a taxi!  If there are four of you it is less expensive to get a taxi to Disneyland.  A day pass from the resort is $5 each.  A taxi is $12 with tip for 4 or 5 people.  I don't like having to stand up the whole trip on the shuttle (seniors).  Next time we will stay closer to Disneyland, somewhere where they have free wi-fi and an edible breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place for a family trip to Disneyland, etc
Summary: Very happy with this hotel. Close to Disneyland. The buffet breakfast was great. The rooms were spacious & comfy. Unfortunately the sofa bed was a bit tired but the kids didn't seem to mind. There are a reasonable amount of eating options nearby & some shopping options (sports store, t-shirt place, Target)  Would use this hotel again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, except for the food poisoning
Summary: This is an excellent choice for visiting the Disneyland Resort. The PCA shuttle drivers go above and beyond, but I agree that it is a bit of a hike out to the drop-off/pick-up area. The rooms are large, comfortable, clean, and obviously updated recently. Housekeeping service each day was exceptionally prompt which is much appreciated with small children who need to come back for a rest early in the afternoon.  Our rooms on floor 12 were well away from the noise of the elevators and roaring lion. We used the guest laundry facilities and everything worked well.  It is great that there are washing facilities on floors 3, 6, and 9. The ice/vending areas are convenient and well stocked.The parking situation is just fine. If you find the spaces in front too small, there are lots of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We regret to hear that you had gotten ill during your stay with us as this is the first time we are hearing about it. After receiving your review, we performed a thorough investigation of the situation. During the time you were with us, we had served hundreds of people each day during our breakfast period, which is the case on most days, and we have not received any negative feedback or anyone stating they became ill. So we cannot substantiate that was the source of your illness. Even though the hotel has received an “A” rating from the Orange County Health Department, which is the highest rating you can receive, we will continue to monitor the situation.

Summary: As usual, great stay at Embassy.  Manager's reception was quick and breakfast was fast too.  Nice pool, nice location.  Room great.  One mile from Disneyland.  Only issue was the crowds at Disneyland, wow.  It was very crowded at both parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our go-to hotel for Disneyland vacations.  As usual our room was clean and ready when we arrived.  Front desk staff was always friendly and helpful.  We usually get a standard room, but upgraded to a Disney facing room this time.   Our kids usually don't make it very late in the park, and we wanted to see the fireworks.  Loved the big window and view of the fireworks!  Only draw back was the rooms are right off the elevator.  In fact our room was about 3-4 feet from elevator.   Luckily we were there to sleep after a long day at Disneyland, so the kids feel asleep quickly and the noise from the elevators wasn't a problem.  We LOVE the matresses in this hotel.  We always feel like we get such a good nights sleep here.   Breakfast was fabulous as usual! Pancakes, french
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your loyalty to our hotel and glad to hear you had another fantastic stay. We do have great restaurants nearby however, our executive chef is putting the final touches on a new menu for our restaurant. I hope you will give it a try the next time your travels bring you back to our area. We look forward to hopefully seeing you soon!!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay. Staff was awesome
Summary: My husband and I stayed here on our recent trip to Disneyland and we loved the Embassy! The staff was super friendly and very helpful. When we checked in we had the best experience the clerk that checked us in was great. The breakfast each morning was terrific and offered a lot of variety. The room was very clean and so spacious. We tried room service which was great!  I would suggest an Embassy Suite in any city but the staff here went above and beyond. Great place to stay, we will be back!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for our trip to disneyland rooms are nice and big. The furniture is dated but clean and in good repair.   It's about 15 minutes on the shuttle to disneyland.   We will likely pick somewhere a little closer to the park next time. The shuttles can get very crowded and standing in a moving shuttle after 10hours of walking is not enjoyable while holding a tired 4 year old.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I went by ourselves to Disneyland and other attactions. We chose this hotel because of all the great reviews. The hotel staff were all fantastic. The manager get together was good as the manager went out of his way to make you feel welcome and at home. The buffet breakfast included was awsome. We didn't have to have a lunch just snacks. We would recommend this hotel and we have to everyone. Thanks again for a great stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here Sep. 21 - 25 and loved it.  We are a family of 2 adults and 2 kids (9 & 7) and we did Disney 3 days and rented a car one day to go to the beach and Hollywood, etc.  The bed was very comfortable and the kids seemed to think the sofa be was comfortable as well.  The lobby was nice and tropical and the kids liked to watch the fish and walk through the trees.  Check in and out were quick and easy.  The breakfast was wonderful and much more than any other free breakfast I have had anywhere.  The Embassy will now be my choice of chains when in the US if possible.   I loved having the separate bedroom with our own TV so the kids could go to sleep and we would watch TV, have a drink and get some room service.  We also used the free evening social hour twice since we were
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your review. We are glad to hear you had an excellent stay overall except for the rental car. I apologize for the incident as I can understand how frustrating it can be to have to wait unnecessarily, especially when you are excited and ready to see the sites . Rest assure your comments will be shared with that departement and addressed. Thank you again for staying with us and choosing the Embassy Suites for future stays.

Summary: I was rerouted here by another nearby overbooked hotel that I attended a conference at.  The rooms were very spacious and had a door to separate the sleeping area from the living area.  The room was equiped with a sofa, dining table, refrigerator, micro and a wet bar.  We made sure to stop in for the complimentary happy hour on our way up to our room each eve.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious and had much to offer from made to order omelets, cereal, yogurt, fruit, pancakes, bacon, sausage, potatoes. All for FREE!  (I am sure you pay for it somewhere) but hey!  The lobby area had a tropical decor which is great to come back to if visiting the Disney parks.  I plan to stay here again during my next trip to Disneyland since I like to go often.  It may be a few minutes
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here from 12th sept 12 until 26th and loved every second. The staff are so pleasant and welcoming every day, room was spotless and spacious. Breakfast buffet was fantastic and all the staff clearing tables quickly. The area is pleasant and we walked to disney several times, we did catch the shuttle too, no problems. On our next trip to california in 2014 we will be back! Thank you for making our stay enjoyable. Oh also we were on the twelve floor right next to elevators which did not bother us at all , especially after a busy day!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at the Embassy in earlier this month and we did not want to leave.  Maggie check us in quickly and was kind to put us on a higher floor.  She was professional, kind and very helpful.  The suite was quite large, clean and very comfortable.  Next came Paul, the Bell Captain, who helped us with our luggage.  You could tell he liked his job and was very helpful and asked us everyday when we came back from Disneyland if we had a good day!  You will know who he is....great smile!  The breakfast was fabulous and offered just about everything and then some.  Priscilla is the greeter at breakfast and here again, another wonderful employee.  She greets you with a smile, makes sure you get a table and helps you with any special requests.  You can tell that
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there with my Son his WIfe and two of our Grandchildren Sept 17 - Sept 20.  It is a beautiful facility very near to Disneyland.  The shuttle service to the park was excellent.  The breakfast each morning was also excellent.  It was very nice to be able to get a good breakfast at the start of a busy day with no hassle.  It was also a treat to return to a relaxed atmosphere at he end of the day! All of the staff were very courteous and very accomodating!  A special thanks to Maggie D. and Josephine L. for making us feel so welcome!!  Cal & Marsi M.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I went with my mom and my dad  to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South, we went from September 11 trough September 15,and it's was excellent,the service,the attention,etc.It's was a great experiencie,there's only  1 thing.We where in the 10th floor and there was some noise ,i think was the elevator,but afterall,it was great,grat breakfast,one day panckaes ,the next day french toast ,was very good.I recommend this hotel.Hope you enjoy my pictures.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: a very good hotel close to Disneyland - no free WIFI
Summary: We are a family of 6 and had a wonderfull tim in Disneyland. The hotel is very comfortable, clean and well maintained. The suite was very spacious. We enjoyed breakfast, although it is recommended having it very early in the morning since it is very crowded later (we stayed at August). We also liked the pool. A very comfortable shuttle takes you to Disneyland and thus you can avoid wasting time in parking the car and using the tram. My only remark is that the hotel should stop view wifi usage as a luxery and charge money for it.     it is also charged on a single device (pc) based and very uncomfortable for tourists.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed in room 402.  Smelled like dirty feet when I first walked into the room but it is not dirty - I think the odor is from the water feature in the lobby.  The floors are open to the lobby below, very nice looking hotel. The room is quite large, has all of the expected amenities, comfortable. I stayed here one night for business and was too tired to explore the hotel but enjoyed the complimentary reception from 5:30 - 7:30 (free cocktails, popcorn and veggies/dip) There is a free breakfast beginning at 6:30 but I didn't have time to enjoy it.    I'd stay here again!
Manager Response: We hope you are able to come back soon for a leisurely trip next time and experience all the hotel, and the area, has to offer.

Summary: We absolutely loved the Embassy at Disneyland!  Great Breakfast w/ omletts made to order.  Walking distance from Disneyland, about 30-45 mins.   Great front desk staff.  I wish they would have been a little more descriptive about the bus that goes to disney, because we missed it. ... and walked. BUT, we made it there and took the bus back.  The pool and hot tub were perfect.  The business center was very clean & the internet was fast.  I did NOT have any luck printing out school documents from my college website though.  They really should take off the internet firewalls & allow for any educational pages to be viewed & printed.  I could view the documents just couldn't print them.  It was just powerpoint!  Otherwise, PERFECT!  LOVED our housekeeper!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay with us. We apologize for the problem in printing from the business center but wish you luck on your presentation.

Summary: We felt welcome from the moment we set foot in this hotel. Great for families and the Managers reception was popular for the adult drinks and the children's snacks. The location was within walking distance to Disneyland but this information was not given out freely as booking a bus or car was encouraged to support local business. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant as their was better value for money at the Italian restaurant just meters from the hotels front door and a couple of kilometers down the road other family friendly restaurants were available. We could not find any shopping and if you don't like to walk to dinner or more than 2 kilometers then you would need to access transport to Disneyland and dinner. The breakfast buffet was full of typical American breakfast
Manager Response: We are glad you had an enjoyable stay. Being one mile from Disneyland, we are the closest Embassy Suites to the park.  We found that after a long day at Disneyland, guests do not want to make the mile walk back, so we have seen they prefer to use the shuttle service that picks up right in front of our hotel and takes our guests to Disneyland. Also, our new executive chef is putting the finishing touches on our new menu for the restaurant and we are excited to roll it out shortly. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Great Value, Safe Area, Clean Rooms, Free Breakfast
Summary: My new husband and I spent 6 nights here recently in celebration of our Honeymoon. At first I was a little nervous about the reviews we had read, but as soon as we arrived to the hotel, we knew we had picked the right place! The hotel obviously prides itself on being clean. The lobby was spotless, and the woman who checked us in had a smile on her face, and congratulated us on getting married. We had Suite 920 which is on level 9, right in the middle of the hotel. What a view!  We were greeted with champagne and strawberries when we opened the door, and the suite was very clean and spacious. There is a living room with 2 sofas, a dining room table, flat screen tv, fridge, microwave, counter space and nice, simple decor. The bedroom was spacious and clean and had floor to ceiling
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had our all class 1970's reunion here they offered a block of rooms for a very good price! We had the main Ballroom very nice, clean everyone so nice. The food was good and you have got to see the lobby with the animated lion at the top of falls!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your reunion. Glad to hear you had a wonderful time. We do love our lion, Miehana (Anaheim spelled backwards), as do the children...especially when she roars as she does every half hour between 8am-8pm everyday.

Summary: This was a great stay for my husband and two year old as we visited Disneyland. The convenient shuttle to Disneyland was really helpful! The room was clean, although looked vastly different from the online pictures. The breakfast buffet was amazing and definitely has a selection that will make anyone happy! We also really enjoyed the manager's reception--popcorn always makes everyone happy. The hotel is just beautiful and our daughter loved the atrium with the fish!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall had a nice stay in early August - typical older Embassy Suites with breakfast & manager's reception.  Of course very crowded with families so it was noisy but that is to be expected at an Embassy Suites during peak season.  Good:  suite with lots of room, great breakfast buffet and omelets, yummy spicy snack mix during mgr's reception, fitness center, business center, shuttle is only for Embassy Suites/Hampton.  Not so good:  elevators were slow, one broke down and could see a woman and child trapped inside for 30 minutes.  Shuttle did not have A/C one day and it was sweltering - but they used a better bus the next day.  Shuttle drop off/pick up point at Disney is far (by Harbor Blvd). Buffet is set up so you can only get food from one side and you have to wait in a line
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 8 nights in late August and based on our experience we would highly recommend this hotel.  Booked airfare and hotel package through Expedia.com as it was actually cheaper than purchasing separately via the airline and hotel websites.  Chose this location because it has a Disney shuttle ($4/adult; $1/child for day passes which are sold at Front Desk and NOT from the driver), complimentary breakfast and all rooms are suites (kids shared the sofabed).  We did not need a rental car for the 5 days we visited D'land and found the shuttle to be punctual and relatively clean.  Takes less than 10 min. to get to D'land from the hotel.  On our first day the morning shuttle was standing room only but on subsequent days there was more than one shuttle bus.  It picks up guests at
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We are extremely gald to hear that we were able to make your stay enjoyable. During the summer, we have been evaluating the snacks we provide during our Manager's Reception and we are excited to say we have introduced new snacks this week and have gotten great reviews on them. We hope you will stay with us again and let us know what you think.

Summary: We stayed here for two nights while visiting Disneyland.   Overall, it's the usual Embassy Suites experience; however, it's quite clear that because of its proximity to Disneyland, this hotel doesn't have to work very hard to attract guests. There was nothing particularly wrong with our stay, but it wasn't memorable either. Dishes for breakfast and the manager's reception are plastic, which while unpleasant makes sense considering the number of children at the property. However, drinking coffee from styrofoam cups has a very cheap feeling to it, and paper cups would be much better for the environment too. Never saw a waiter during breakfast or the evening reception either.  To take the shuttle to Disneyland, be sure to buy your tickets at the front desk. We hadn't been told
Manager Response: none

Summary: Embassy Suites offer a very uniform experience among all of their hotels. We got exactly what we expected with a couple of disappointments:  Lines for breakfast were ridiculously long. The omelet chef was far more interested in telling us about his years as a surgical assistant than actually cooking.   Hotel was overrun with a Pop Warner league from Oakland. Multiple calls to guest services yielded no relief from noise, running up and down the halls, playing on the elevators, spitting off the atrium walkways, throwing things from said walkways.   Overall, an average experience. Good location, excellent housekeeping staff.

Summary: This is a nice hotel about a mile from Disneyland. We used this hotel to visit many different areas in So. Ca. Most employees were very nice to deal with in this hotel. The front desk staff always greeted us with a hello and a smile when returning in the evening. Our room was on the 12th floor near the elevator facing Disney. We had a great view of the fireworks everynight. The room was mostly clean and spacious and we very rarely heard elevator noise. Our room on checkin we found the bedsheets and bedspread were not clean and informed the front desk. Housekeeping was there in 10 mins to change to fresh sheets and bedspread. They greeted us with a smile and hello but failed to realise we could understand spanish and overheard them calling us liars. From that point on we did not
Manager Response: none

Summary: I earned a free night and thought to try this hotel out since it was close to Disneyland and we wanted to get into Cars Land early. Don't let the "Garden Grove" location fool you, it is 1 mile from Disneyland, just a 5 minute drive and they also have shuttle service. The only thing I was disappointed with was one clerk at check-in and no one at the Hilton Honors check-in line. None the less, we got a 2 room suite that was huge! Perfect for a larger family with lots of space.  The free hot breakfast was great and omlette chef was a hoot! Great place to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We traveled to Disney this season and stayed at this Embassy Suites.  The hotel staff was friendly and we got to know one of the Bellman well.  The hotel room was clean and always serviced promptly.  We went at the peak of the season and found the crowds were oppressive.  The shuttle too and from Disney and the breakfast bar were always packed which created comptetition between guests for seats and tables.  At the end of the day it was a good choice for our family of 5.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Overbooked and tried to move us to another hotel!
Summary: Went for celebrating college graduation with my mother. We had arrived earlier and weren't allowed to check in, so we decided to leave our luggage and go enjoy our day at the parks while we could. We come back after our day, and they tell us they only have one king bedroom left and overbooked the double queen rooms like we had previously booked months ago. The desk clerk tried to offer us to move to ANOTHER hotel at 11:00 p.m. At night!!!!! She basically had no other solution than to either give us the room or move to another hotel down the street! The manager came over and have us a giftcard hoping to solve the problem with that, which is completely beyond the point. If "the computer overbooks your hotel" then FIX THAT PROBLEM! Could have completely been avoided. Also, the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great place to stay,good value.
Summary: Our family enjoyed staying at this hotel it was very clean, great housekeeping and staff in general went out of their way to help.Rooms near the lifts experience a bit of noise, and the pool outside our window was noisy with kids till really late, but nothing that would not make me stay again.Breakfast was great and happy hour was even better our family experienced a lovely time at this hotel and I would recommend this place to anyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are staying in this hotel for Disney well its perfect, its perfect for kids and the rooms are brilliant for families with 2 seprate sleeping area's I would definetley take children and be more than happy with my choice, its about 40 minutes drive to LA although thats on a good run! But is great for location, you can go down to downtown disney in the evenings or the other little shopping area, which had lots of restraunts. Universal is about an hour away but WELL worth it!! Disney is around the corner and is brilliant make sure you buy tickets before you go! Breakfast - TIP get up early, or be prepared for a monsterous queue for your breakfast from about 8am onwards!! ROOMS - Excellent spacious, and just lovely !

Summary Heading: Don't count on what they say...
Summary: I prepaid my 3 night visit online for a basketball tournament. Not knowing how far we would advance in the tournament, the front desk confirmed that if we needed to check out early, it would be fine, that it "happens all the time"..... credit are given within 24-72 hours. Not the case, friends. Even after everyone I spoke to (front desk, accounting, Net Direct Sales, accounting - again) confirmed that I would receive a credit, it's not happening! Now they are claiming I agreed to the terms and conditions and that the prepayment was non-refundable. (Who reads all that fine print anyway?!?!?!) Well, I will NEVER EVER stay at a Hilton Hotel again.   Oh? and the "free" breakfast. Ew~ it was barely edible. We had to go out to eat afterwards because we couldn't even eat the food.

Summary: We enjoyed the room, clean and comfortable. The morning breakfast is like rush hour in a major city, you have to jockey for a position especially if you have several children under the age of 9. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My only other concern was the distance to Disney. Online it touts 1mile....more like two when walking. The parking fees and transportations fees were annoying, but the hotel claimed it was out of their hands, "it's run by the city".
Manager Response: none

Summary: I admit, I'm usually inclined to stay at the big name hotels whenever on vacation, Hilton, Hyatt, Sheraton, etc.  But as we were researching hotels for the Disneyland area, Embassy Suites Anaheim South (a Hilton hotel) came up with good and mediocre reviews.  So our group decided to give them a try.  Our overall stay was good.  Check-in was fast and non-eventful, even being early prior to their 3PM check-in times.  Our room was clean.  No crumbs, beds made, bathroom clean, etc.  Size of the room was nice.  We had a living room with a pull out sofa and table to eat for 5 people, faucet outside the bathroom to clean various things such as our baby bottles, fridge, and a bedroom with 2 double beds as we requested.  We requested a room towards Disneyland to watch the fireworks,

Summary Heading: A lot to say about this hotel
Summary: I have mixed reviews about this hotel, both good and not so good. The manager's reception is very good for drinks not so good for the basic snacks that are available. The margarita's are very nice and too easy to drink! The breakfast is for me so so, there is a tonne of choice, from eggs to cereal. For me the pancakes and french toast were too sweaty and dried out too quickly to enjoy. There was no powdered sugar or cinnamon sugar for the french toast. The range of fresh fruit was awesome. The doughnuts were too claggy for my liking. As we were visiting from the UK, forget getting a decent cup of tea, there is none. Only choice is Lipton, which does not make nice tea at all. I think that it would be great if the hotel looked into this for us UK visitors. The hotel could do with
Manager Response: Thank you for your candor about your recent stay with us. We will most certainly pass on your positive and negative observations to our department managers. We do indeed hope you do return to the hotel for any future stays in the Anaheim area.

Summary: We almost always stay on Hilton propery when we travel. I would have to say this was our least favorite property so far. It wasn't bad, it was just ok. Rooms were clean, free breakfast was actually pretty good, kids enjoyed the pool area, etc.  The staff were not all that friendly, except for the 1st one I encountered at the bell desk. When we got to our room, we realized we had no shower curtain, no extra blankets for the pull out sofa sleeper either. So I called for those items while we went to Downtown Disney. The blanket they brought us had a hole in the middle of it large enough to fit my head through, so I called for another. The next day, our room never was cleaned (no, the do not disturb sign was not out). When it was done the next day, shampoo & conditioner was not

Summary: I was so happy with our stay at the embassy suites south. The breakfast was wonderful and the managers reception was a nice surprise. The kids loved the fish, turtles and lion. It was a little far from Disneyland but it was worth it. We just needed to realize how long it took to wait for the bus, drive there and walk into the park. I would recommend the hotel and would stay again.

Summary: Spent a week at the Embassy Suites South Aneheim in early July.   Nice hotel about a 10 minute shuttle from Disneyland. If you are scared of heights this is not the hotel for you. The hallways are open air to the atrium below and the elevators are full length glass. The atrium is neat with a long pond with coi fish and turtles.   We arrived on Independance Day and it was absolute madness in the hotel for  the few days following. You could hardly move in the eating area let alone find a table. After those first initial days everything was great.  We had the Family Suite room on the 12 floor which had a seperate bedroom with a king bed and a pull out sofa bed in the  living room. We had a mini fridge, microwave, table that sat four. There was a tv in the bedroom and living room.

Summary: We just returned from Disneyland and staying here for 4 nights.  The hotel was clean and quiet. THe food was fine, like always but they did lack hot chocolate mix which the kids love. A short drive to Disneyland and the hotel charges $12 per night to park,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent two nights at Embassy Suites Anaheim-South. The room was very clean. The service we received upon checking in and checking out was excellent. Both the free breakfast and free cocktail hours were nice. Now, remember--you are at a hotel close to Disneyland which means there will be tons (and I mean tons!) of kids! The breakfast was what you'd expect from an Embassy Suites hotel and the cocktail hour was a bit better than most Embassy Suites hotels. (Maybe this is because people are at Disneyland during that time and/or a high percentage of the guests are underage?!) The hotel has a shuttle that transports you to and from Disneyland for $4 per day per person. The shuttle drivers were nice. If you're looking for a reasonably priced Disneyland hotel, this is your place!

Summary: It is true that there are several option to stay in the Disney area, but honestly, Embassy Suites delivers quality and good service. Have in mind that this is a family resort and that can be said of all the hotels in the area. If you go to Anaheim you know that Disneyland is family oriented and no doubt you are going to meet families. Being said that I consider this hotel to be of a high quality. Check in and check out were easy and fast, and the staff attentive and customer oriented. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Housekeeping is prompt and efficient. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. The bed is really good, and don't be alarmed by other reviews about bed bugs. Found none. Simple bathroom and good quality toiletries. Wet bar that provides a coffee maker, small

Summary: Took my family here because we were going to be traveling in the area. It is a nice hotel. The staff was ready and willing to help us. The parking lot has very tight parking spaces and I drive a truck so it was difficult to park. The breakfast line for omelets is a little confusing. I was not quite sure what was going on. Good location if you plan on going to Disneyland. For the most part our stay was wonderful. We will definitely be staying here in the future.

Summary: After reading some of the other reviews I was skeptical of this hotel.  I read about bed bugs, sticky carpets and poor customer service.  I was happy to not find any of this to be true.  I am a super picky person, so for me to say that is huge.  The hotel was clean, the room was clean and the staff was welcoming and curteous.  Some reviewers complained about the breakfast but considering they are feeding well over a thousand people a day I thought it was fine.  Fresh fruit was always available, the bacon was not dry and overcooked and, although I didn't have an omelet, they looked great.  The omelet chef had a big smile on his face and was joking around as he was cooking.  Yes, there is no free wifi which would be nice and is usually complimentary, but the business center was

Summary: Last summer I took my daughter and son-in-law and grandkids to Disneyland.   We spent 5 nights at this hotel and it was very nice.  Comfortable beds, small fridge and microwave and complimentary breakfasts in the morning.   The kids loved the pool where we hung out at night to rest after long days at the park, and we also enjoyed the inexpensive pizzas that are offered for purchase in the evenings.   Great place to stay with children.   My only complaint was the long wait for elevators sometimes but we went in July when it was very crowded so that was understandable.  We would definitely stay here again.   We also loved the restaurant right in front of the hotel, Buca de Peppos.

However, it was full so we picked this one instead.  They seem to get most of their business from Disney tourists so they don't have to generate repeat business, and it seemed like they cut corners.  The Good: The two bed suite was one of the largest we have had at any ES.  The carpet and furniture looked reasonably fresh.  The air conditioner kept the room comfortable even though it was 90 outside.  I had asked for towels for 4, and those were waiting in the room. Although I had hoped the walking distance to the park would be not so bad, we tried it the first night and decided it was too far. We were told it was just over a mile but it took us 40 minutes to get to the security line outside Disneyland. We are not slow walkers! The shuttle ended up working out better for us. It leaves the hotel every half hour and we never had a problem getting on as it only serves the Embassy Suites and two other hotels next to it. Our room was clean and the staff was very friendly, especially the people working the Disney counter. Summary Heading: Always the best in So. Cal.

This past time we splurged for the deluxe room since we were going to be there for 7 nights and we felt the extra space was worth the money.   Room: Our room was always clean and our 2 kids run around barefoot and the bottom of their feet were always clean unlike other hotels.  If you are a returning customer, you will probably notice the breakfast omelet guy that was there over the past 5 years is not there.  For a resort area, this Embassy has done well keeping the rooms appearing fresh rather than abused.  My only irritation is that like most newer hotels, their HVAC system has an occupancy sensor so when you are not in the room, the air conditioning doesn't run.

Summary: To begin, I’m a huge Embassy Suites fan and had a wonderful stay at this location in 2007. Summary Heading: Awesome hotel and great value, too!
Summary: My wife and kids had a great experience at this hotel, which I must say it is one of the busiest I have seen.  The entire hotel is friendly and, the employees will do everything on their power to accommodate you and your family.  Of course, be ready to deal with heavy traffic, since this hotel is made to attend the needs of families vacationing at Disneyland.  I will definitely come back to visit the Embassy Suites next time we make a trip to Disneyland.  This note is for the management at the Embassy Suites:  Your employee Pricilla B. made our stay super special by going the extra-mile during our stay.  Thanks to all. Summary: This Embassy has good clean rooms but lacks in cleanliness of common areas. The reception and breakfast areas nver seemed to be cleaned when the meals were in progress. The spaces are small and I observed no addtl security roaming the grounds to account for the parking charge. The pool area is blah and almost part of the parking lot.

Summary: Excellent choice for any kind of vacation, especially families.  The rooms were very clean and the staff was extremely helpful.  The beds and pillows were so comfortable. The free breakfast and happy hour every day was awesome! They went above and beyond the call of duty!!!  My son had a conference in the area and I met him there to explore the area.  Very affordable.  They also have a shuttle service from John Wayne Airport that costs $10 per person, which, compared to a taxi for a 30 minute ride, was a great deal.   I would definately book this hotel again.

The waterfall beneath the lion was off and the algae was relaxing with us at the manager's reception later in the night. SO If you want to be at Disney at 7, well...you miss out on your "early" morning or you can't take the shuttle.   The rooms are very nice if a bit outdated. Very clean though.    It is definitely a family place. Lots of kids. Ours are 6 and 4 and loved being on the top floor (14th) and riding the elevator up and down. Our room was a fireworks view room. Our group would get Bucca di Beppo to go and bring it into the Hotel lobby and eat there.  Great for our kids to run around, free drinks for all and we didn't have to leave the hotel after a long day at disney.  The shuttle is amazing.  It picks you up right outside the hotel and it wasn't hard to find a place on the shuttle most days.  It's a short walk from where the shuttle drops you off to enter Disneyland. Summary: We've stayed at Embassy Suites South a few times.  Our first two visits were great. I also love that you can adjust the AC easily, you have two tv sets, and a decent table to play games on and that serves as a dining table when you order room service.  Overall this is a great hotel for a Disney trip!  The last time we stayed, however, there were a few issues; the elevators were on the fritz, our keys didn't work twice (late at night with sleepy kids coming back from Disney), and the front desk personnel was not

Summary: Stayed in this hotel the week of fathers day.  We had booked 3 rooms, and were only given 2 rooms on the same floor. Wasn't ideal since some of our party had not seen each other is over a year.  Also of the 3 rooms, only 1 smelt fresh.  The other 2 smelled stale but a little lysol and lowering the air conditioner did the trick..  Also they did not have enough front desk staff to handle the check in.  Using the ART was wonderful since pick up was right in front of the hotel.  back to back buses in the mornings and at night we had no problem returning to the hotel. Summary Heading: Wonderful Staff- Comfortable Room and Fun Environment

They kept the line of people moving at a steady pace.  We came downstairs to purchase Disneyland tickets, (on site as well) and she told us that the transfer bus to Disneyland would be there in about two minutes.  We caught the bus (only $4 for the whole day).    Room service was excellent as well.  Prompt and delicious.  We ordered a club sandwich, fries and Pizza.  Breakfast featured, bacon and sausage, french toast and made to order eggs/omelets!  Wonderful hotel experience!  We will definitely be back!

The bedroom also had a nice flat screen t.v. Great for families.   The breakfast buffet was nice with choice of a fresh omlet. This is a very busy hotel so do get up early if you want to get in an out of the dinning area quickly. Even then sometimes it can be busy with everyone trying to get to Disney when it opens. Summary: My family just finished a 5 night stay at the Embassy Suites and It was Perfect. We had a corner suite with a king bed which was very comfortable. The kids enjoyed watching their own tv while falling asleep on the pull out bed. The room was very clean and had a mini fridge, microwave, and coffe maker. Breakfast was good and there were many options to choose from. It was a great location and close to Disneyland. Night's when we were too tired watch the fireworks at Disneyland we would just look out our window and we could see them from our room. They even have an evening reception with free drinks and light snacks. This place is perfect for a family and when ever returning to this area of California there is no doubt that we will be staying here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed in this hotel for a Disneyland/ CA Adventure weekend.  The suite was really roomy and spacious!  Small refrigerator, microwave, two TVs, pull out couch, two double beds.  The breakfast options were great.  It's not very quiet, though, and we could hear the other hotel guests outside of the room early in the morning.  Too many excited kids getting ready for Disneyland!  All the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful.  I would return here again if I got a good price again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were recommended to stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South by a friend who had stayed there last year.  We weren't disappointed.  The Embassy was a great place for families.  The kids felt comfortable there and so did we.  The rooms were spacious and housekeeping was great.  A shuttle bus was available at the hotel to take us to Disney everyday and that was handy.  My only complaint would be that staff on the front desk weren't that nice.  We had a few questions to ask and were made to feel like we were interrupting them.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Found bed bugs on both bed and pull out bed!  Our child had several bites.  Made a report AND included a live bug.  Due to no managent staff avail for us to speak with upon checkout, was told someone would call me.  Still NO call from anyone - it's been almost a week!!!
Manager Response: I want to apologize for the unfortunate experience that you had at our hotel. The health and safety of our guests is of the utmost importance and is always a focal point of our operations in order to continue providing our guests with a great experience. We work closely with a professional pest control company to address and rectify any pest situation that might occur. We have reviewed your comments with our staff and promise the situation has been addressed.

Summary: First of all let me start by saying we did enjoy our stay at the Embassy Suites South, however there is quite a bit of false advertising with the hotel photos on the trip advisor page.  If you want a true acount of the hotel, look at the traveler pictures.  We stayed on the 4th floor and no room on that floor was updated as in the hotel pictures.   We also paid for a Disney view room and all we could see was the very tip of the Matterhorn.  We did not witness fireworks from our room, even when we were back early enough to look for them.    Frequently, the cleaning staff did not provide enough towels and certainly not enough face cloths for a family of 4.    Breakfast in the morning was a definite perk as well as the very reliable shuttle service.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney Trip
Summary: We stayed here with our two kids on our last trip to Disney. It was just perfect. Our kids still say that the next time we go to Disney that we HAVE to stay at this hotel again. I love the lobby area. Our kids could enjoy the area as the adults sat and talked. We wanted to go back to the park at night but the kids wanted to hang out at the hotel. Breakfast is great and so much easier than having to get up early and get dressed to go out. Manager reception was also a great convenience. We used the pool alot also. The running streams with turtles and fish was great. The kids loved that also.  In the lobby was a concierge for Disney. She gave us helpful info on how to enjoy the park. The hotel really made the memories of this trip.  I tell all my friends when they are going that
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there for a family trip to Disneyland in May. Overall it was OK, but a little busy with high school kids due to grad parties. We'd never stayed there before and were used to quieter hotels.  We liked: *Free breakfast - line for omelettes was always long, but everything else flowed OK. Food was decent for being free (they could add more variety though, like blueberry waffles; also make it easier for people to access tables when it's busy). *Room - pretty quiet considering how busy the hotel was. Beds were comfortable too.  *Roaring lion, waterfall & koi pond - great for kids, like a mini Rainforest Cafe. *Proximity - Target was right across the street, Buca di Peppo in front, quick bus to Disney. It's also immediately next to the Hyatt (quieter, fewer kids) and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Has its Pros & Cons; free breakfast makes it worth it
Summary: This hotel is honestly just ok. For the hotel class,  price and the Anaheim area, which I know quite well, it is basically what you would expect and a very good bargain. There really are no "luxury" hotels in Anaheim because of the very nature of the area all of the hotels are crammed into. If you want luxury you really need to stay at Disney's Grand Californian.  I use trip advisor a lot for making up my mind on hotels, so I'm going to try to give as much info as I can that will give you honest feedback when making your decision. I stayed with my husband and 2 children, 7 and 11 during Spring Break of this year. I'll point out pros and cons. But I'm going to start with what makes this a place worth considering and why I might come back, even though the hotel itself is just
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here in April for spring break.  Came home with bed bug bites.  The hotel confirmed that we had bed bugs in our room.  Said they would get back to us....never did.  Several unreturned messages and emails followed.  I would assume that our money would be refunded. The girls at customer care for Hilton Hotels told me that they didn't have anyone I could complain to about their service....told me they don't answer to anyone.  Terrible customer service!!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had 5 days stay here. Very spacious room and great service. Excellent breakfast included as was evening Managers receptions for drinks nibblies etc. Only negative, if you could call it that, was a bit of an eyesore of meal trays be left outside rooms for hours before being collected. Have stayed at numerous other hotels in Anaheim area over many years, and this has definitely been the best. No hesitation about staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When trying to make a reservation the computer system went down and the agent was unable to proceed.  I was asked to call back within an hour which I did and still down.  I was then told to call back the next day.  So I called back and was informed the room rate increased.  After multiple attempts to speak with the person who could help me I was given an email address for the Reservations coordinator.  I sent an email and did receive a response stating that due to demand and limited availability they were unable to honor the rate.  I have stayed in many Embassy Suites and have always had a positive experience.  The hotel looks beautiful and I am disappointed she was unwilling to settle the issue.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Service for a Large Group
Summary: We were with a large group of kids in several rooms on the second and third floors. Loved the size of the guest suites.  Mini fridge, microwave, bar sink.  Buffet breakfast (and cooked-to-order choices as well).. Be aware that the breakfast doesn't begin until 7:30 a.m. if you need a very early start (Super friendly hostess!) But was great to bring our trays to our rooms in the morning and watch TV from the dining table that seats 4.  The staff was good, but guess we miscommunicated on a wake up call on the last day, because we didn't get one (although they had handled the entire week's wake up calls to 15+ rooms with no problem).  We had set our cell phone alarm as back-up, so no problems occured.   We had trouble with the air conditioning in one room and a really nice
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect Location to Disney Parks (if you're looking for value)!
Summary: We booked 1 night at this location because we were going to take advantage of the Disney Hopper ticket.  This is two parks (one each day) for $99.00 per person for CA. residents.  When we arrived we were upgraded to a corner king suite which you could see the Disney Parks. This was because we were celebrating a milestone birthday.  When we walked into the room the a/c was on and the coolness was a real plus.  Next we headed for the Disneyland desk inside the hotel to purchase our hopper tickets AND the hotel offered shuttel service for 4.00 per person, per day which offers unlimited rides to and from the Disney Parks up until an hour after the parks close. The shuttel going to the parks is every 15 minutes after and before the hour.  Coming back it's on the hour and half hour.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good: lots of room, great breakfast, location is pretty good. Bad: desk staff seemed disinterested in the whole Disney thing, transportation to park was expensive (I miss ART), queen beds were very small. Marginal: Pool was nice and square, parking is $6 per day  This was our second time here and we really enjoy the extra space compared to other properties in the area. Next time I might just use Disney parking to save money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First of all the bad. There was five of us in the room, (3 kids + parents) and we found the beds too small! I don't know if they were twins or doubles but they were definitely not queens! I don't know if bigger beds were an option but I would ask next time. Also we were close to the elevators and the noise was bothersome. We also paid extra for fireworks view but that was a waste of money. No free WIFI and paying for parking seem to be a bit of a money grab. Enough complaining.   Now the good. The rooms themselves are quite large. The free breakfast was great, and the always smiling hostess was very helpful when the family was entering the breakfast area at different times. Also the staff keeping the breakfast area running and clean were always friendly. When inquiring about
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, super kid friendly and super accomodating. Beautiful lobby, great breakfast and a managers reception that can't be beat.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel, but far from Disneyland
Summary: I really do like Embassy Suites hotels; they are very nice with lots of amenities.  This hotel has a great lobby/reception area, the breakfast is good, the rooms were large and clean, and as a whole the rooms are quiet, which isn't true of a lot of hotels near Disneyland.  The few downsides are the breakfast area gets very busy in the morning, the manager's reception could offer different snacks (it's always popcorn and a snack mix) the Embassy Suites in Hawaii offered something different each night with more options, and they start shutting down their breakfast/manager's reception early.  I was also really disappointed with the fact that they charged $12 a night for parking and another $4 a day per person for the shuttle.  They know that people need that shuttle because they
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall we had a good stay.     When making my reservations, I requested a room away from the elevator. When checking in, the pleasant clerk confirmed my room was away from elevators. However, after going to the room we discovered it was directly in front of an elevator. I returned immediately to the front desk where a different employee, Allain assisted me, he was very efficient and courteous as he quickly found me another room, far away from the elevator.  Allain was actually very helpful to us several times during our stay.  Also, Enrique at the front desk helped me find the closest bookstore, and even went further to print out driving directions.  I must say having a Disney facing room to view the fireworks, is no big deal.  The hotel is too far away from Disneyland 1.5
Manager Response: none

Summary: Massive rooms with all the facilities you need, walking distance of disney, breakfast buffett does get busy but you can always take back to your room
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family stayed at this hotel in a corner suite facing the Disneyland fireworks.  I would say that it was a good idea to get the suite for the size but didn't think it was worth getting for the fireworks.   It was also very noisy because our room was next to the elevators but we just turned the fan on and it drowned it out well.  The king bed was very comfortable, which is a huge plus after a long day at the parks!  The great thing about this hotel is the free breakfast.  The food was good and it was a big daily savings for our family of four.  The manager's reception in the afternoon was a nice plus as well.  We had a great experience with everyone who worked there and the shuttle to/from Disneyland was very easy and pleasant with friendly drivers.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I wasnt taken away by this hotel, but it is standard for Embassy Suites. Pretty nice rooms, could be cleaner. Very spacious, comfortable rooms, but noisey. Sounded like a basketball team was practicing next door.. Also, the buffet breakfast start time at 7:30 am is very bad timing! I had to skip breakfast twice because it was too late. Unless this was intentional to save money, not good. Front desk was very helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Disney view rooms not worth the price
Summary: With all the wonderful things that were said about a Disney view room, we opted to spend the extra money.  It was a waste.  We never saw the fireworks which was the whole point.  Breakfast starts too late if you're trying to get to the parks for opening (7:30am on the weekends and 6:30am during the week).  We only got breakfast 1 day because we had a tour booked and were scheduled to arrive later.  I agree with other comments about the elevators being really slow.  It was good to have a separate room for the kids without having to spend too much more.  Very family friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here last week during spring break as the Homewood was full.  I wouldn't stay here again.  The double beds are too small for a 6.2" person.  The elevators are a mess.  They take forever.  Also they miss your floor altogether. The breakfast is good, but you have to be down there before 8am if you want to miss the line.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed with family of four for 3 nights in April. One room suite was very spacious--huge separate bedroom with king bed and tons of room for luggage. Living area hosted table / chairs and pull out couch for kids. Buffet breakfast was great--we went down close to the end of it on first day and there was still lots to chose from including omelette station. Easy shuttle service every 30 minutes to / from Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a March trip to Anaheim with two sets og grandparents and five kids between us. Hotel worked out great.Our thrid stay in this hotel. Each time it has been the right choice. Rooms are great, kids impressed with the whole place. Great breakfast to start the stay. Lots of selection. A real value add on to staying at this hotel with kids. Has its peak periods busy in the morning but lots of tables and very good staff to clear them as they come open. Only downsides with this hotel is the pay for parking charge and the no free wifi. Other locations in the area have same policies. Of the two the parking charge is the most bothersome. have to weigh it against the other positives. If planning in advance there are travel services that can get a good package price that includes hotel,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just stayed at this hotel for almost a week and had a great time!  The shuttle to Disneyland was great so we didn't have to deal with parking and the cost for a day was next to nothing.  The rooms are nice and the staff was very friendly.  We didn't use the pool but that looked nice as well.  The breakfast isn't the best, it beats out most hotels, and the line for it was always really long so we only ate at the hotel once.  Overall it was a nice stay and I'd recommend this hotel to my friends and family!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, good breakfast, good time!
Summary: Went to SoCal with the family for some vacation time and decided on Embassy Suites for our stay. Know their reputation and got a good deal through Hotels.com. Even found an online coupon for an extra 10% off the stay (HINT: use Google and search for "discount codes + hotels.com").  Here are the particulars both good and what I would consider "bad":  1. Located about 2.5 miles from Disneyland. Though it is in the "Disney area" with a ton of other hotels, it is NOT walking distance, especially if you have kids. The hotel runs a daily shuttle (cost: $4 per adult/$1 per kid) every half hour on the :15 and :45 and it will pick you up at Disneyland on the hour and half hour. First shuttle leaves the hotel at 7:15a and last pickup is late into the night.  2. Arrival... off of
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was a great! Close enough to walk to the convention center. Excellent free breakfast. Made to order eggs, lots of selection. The rooms were well laid out seperate living area and sleeping areas. Nice sun deck and pool area. Staff were very friendly and outgoing. I had lost my drivers licence somewhere. They mailed it back to me without me reporting it to them. My only complaint would be the coffee. Both the inroom and the breakfast area coffee were very poor. I walked to the Hilton next door to buy a coffee every morning. I will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just had a five night stay at this hotel.  The two room suites are great.   Nice breakfast, but it does get busy.   Staff are very helpful.   Bummer it doesn't have free wifi.    Would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here last February during a trip to Disneyland with our 3-year old. We go to Disneyland often and typically stay at a Disney Resort or the DoubleTree, but I could not pass the deal I got to stay here. Checking in was quick and easy. From what i could tell, there was no vallet and the parking lot is pretty small and shared with a few other hotels. Our suite was fine, nothing fancy, just standard hotel issued furniture. We had plenty of room to spread out since we got the slightly larger suite in the front of the hotel. If your a light sleeper, you should request a higher floor suite. We were situated on the 4th floor and we could hear the waterfall and some chatter with the door closed. It wasnt too bothersome for us. Also, the air system in the room was a bit loud.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love the 2 room suites.  Love the morning breakfast.  Love the manager's reception.  Rooms are nice, what you would expect from an Embassy Suites.  Very clean and easily fit a family of 4 or 5.  The ART to Disneyland picks up in front of the hotel.  It's a bit slow and often late, but it gets the job done.  Better than paying to park at DL.  Best to get outside a few minutes before the pick up to get a seat if the hotel is busy.  Only $6 to park your car at the hotel.  Pool is average, not very big, but we didn't spend much time in the pool.  Staff was very friendly and accomodating.  Several restaurants within 1-10 minutes walking distance.  Majority of guests have children, breakfast can be a bit hectic.  It can get noisey.  But, this is a great family hotel with easy access
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at this Embassy Suites a total of 3 out of 5 times during our Disneyland vacations and our stay has always been excellent.  The full free breakfast is amazing and the variety is great.  Can't complain about free Happy Hour either.  We have stayed at other hotels near by and they never come close to measuring up.  It's a bit pricey but like I mentioned, they serve free "made to order" breakfast and free happy hour.  Try adding those into your daily vacation cost and see how much you would end up spending.  The rooms are always very clean, the staff are very friendly and the Anaheim shuttle comes by every 10 minutes or so.  The kids can watch the animated lion while they wait for the shuttle.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was impressed with the customer service and the maid service was above par in this hotel!  I had an infant with me and was never once worried about her safety or the cleanliness of this hotel. The atrium with the koi pond and animatronic lion was beautiful and entertaining to my toddler.  It was extremely quiet and the bed was more comfy than my bed at home. We were rained out at Disneyland one day and enjoyed the accommodations of the hotel and our room. I highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place to visit but if you have tattoos hide them
Summary: i was out here visiting with my family (husband and 6 year old daughter) . My husband has a tattoo of his older sister on his arm who got killed in a hit and run car accident and you could bearly see it but everyone there was looking at him in a funny way and judging him by just not speaking to him or saying hi and i just felt like they were very judgmental here and it was wrong and rude and very disappointing. Other then that the breakfast is one of the best breakfasts my family and i have experienced than any other hotel. They were clean. Just wish the front desk service had better attitudes.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Disney hotel out of 5 we have stayed at
Summary: Awsome hotel the room was BIG the food great staff great shuttle to Disney on time every time and easy. We have stayed at DIsney grand, home wood suites, sheraton,merriott and I would go back to embassy first. The Grand is nice if you have money to burn but you don't spend that much time at the hotel so I wouldn't stay there again the rooms are small and you pay for everything. We were in room 205 right behind the lion and waterfall and I could here it in the living room but not in the bedroom we slept great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nicely done, Embassy Suites Anaheim South!
Summary: Arrived late at night and was greeted warmly, checked in quickly and efficiently. Can't say enough about how friendly and helpful the staff was at every level and juncture. Embassy Suites follow an extremely consistent formula of layout, rooms, restaurants, etc.,; what made this stay so nice were the people!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: Distance to Disneyland, Room size, Self Laundry, Breakfast buffet. Cons: Room decor was really worn out and who has tube TV'S anymore? Elevators took FOREVER!! and finding a table during morning breakfast is rough but not impossible! Also, it rained one day at Disneyland and when we got back to hotel I spent 2 hours at the Laundry room(staying in line) to get our clothes dry because they only have them on certain floors.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent value, friendly service, pictures are not as great as the hotel really is, unlimited free high balls, beer and wine -5
Summary: We got here with our 6 yr old and immediately she said, " this place is beautiful!" It certainly is. We have stayed at the new Hilton waldorf  historia in Florida  and this place comes close! Staff is very friendly and helpful! Rooms are huge. All rooms have a ledge outside the door facing the food court with a fence to look down on it. All kids seem to love this place! Have not seen the pool yet or the gym. Wifi is great but found it difficult to log onto to. I purchased a business deal with prepaid parking and wifi. I just contacted front desk and problem solved! Breakfast is a huge bonus and tastes great! Has all you need. Rooms are clean and hotel is always vacuumed! Also, they are huge! We didn't drive to DL and took the "art bus" . Cost $4 per adult and $1 per child all
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Cannot say enough good things about this hotel
Summary: Full breakfast (including made to order omelettes) is included at this suite hotel - all a mile from Disneyland. The shuttle service is not the ART shuttle, but rather their own and runs every 30 minutes to and from Disneyland. Rooms were very comfortable and clean and the staff was extra friendly. It is a Disneyland Good Neighbor hotel - we bought tickets in the lobby and they had an extra magic hour. There is no airport shuttle included at this hotel from LAX, but I couldn't find an Anaheim hotel that included one. Shutle service from Disneyland Express came here for about $32 per person to/from LAX. Room service menu you was pricey as usual, but kids meals are only $8.00 and are generous portions. I believe two kids eat free with an adult meal. I would DEFINITELY stay here
Manager Response: none
