Summary: Nice location and a pretty good hotel when you add in the great breakfast and the complimentary beverages for happy hour. Housekeeping needs a little more attention. Nothing major but things not picked up, it didn't look like they bothered to wipe my counter after a couple of days.  I'd stay again but it's not a favorite.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not quite so good the 2nd time around
Summary: After having what I would generally categorize as a very nice stay here back in March, we decided to stay here again on our trip to Disneyland for our daughter's birthday.  She was allowed to bring a friend, so this time around we wanted two connecting rooms. This is partially where things got a little more difficult, with the other part being that we were using reward points to partially pay for the stay.  Because of all this, we actually made sure to call the hotel directly to make all of the arrangements. One of the key (and very clear) requests was to have connecting rooms, as we planned to let the kids stay in one while we stayed in the other.  So we get there and get checked-in, reminding the clerk that we needed connecting rooms, and get our side-by-side rooms. We head
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Free breakfast, close to Disneyland, and outstanding staff!!!
Summary: This hotel is amazing!!! We are Disneyland Anual Passholders, however, we live in San Diego and have stayed in different hotels around the Disneyland area. We arrived on Saturday February 25th just before 3:00pm for check in, our room wasn't ready yet, the lady in the fron desk was so nice and maybe she felt bad for making us wait that she gave us 2 complimentary "shuttle passes"- (The shuttle that takes you to Disneyland) The shuttle leaves at 3:15pm, 3:45pm, 4:15pm.....the last shuttle FROM Disneyland to the hotel leaves at 1:00am!!! The lobby is Rainforest/Jungle themed, they have a lion that roars, they have a nice waterfall and a small bridge, really cool. We went up to our suite on the 5th floor facing the parking lot and facing  Harbor drive (I think it's Harbor drive).
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience at our Embassy Suites hotel in Anaheim. I am very happy to hear that the staff took such good care of you and you found the amenities of the property to your liking. Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: This is a great hotel to stay at with your family.  It is a standard Embassy Suites and they have a nice breakfast that is included with the cost.  The made to order eggs/omlet is the way to go!  Priscilla the employee who checks you in for breakfast is absolutely wonderful.  She was able to keep other peoples kids under control while also being incredible with my kids.  They have turtles in the stream in the lobby and my son asked Priscilla if they had a name and she told him he couls name him.  My son called him Lucky and for each of the next three mornings she asked him if Lucky was doing well.  Details like this made our trip.  Thank you!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim - South and will let Priscilla know that she contributed to your enjoyment. We hope to see you again soon!  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Not the place to stay if you value your sleep
Summary: My family recently made a trip to Disneyland, and based on the reviews and being HHonors guests, we decided to make a reservation for this hotel.  We stayed 2 nights in their larger King Suite room.  Because we were driving from San Jose, CA, it took us a good 6 hours to get there.  I notified the staff of a late check in, and that was not a problem.  However, upon check in (which was close to 1am), I asked to use their luggage cart and the receptionist who checked me in said, "I don't really see one around."  I was a little frustrated at this point, not only did I have a long car drive, but it was 1 in the morning, and I didn't appreciate the negative comment.  He must have realized what he had said and quickly followed up with that he would go look for one.  We finally made it
Manager Response: First of all, thank you for your review of your past stay. We always appreciate hearing from our guests - including items of opportunity. I understand that the noise was an issue during your stay; while we do have additional security and overnight managers available during high traffic periods we certainly do encourage for guest’s comfort and safety that they contact the front office so we can calm the issue. I apologize that your comfort was interrupted by other guests and I have shared your review with our security team to ensure that this is not an opportunity in the future. I do hope the next time you return to Anaheim you consider staying with us again. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location and alternative to staying on the Disney property
Summary: We have stayed there twice and enjoyed it.  They have a bus that pics you up at the hotel and takes you to Disney.  Breakfast is included in the morning and evening snacks an beverages.  The pool is nice for the kids and it is nice to get away from Disney at the end of the day.  We did stay at Disney one trip and didn't see the value.
Manager Response: Just wanted to thank you and your family for your recent stay here at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South! So glad you were able to experience our warm Embassy Suites hospitality and we look forward to seeing you the next time you return to Anaheim. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Good for family, but needs updating
Summary: Good size rooms and the free breakfast works out well with 3 kids. But the hotel does needs some updating, funky smells in some areas and it is 1.5 miles from disneyland so you need to take a shuttle.  If they had a better pool it would be much better.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about our hotel. We apologize for the inconvenient smell during your stay. Because travel is very important, we try hard to make sure all our guests have a rewarding experience at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Nice place to stay, with shuttle to Disneyland. Very friendly and family accommodating staff! We thoroughly enjoyed there complimentary breakfast buffet. Especially the made to order omelets.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South and that you liked our breakfast offering so much. Hope to see you return in the near future. Safe travels. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice Embassy Suites in good location, blocks from Disneyland
Summary: Of course being next to Disneyland there are lots of kids and a Disney desk downstairs. This is in a mall type area with tons of restaurants, Bucca de Bepo, Red Robin and others, plenty of places to eat and grownups to play. Shuttle to park, staff was nice, breakfast was adequate with hot items although I have noticed that in general Embassy Suites seems to be cutting back a bit on breakfasts, which is disappointing. Typical Embassy courtyard atrium with koi fish, waterfalls, etc, restaurant and breakfast area downstairs, pool and spa was nice and well maintained. Rooms were typical two room suites with sofabed. Everything very nice. And as I will mention in every review from now on, NO holds were done on my credit card, rates were reasonable, parking was free.
Manager Response: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of the hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.                                             Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: This hotel is awsome if you were to take your family to stay, if you are going to stay there for the convention center, well then it is a different story.  It is a fair distance to the convention center so to walk all day at a show and then walk back to the room can get very long.  It is nice to have a suite but for me I would almost rather stay in one of the hotels closer to the convention center.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our location. Our shuttle service is available to pick up and receive guests from the convention center and we hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: After hours of research on line we decided to stay at the Embassy Suites South Anaheim again this year for our annual trip to Disneyland and again we were happy with our decision!  You really can't beat the breakfast and the beds are so comfortable .  Close to Disneyland with Bucca de Bepo in the parking lot you really can't beat it!  We have also stayed three other places over the years and this is the only place we've all wanted to come back to for a second stay.  I also can imagine after dealing with Disney day in and day out your over it but their staff does not give you that vibe if you know what I mean.  Staff was so friendly too.  Love this hotel!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. I am very happy to hear that the staff took such good care of you and you found the complimentary breakfast, location and service level at the property to your liking. Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times. Once on my own & twice with my family. It is very family oriented. The shuttle service was mediocre to & from the parks being that it's city run. The hotel was clean, great space & a fantastic breakfast! The pool was always crowded unfortunately but we still made a go of it!
Manager Response: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the amenities and service levels of the hotel to your satisfaction. Although our pool can get busy when the weather is nice and the hotel is booked, I’m glad to hear you were able to enjoy a swim. Hope to see you return soon the next time you are in the area!  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful Lobby and Rooms, the Lion in the lobby Rules!
Summary: Loved this hotel, great staff, amazing lobby. The bar has great drinks and delicious food. Good breakfast. Cool Lion in the lobby that roars on the hour! When we were there they had free beer in the evenings! Free wine and mixed drinks too! I think it was 5-7pm, not sure if it was a special thing but I think they do it all the time!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you found the lobby, bar and breakfast to your liking. We look forward to servicing your travel needs at the Embassy Suites should you return to the Anaheim area.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Appreciate free brkfst, evening reception, pool, business area, etc.!   Only downfall is room is dark which makes it seem outdated despite their efforts.
Manager Response: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the amenities and service levels of the hotel to your satisfaction. I also appreciate your feedback in regards to our room lighting, and will take your comment under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Just returned from a trip to Anaheim/Disneyland.  We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Garden Grove.  Stayed four years ago, and was reminded why we stayed.    The hotel is very clean, the staff friendly and helpful.  There is a Disney booth in the lobby if you have questions or need to buy park passes.    There is a wonderful breakfast each morning, you can even have the chef make an omelet as you wait, great selection of fruit, breads, yogurts, juices, etc.  If you are traveling as a family, this breakfast could easily save you $10 per person each morning.    Though I would say this hotel caters to families, the rooms themselves are quiet.  Each room as a separate bedroom with a door you can close if you have ultra sensitive hearing.    The hotel is about 3 minutes from the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I frequent Disneyland & this is my #1 hotel. I absolutely love it. The rooms are spacious, clean, have microwaves, refrig, wet bar, table, sofa bed, etc. The beds are super comfy as well as the pillows. The towels are not thin, lots of storage room, nice large bathrooms. Not to mention room service!  The breakfast is wonderful. Cooked to order eggs (omelets, over easy, egg white omelet, you name it) bacon, sausage, french toast, pancakes, fruit, yogurt, donuts, oatmeal, toast, cereal, coffee, juice, etc. Everything you can imagine.   Then if that wasn't enough, every evening from 5:30-7:30 there's the manager's reception with free snacks, sodas, shirley temples & cocktails.  There were a few small snags on this stay, but nothing is perfect & it was very small potatoes. I'm
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at many Embassy Suites, which are all the same in terms of hotel and room design, but, this was the first time to stay at this particular Embassy Suites. I love Embassy Suites because they all include a full buffet breakfast and manager's reception with free alcohol and snacks in the evening. I was surprised they charged for my car rental parking. I guess it is due to their proximitity to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: beautiful hotel excellent rooms very spacious we stayed in a suite which had room with tv sofa chairs table etc which then led into kitchen area with all amenities followed by beautiful bathroom and very large bedroom with full length windows over looking disney land you really cant ask for a better location or hotel for disney etc food was also good and staff very friendly the only comment i would make is that disney anaheim is not a patch on disney orlando although still very good but dont expect it to be like orlando although hollywood is a must
Manager Response: none

Summary: We decided to take a short trip to Disneyland/ California Adventure the week after Christmas. Since this hotel is only about three blocks away it was perfect walking distance. We chose the extra large suite which was great! The hotel was very nice, clean and the breakfast was wonderful, all at an affordable price.The front desk & breakfast staff were very accommodating and  friendly. We requested extra pillows and blankets, which were brought to us within 10 minutes. We would absolutely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I found most everything about this hotel to be very good.  we had 3 rooms with 5 adults and 7 kids and had plenty of room for everyone.  The happy hour drinks were good also.   Rooms were clean.  The only thing i didnt like was the resturant.  we ate ther one night and the food was not very good in my opinion, However, the breakfast was very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Embassy Suites Anaheim South is a great value.  The breakfast and managers reception are what makes it such.  The breakfast selection was great and the food was really good.  The managers reception including two hours of complimentary top shelf liquor was wonderful.  The only drawback is that the atrium is really cold, so bring a sweatshirt or jacket.    The elevator was a little slow, and for some reason, our floor kept clearing after we pushed it so we took a couple of random elevator rides.   The room was okay---not as nice as the rest of the hotel to be honest.  The double beds were a little small and the rest of the furniture was just decent nothing special.    Some reviewers have mentioned free parking, but I had to pay for it.    The hotel was really convenient to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and our made-to-order breakfast and manager’s reception. We hope to see you again soon.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay as a family
Summary: This hotel is nice. The rooms are pretty clean, you can tell they have seen their fair share of kids..but, that is to be expected at a hotel near Disneyland. The service was good, and the breakfast is worth its weight in gold. Big breakfast, and then you are good for dinner. No fee to park, and the shuttle to Disneyland picks you up right in front of the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that the staff took such good care of you and you found the service, breakfast and shuttle to Disneyland to your liking. Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We stayed 4 nights at Embassy South over the Christmas Holiday.  Overall the experience was excellent.  The staff were all great to deal with.  The room was very clean.  The manager running the buffet each morning (I forgot to get his name) deserves special recognition.  On Christmas morning he relaxed the buffet policy knowing that families much less fortunate than hotel guests would probably be trying to get a meal.  That simple act of graciousness is enough to make me a repeat guest.  The ART Disney shuttle was extremely convenient.  The only negatives were the elevators were a bit slow.  By the time we checked out the hotel was at 100% occupancy so getting an elevator to/from the 10th floor could be a challenge.  Also, the pool heater was broken.  The spa was heated and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our Embassy Suites hotel. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and will let Rey Lazaro know that they contributed to your enjoyment. Thank you for your feedback in regards to the elevators being slow and the pool heater not working. I am working to resolve these issues to make sure that we can provide our guests the best experience possible. We hope to see you again soon.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights in early December for a surprise Disney trip.  We thought it was a GREAT hotel.  We have stayed at many different resorts around the Disney area, and this is the first one, besides the Courtyard, that we would stay at again.  Having a separate living/bedroom made it SO much easier for the kids to get naps, and go to bed at night.  I'm not sure what the other reviews were talking about with the "needs updating," comments, because our room was beautiful, and I couldn't see anything that needed updating.  The only little thing that was slightly "odd," was that there were never any liners/garbage bags placed in the various garbage cans in the room.  Seems like no big deal, and really it isn't huge, but it was slightly annoying!  But, everything else was
Manager Response: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of the hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We chose the Embassy Suites for the 1-bedroom they offered and it was pretty spacious.  I loved the bedroom and it was nice that there was a fridge.  We were too close to the elevator though and could hear quite a bit of noise.  The breakfast was good but it was very busy when we went so we had to get up early because the lines were long.  It was fantastic having eggs cooked to order!  The computer room was horrid there was nothing but teenagers playing games the whole time and I could never get on.  That was a bit frustrating that for such a large hotel there were only a handful of computers.  The pool was very nice and the staff friendly. And you can't beat the proximity to Disney!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you found the bedroom amenities, breakfast and location to your liking, and we also appreciate your feedback in regards to the computer room. We look forward to servicing your travel needs at the Embassy Suites Anaheim-South should you return to the Disneyland area.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Suites are nice, but service needs work
Summary: My family of 4 just spent a weekend at this hotel for a trip to Disneyland. We are frequent Disneyland visitors and have stayed at many, many area hotels. This was our first time at this one. We decided on it because we got a great rate and we have been fans of their free breakfasts. The suite was nice, and we got an upper floor room as we had requested. We had a King suite, planning to have the kids take the sofa bed. I found it interesting that, despite their knowing that we had 4 people in the suite and therefore needed to make use of the sofa bed for sleeping, we had to make up the sofa bed ourselves and call for bedding and pillows for it. Why? This seems like a simple thing they could have had ready for us.  The atrium area is quite pretty with the koi pond and the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you found the suite and atrium to your liking. We are sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of service you deserved during your recent stay. We apologize for the issues with our breakfast buffet and service on the elevator. We will be sure to address these issues and hope you will consider giving us a second chance if you return to the Disneyland area.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice stay, but a few misleading selling points
Summary: My wife and twin boys stayed here one night to go to Disneyland.  Their restaurant offers free food for children with a purchase of any meal and a drink.  We spent $30 on dinner during the manager's reception, therefore, we had free drinks as well.  For what you pay, I expect more.  We would have had a better stay, but there was one major issue and one misleading issue.  The major issue was that our room did not have two Queen beds, it had two DOUBLE beds.  I did not get a good nights sleep because of this and I still can't believe they don't actually have Queen size beds when every other hotel does.  The misleading issue is that it said I would get "complimentary shuttle passes up to 4 people to and from Disneyland resort".  I did get that when I arrived, which is a free
Manager Response: none

Summary: I came here with my wife and 2 year 7 month old toddler in tow.  We were meeting about 12 friends for our annual Xmas get together. We stayed from Dec 7th thru the 10th and found the room rates at the beginning of October.  We could have stayed closer to Disneyland but chose the Embassy Suites based upon the room rates we found and the availability of breakfast in the morning.    We arrived to the Embassy Suites around lunch time coming from John Wayne Airport.  The drive is only about 15-20 minutes in light traffic.  Getting to the hotel was interesting as we could not see the hotel from Harbor Blvd.  Embassy is located in the back of the Hilton Garden Inn and Hampton Inn and Suites.  Make a right or left turn at the sign that says "Hotels" and the Embassy Suites will be just
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Functional suites well located for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here in November 2011 as part of a Virgin fly drive holiday. The suite was comfortable and well appointed, with a fridge and microwave. The complimentary breakfast provided a good start to the day, and the afternoon reception was an added bonus when we were around to take advantage. We took a trip to Universal Studios and Hollywood by night which worked well, the coach picking up from the hotel to take everyone to a central point where we dispersed onto the different trips. We also pottered around the beaches south of LA, and found the Bolsa Chica Nature Reserve which was good for bird watching.
Manager Response: none

Summary: this embassy suites is not as nice as the others that i have stayed in, but nonetheless it was a great stay for my husband and i our daughter and our three grand daughters. the breakfast is a great plus. the bus to Disneyland stopped right in front. Boca di Beppo is right across the way in same parking area. great family restaurant when you take a break from the park. target was around the corner for snacks and other incidentals. had no time for swimming, but the pool looked great. though the hotel has had recent renovations, it still seems a little outdated. the only thing that i do not like about embassy suites in general is that they are very noisy. i think it is because the atrium area  transmits the noise all the way up and around. if you are not using the pull out bed in
Manager Response: Thank you for your Trip Advisor Review. Sorry about the noise issue. With the open air atrium we do get noise issues at time. I do apologize for that. Looking forward to seeing you and your family soon.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Great family hotel close to Disneyland.
Summary: I have also been staying here and booking many clients at this hotel for the past several years.  Expect this hotel to be full of families.  The lines for breakfast are long.  The area is too small to accomodate the amount of people they are trying to feed.  The front desk staff was good but did not feel an overly warm welcome or anything especially as a Diamond member.  The hotel recently started charging for parking, however it is not a gated lot so use your judgement here.  They share a lot with Hampton, Bucca and the Hilton Garden Inn.  I have had clients park without paying and it was never an issue.  A good solid choice with large suites for those with big families.
Manager Response: Thank you for your Trip Advisor review. I will share your comments with my Front Desk staff. We want to our Hilton Honors Diamond members to finally apperciated during their stay.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: I stayed here on a business trip since it was in a good location.  It was busy with Disney travelers (so it might be too much for some people).  The breakfast was awesome as usual for an Embassy.  The evening reception is a liltte disappointing with the snacks.  It is about a mile away from Disney.  In this same area, there are a LOT of other hotels.  The service was a little slow.  I did have to ask several times for paper for the printers in the business center.  Also, the front desk was not very helpful when I asked for some directions.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about our breakfast. I will also see what we can do about our snacks in the evening as well.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: From the moment we got their, I felt like they were all about customer service. I think her name was Mjoii that checked us in, because we added an extra day outside the vacation package, it wasn't just a simple check in, she made it so we woudn't have to change rooms as well as try to match the rate we were given with our package.  You cannot beat the make to order breakfast, the manager was always walking around making sure things were running as smooth as possible as well as asking us if everything was okay.  As long as you go there knowing that your going to have to take the shuttle to Disneyland and that your going to a hotel that caters to families, which means there are kids running around, you will be perfectly happy. Never waited more than 5 min for shuttle, they come
Manager Response: Thank you for the great comments about our customer service. I shared your comments with MiJoi and our entire staff.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Overall, we were pleased with our stay at Embassy Suites. Check in was smooth, the bell man was friendly and made local dinner recommendations, and the room was about the size expected. I personally am not a fan of the decor (it looks dark and dated to me) but my husband seemed to think it was fine. Our room was right by the elevator and I was worried it would keep our three kids up, but I rarely heard any noises during the night. Breakfast was very good--free and hot and tasty, so that was a major bonus. Other Pros--it's close to the parks, the  bus service runs RIGHT up to the door (good for folks with little ones in tow) and bus service kiosk out front where you can purchase day passes for $4 per person. Also, they do a managers special on drinks and snacks daily--all free,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not the best Embassy Suites, but still quite nice & already plan to stay there again
Summary: We visit Disneyland on a fairly regular basis (every year or two) and have stayed at several different hotels in the area. Between business and family travel, Embassy Suites has become one of our favorite places to stay. With that in mind we decided to give this location a try on our DL trip earlier this year (we split the stay between here and the Grand Californian).   Overall we were very happy with our stay at this Embassy Suites. Although I must say that it was a different experience than most of our ES stays. Of course this is really expected given that this location caters to a much different clientele than most other locations, with DL visitors being their primary demographic.  The breakfast was very good (as usual with ES), although probably not the best ES breakfast
Manager Response: We look forward to see and your family very soon.  Obed Morales General Manger

Summary: We have  stayed at the Doubletree just up the road the last couple of visits but decided we would give the Embassy Suites a try. The DT was more expensive per night plus had introduced a resort fee which from what I could tell was for nothing new. Plus parking was $16 a day. The ES was about $15 a day cheaper, $8 parking and we had free breakfast and managers reception (free beer !), ok it was the beer that swung it !! Rooms are a decent size with living area and separate bedroom. Nothing fancy but very clean (great powerful shower). Probably could do with a bit of updating but perfectly fine (apparently they are re doing all the rooms over the next 6 months so next time should be nice and new). 2 Nice LCD TV's.  Breakfast was excellent with choice of eggs, omelettes etc, Bacon,
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about the hotel.

Summary: Typical Embassy Suites hotel located a little over a mile from Disneyland (about 25 - 30 min walk at a brisk pace from the Disneyland front gate), tram service ($4 a day/person) is also available.  Rooms are attractive and clean, bed was comfortable, lobby is well laid out, and breakfast was well organized.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Parking was $8 a day.  Had a Disney view corner suite, which was a little larger and faced the park with a decent view, but it was close to the elevators and we could hear them all night long.  Ice and vending machines are located on floors 3, 6, 9 and 12.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review on Trip Advisor. I am glad to hear you liked your corner room with a view of Disneyland.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: This hotel was great. My family and I always stay at an embassy suites if possible and this one was just as nice. I recommend staying here. I loved the shuttle to Disneyland and the atmosphere :) the only thing that was the worst part of the hotel was the elevators. They were so slow. My family and I would take the stair so thank goodness we were on the second floor. You would wait at the elevator for like seriously 10 minutes before it came to ur floor or Lobby horrible especially after a long day at the park!!!
Manager Response: Sorry about the elevator situation, but thank you for your recent review.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We stayed October 20-23 during a disney vacation for my sons 11 birthday.  Rooms seemed a little smaller than other embassy hotels we have stayed in.  The food in the on site restaurant was average.  However it was a pleasant surprise when we got a call the next day saying we had been over charged and they gave us a $20 credit.  Disney tix available on site.  Manager reception always a bonus expecially with the cardinals playoff games on tv.  Free breakfast saved a lot of time in getting to disney early.  Staff during free breakfast was amazing.  Always happy and caring about your experience even while trying to feed 100s of people.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review and thanks for the good comments about our breakfast staff. It's always nice to see a smiling face in the morning and I am glad our team did that for you. We look forward to your next visit.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel at a reasonal price
Summary: I was in town for a convention with a party of 6 for three nights, so we were not the typically Disney family. We originally asked for a connecting room during our reservation, but they had none available when we checked in, not a big deal.  we stayed in room 903 and 904. Rooms were very spacious and clean. We were high enough not to hear anything in the lobby, except for the roaring lion every hour. Requested extra. The pillows are a bit thin, but that is easily solved with 2 and the bed was comfortable.  blanket and pillows for the sofa bed, and we received it within 10min after we called downstairs.  Breakfast was good. Can't really complain about the quality when it's complimentary. We went every day at around 8:30am and was able to find a table for six very easily. I would
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words on your Trip Advisor Review. I will make sure to look into those 2 cons that you mentioned. Have a good week.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel October 15th though the 18th and had a great time.  We had a total of 4 rooms for our family Disneyland trip.  Josephine at the front desk was amazing and helpful! The rooms were clean and beds were comortable.  It was great checking in and attend the managers reception to unwind after a long car ride. There was plenty of great restaurants close by for dinner choices. Breakfast in our opnion was very organized and we had no problems getting a table for 9.  Overall we had a great experience and will definately stay her again!
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. I am glad our front desk agent made your stay more enjoyable.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We've stayed at this hotel many times before when we visited Disneyland. All other stays before this one the parking was free. When we arrived for this visit the hotel advised us of an $8 parking fee for everyday that we stayed there. Which was ok, but they charged my account three different times for odd amounts. When asked they were unclear why. I don't understand why they needed to authorize my card three different times. Other than this issue the hotel was pleasant.
Manager Response: Thank you for the Trpadvisor review. I am sorry about the credit card issue at the front desk. I will review the procedures with them, so this does not happen again. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel for Disneyland Trip
Summary: This was our second annual trip to Disneyland. We would definitely go back to it, if we don't step up to staying on-property next time. I was able to get a bigger room with my Hilton Honors level, even though this is a premium location. :)   We could walk or take the Anaheim Resort Transit to Disnelyand. The ART was about $21 for our family of three to go back and forth to Disney for 4 days straight. The breakfast are exactly what you expect at Embassy Suites and there is plenty of seating. So get your egg white omelette while the kids get pancakes or waffles and Dad gets his fill of bacon. Tasty, hot, fast and included. Love it.  The pizza nights are a good value, and the restaurant had kids eat free with parent entree purchase. GREAT VALUE and MacnCheese makes for a happy 3
Manager Response: Thank you for your Trip Advisor review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed all the amenities that the hotel had to offer. We take great pride in our morning breakfast, so I am glad to hear you enjoyed it. Sorry about the odor in the pool area. I will see what that might be so that issue won't happen again. We hope to see you again soon.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at a number of Disneyland area hotels over the years. The Embassy Suites is always a good choice. You can fit 6 if two don't mind the uncomfortable sofa sleeper, free breakfast and good location. The hotel is being remodeled which is a good thing, beds are OK, pillows were something that you used to get on an airplane, terrible. You do have to take the Anaheim shuttle to the Disney Parks, $4/day, comes every 20 minutes.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that the staff took such good care of you and you found the amenities of the property to your liking. I also thank you for the note on our pillows. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Quiet. Close to attractions. nice bed. Very nice place to stay. Will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thanks for the comments and hope to see you return soon to the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Can NOT see Disneyland from "Disney facing suite"
Summary: Overall this place was just average.  The initial suite we booked was a "Disneyland Facing Suite" and cost an additional $50/night.  This room had an awesome view of the hotel next door NOT of Disneyland. I suppose this suite might be worth a little extra(not$50/night) IF Disneyland was lighting fireworks however that is not the case in October.  They switched our room no hassle and moved us to another room.  So we dropped our bags and went to Disneyland when we got back to the room it smelled like crap.  Apparently they had moved us to a SMOKING suite so we suffered the first night and packed all our things up for a 3rd time and were moved to a non smoking suite.  Like I said pretty average all around.  Staff was friendly, rooms were clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I apologize that you were not happy with your room assignment during your recent trip. We strive to accommodate all reservations but occasionally cannot meet every room request. We hope you will consider giving us a second chance if you return to the area. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: My daughter booked this hotel and by the pictures online, I was very disappointed. The pictures do no justice to this place. The room was nice with great amenities, microwave, fridge, 2 flat screened televisions. The atrium where every room faced was amazing. The buffet breakfast was served there in such a beautiful atmosphere with goldfish ponds and rock mountains. The staff was more than helpful and courteous. We totally enjoyed our stay and would never want to stay anywhere else..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you found the atrium and overall hotel was  to your liking. We look forward to servicing your travel needs at the Embassy Suites should you return to the Anaheim area. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We went their with our 3 teenage sons. The location is great for the parks. There is good accesss to the highways. The breakfast was wonderful and they had a free internet connection
Manager Response: Thanks for your gracious comments about your recent stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South. Hope to see you return again soon. Safe travels.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Rooms very 'tired'. Bathroom had mould. Fold away couch practically broken. No top sheet or pillows supplied for it. Housekeeping did not remove dirty cups for three days. In house restaurant menu limited but good quality. Included breakfast was good but dining area's floor is uneven & very crowded with tables & chairs, so unable to sit comfortably. Front desk staff unhelpful & unfriendly not a smile amongst them for our three day stay!!  Local bus service transfers to Disney from hotels front door was excellent. Have stayed in other Embassy Suites & this one disappoints.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our guest rooms and our service. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: we stayed for 5 nights in June 2010 in room 823. This was our second trip to Disney so did not see the need to stay at the expensive Disney Hotels for a second time. We chose this Hotel following a visit to their sister property in Waikiki. having read other reiews we requested a room high up. We arrived at 10am expecting for our room to not be available, we dropped our bags and were assured that if we came back after 2 that our requested room would be ready. Unfortunately when we returned at 3pm our room was still not ready and were told to come back after 5. (!!!) after a heated discussion and a request to talk to the Manager our room was miraculously ready immediately. Not a great start after a long haul flight. However, we then had a knock on our door and the manager had
Manager Response: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of the hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Repeat Guest - Hard to Beat The Value - We'll Be Back Again!
Summary: This is a repeat stay for me – probably my fourth. It’s just hard to beat the value here: the extra room with the separate bedroom, the full breakfasts, and the “manager’s reception” meaning wine for the price of a tip. Very welcome after a long day with Mickey Mouse! True, you need to either come back early or come back and return (on longer-hour days, like weekends) to the park, but we hit the reception 2 of our three nights there. You do get tired of the same popcorn and snack mix, but hey, free is free. And the breakfasts remain awesome – fruit, pancakes, made-to-order omelets, yogurt, cereal/oatmeal – what’s not to like? Makes other hotel continental breakfasts look pathetic.  We used the pool once but the water was a bit too chilly for late September evening swimming. Hot
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect for familes on budget visiting Disneyland
Summary: We've stayed here twice on family visits to Disneyland, and it's perfect for our family of four.  Suites are great. Kids on the sleeper sofa, Mom and Dad get a little privacy in the bedroom. Kitchenette is great for reheating leftovers, or for cooking food we get from the walkable Target just down the street.  Free breakfast is very busy, and tables can be hard to find depending on the time, but well worth the huge savings for a family of four.  Shuttle bus runs frequently (every 20-30 minutes) from the hotel parking lot to Disney. Multi-day and one day passes are available.  Embassy Suites are our hotel of choice when we travel as a family, and this one doesn't disappoint.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic place to stay when visiting Disneyland, California
Summary: My son-in-law, daughter and my 2 grandchildren (ages 4 and 6) stayed here for 5 nights.  The location is great, there is a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes.  It is $4 per adult and $1 per child per day.  While we would have liked the shuttle to run a little later sometimes it really was very convenient and easier than driving your own car.   It is about a 10 minute  ride at the most.  Some bus drivers made the trip something to really look forward to as they were "wanna-be comedians"!  The free breakfast is one of the best breakfast that I have seen in a hotel.  The hotel itself is very nice, our room was large.  We had a one bedroom with separate living room.  The bedroom had 2 double beds and the living room had a pull out sofa bed.  The kids slept together, myself (grandma)
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here on a business trip. I was there for 3 nights.  It is a good hotel. I have stayed in Embassy Suites before and this hotel didnt disappoint or surprise. It was exactly what I expected.  Rooms were very big. Bed was big and comfortable. Bathroom was clean and the shower worked well.  Breakfast is OK and adequate. Certainly you can get a lot of food, but I dont think there is a lot of variety on offer - I didnt find any muesli, cooked meats and cheese, porridge etc.  As I was jet lagged then I was there at opening time (0630) every day so I had no problems with queues or crowding. It was clear this is a problem as there were signs everywhere indicating what to expect at what times. I can imagine the peak time, full of families, would be quite horrible.  One thing I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lives up to expectations of Embassy Suites
Summary: The hotel definitely lived up to my expectations, I would have given a five if anything had slightly exceeded expectations. Room was nice and clean and the staff were very friendly. The bus to Disneyland was very convenient. Breakfast was chaotic but fine and the pool area was nice but a little unkept by the end of the day.  I had called the hotel due to an 8 hour delay which meant we arrived at midnight, I would have been thrilled if the sofa bed had been pulled out for the children or even enough bedding left for them.  The lady I spoke to assured me my room would not be released if we arrived after midnight but didn't seem interested in knowing our name to make any sort of notation on the phone call.  The children loved the fish and turtles and of course the lion in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed 4 nights here during our recent visit to Disneyland, the hotel staff were very helpful and courteous. The first night, the frigirator did not work properly, the front staff sent an engineer immediately, who in turn replaced the frige with a brand new one.  The horrifying part came when we got back home, my daughter was bitten, first we thought it was mosquito bite, which was not usural in my house anyway, until my husband found a bug near my daughter's bed, he killed it, the bug has my daughter's blood, the bug was later confirmed with information and photos on the internet as bed bug, we were horrified, and spent the whole week doing as much laundry as possible, steam mopped the hardwood floor, dumped some stuff that could not be washed, etc. This is the last thing we
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We love this resort! Have stayed here repeatedly for Disneyland
Summary: I can't believe I'm only finally getting around to reviewing this resort. We've stayed at this resort over 12 times in the past few years each time we've visited Disneyland. It is a great place to stay!   The staff is amazing and very accommodating. If you want anything, they will be sure to try and get it for you.  The rooms are always very clean and well appointed. The beds are very comfortable and the bedding is fantastic. I'm a hotel snob and typically stay in higher end brands, but this hotel is right up there in comfort and amenities.   The morning breakfast is amazing! Full on buffet style breakfast with anything and everything you could ever want. This is no continental free breakfast - this is seriously awesome and amazing.  The ride to Disneyland on the ART bus is very
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for the convenience of the two-room suite and full continental breakfast. The hotel has what you'd expect from an Embassy Suites. We enjoy the two-room suite since we have young children (ages 2 and 3) and the breakfast is a huge money saver and is easy when you're trying to feed the kids quickly and get out the door. The kids loved the fish and turtles in the lobby, and this hotel has an animated lion that roars every 30 minutes. The downside for sure is the distance from Disneyland. We walked home a few times at the end of a long day and the kids slept in their strollers, but it is at least a mile, if not 2 miles. The bus that runs to Disneyland is not a hotel shuttle. It is the local public transportation and was unreliable, packed to the gills, and very
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfortable, spacious, relaxing, would stay again
Summary: We decided to take a last minute road trip to Disneyland from WA at the end of August this year.  We drove for 23 hours, on the way down I researched on my cell phone all the hotels around Disneyland.  We had 2 adults and 3 children, so I wanted a hotel with a little more room than just beds.  I came across the embassy suites and read the reviews and I decided we would stay there.   The room was the perfect size for all of us. It was clean, beds were comfortable, nice bathroom.  We would defiantly recommend this hotel to family's wanting more space.  It is not walking distance to Disneyland, but it is only about a mile drive away.    Pros:  large rooms          Heated pool          Clean          Hot buffet breakfast ( better than any free breakfast at any hotel I've ever stayed
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here while visiting Disneyland.  Very friendly staff and awesome free breakfast!  Great place to stay with very large comfortable rooms.  We are going back next year and are staying there again!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel for Disney - Easy to stay here
Summary: Stayed with our teenage sons who really liked this.  Very big sitting room with sofa bed, with dining area and kitchenette, plus spacious bedroom.  Free breakfast with a lot of choice - our sons loved this.  Very easy to get to and from Disneyland direct from the hotel, though if you want to visit LA itself - is a fair drive.  Kitchenette wasn't well provisioned - had coffee machine, microwave and fridge but no way to cook a meal.  This hotel also has coin operated laundry which was great on a longer trip.  All beds were doubles which is great for sleeping singly but less so when a couple is used to a kingsize!  Another annoying thing was a lack of stairs.  We were on the second floor and got impatient having to wait for a lift when would have been easier to scoot down stairs.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good option for families going to Disneyland
Summary: We booked this hotel for the suite.  It wasn't that close to Disney but the shuttle worked great.  If you aren't going to stay at a Disney resort I would recommend staying here.  Breakfast was just okay other than that it was perfect for our family.  We will probably be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay and would use again.
Summary: Firstly I should point out, we did not go to Disney and this hotel was chosen by my partner's company so proximity to Disney was not a factor in chosing to stay in this hotel. That being said I'd really rate this hotel quite highly, it's suitable for more than just those guests chossing to visit DL. We found the rooms to be spacious, really clean and very well maintained. Room service was excellant, the staff where all friendly and the facilities where extremely good. The pool and outside area was clean as was the gym and restaurant area's. The food and service where good (particularly breakfast) and the manager's reception was a refreshing extra (you don't get this kind of thing in UK hotels). If I had any complaint, it would be the lack of knowledge the reception staff have
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that the staff took such good care of you and you found the amenities of the property to your liking. We look forward to seeing you return soon! Safe travels.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Good location 1 mile south of Disneyland on the the Anaheim shuttle bus stop to the park (shuttle is $4 a day for adults but well worth it to avoid driving and parking hassles). Staff was professional and helpful. Hotel was clean and well maintained. Nice pool complex. Breakfast is one of the better Embassy Suites operations. The biggest problem was breakfast doesn't start til 7:30 a.m. which doesn't work for families getting an early start to the park or business folks attending convention center conferences. We complained as did others and front desk clerk confirmed they get a lot of complaints. Also parking is $8 a day, which seems ridiculous for a Harbor Boulevard hotel. Overall, a much more reasonably priced option than staying at a Disney hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you found the staff, pool and location to your liking. We look forward to servicing your travel needs at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South  should you return to the Anaheim area.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: The one-bedroom suites overlooking Disney provide a great vantage point for the fireworks, although they are much more dramatic in the park itself. Breakfast is free and varied, and the manager's reception at 5:30 p.m. offers free soda, wine and cocktails along with popcorn but little else in the way of appetizers, although pizza is sold at $2 per slice. There was a special on Disney tickets while we were there, but the ticket desk did not offer this option. Fortunately my daughter had found the special on the internet so we were able to buy them at the park, saving several hundred dollars. Front desk not particularly friendly or helpful, and final bill was incorrect. It took some time, and a chat with the manager, to straighten it out. Probably will not return, as there are
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place for a stay with a young child
Summary: My wife, 1 year old daughter and I satyed here for 3 nights as a stop over on our way to New York so we could take the baby to Disneyland. The hotel was very well priced and the free breakfast was excellent. Staff were all extremely helpful and I'd definately stay here again. Only issue is it is a bit of a trip to Disney compared to some of the other hotels although we just caught the bus which comes very regularly and drops you door to door almost. The only other issue was the wife was about $13 a night when a lot of places offer it free these days but apart from that it was a great hotel and I'd definatly stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am one that reads reviews of hotels before going or staying at a particular hotel. The Emabssy Suites South came well recommended and rightfully so. It is in a perfect location away from all the Disneyland traffic, but not too far from Disneyland. The beds were very comfortable, except the pillows could have been a little firmer, but other than that the room was very comfortable. The staff was extremely nice and helpful from the time we checked in until the time we left. Nice and courteous must be their primary goal, because it worked, they were awesome ! The morning made to order omlettes and breakfast buffet is the best I've had in a long time at any hotel. Then in the afternoon pizza and free drinks, what more could you ask for. The freshly made pizza is one of the best ! I
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review. Iam happy to hear that you had a great time at our hotel and we look forward for you to stay again in the near future.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: To: Poor Customer Service @ Embassy Suites Garden grove. True sometimes you arent always able to get what you "REQUEST". I find a few things wrong with the picture 1. Embassy Suites is over a mile away from Disneyland so, how exactly were you going to see the park? 2. the fireworks don't start untll 9:30pm you state you missed them at 9:10pm (ummm) 3rd you would need to repeat the info to the anyone trying to help you. 4th what is the refund policy? Listen, when you travel to the happist place on early try to be flexable if things go wrong because.......let's all hear it THEY DO!!! all vacaton have bumps in the road. You need to chill out.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Exactly what we needed for Disney
Summary: Our family of five stayed here for 3 nights for a trip to Disney.  The hotel was perfect for our needs.  The location was a short drive to the Toy Story parking lot making it easy for us to leave the park in the afternoons and come back to the hotel for naptime.  Also, having a suite meant we could put the kids down for naps/bed without forcing the adults to bed at the same time.  Breakfast can be packed if you wait until after 8a to head down, but if you are visiting Disney, the breakfast crowd is nothing compared to what you deal with at the parks!  The breakfast is excellent and well-stocked.  They feed a ton of people but they do it well.  We took advantage of the free snacks/drinks at the Manager's Reception one time; the other evenings we were already back at the parks.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy our pizza during the Manager's Reception. We usually get good comments on it, but I will share with my staff and see what we can do to improve it. Thanks for the comments and I hope to see you and your family soon.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Fair value, well placed for Disneyland.
Summary: My wife, 12 year-old daughter and I stayed here for 11 nights.  Plus points : Well placed for Disneyland (3/4 mile), Clean restaurant, Pleasant staff, Clean rooms, "Free" breakfast and evening drinks from 7pm-10pm.  Nice pool area. Minus points : Over-priced parking ($12 pn), Staff untrained in fire procedures (we had an "evacuation" @ midnight one night where the alarm went off and there was no direction or marshalling from the staff - potentially VERY dangerous.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments about your recent stay at the hotel. I do apologize about the fire alarm issue that happened late at night. I did discuss with my staff how to handle these situations better in the future. If you need anything else please do not hesitate to contact me at Obed.Morales@hilton.com.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times when taking the kiddos to Disneyland- this last time being the last week of July. The best price I could find (after searching numerous sites) was Hilton.com; they even have AAA discount. This time we reserved a room facing the park. Since my kids are little, we never stay for the fireworks at Dland but this time, we had a great view from our room. My only complaint is that the pull out sofa bed was dirty and there were no extra pillows. I wish we had realized this before getting two cranky kids ready for bed then calling housekeeping and waiting for pillows. Other than that, it was another nice experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am a Hilton Gold Club member and used points to make a reservation at this hotel for 2 rooms on Saturday night since I was traveling with 4 kids to Disneyland.  Prior to arriving to the hotel, I had called three times to ensure that the hotel knew that I wanted the rooms to be close together, if not connecting.  The reservation was BOOKED and CONFRMED for 2 rooms facing Disney so that we could enjoy the fireworks at 9pm with one booked as a corner room.  At check in, the clerk Monica tried to give us rooms that were 3 floors apart.  After 25 minutes of going back and forth and her repeating that Embassy does not guarantee rooms and my repeating that I had to pay more for the view and that I was reassured numerous times that my request would not be a problem, I finally got the
Manager Response: It was nice talking to you over the phone last week. I do apologize about the issues you had at the front desk. I have spoken to my staff and something like this will not happen again. Thanks for sharing your comments and you have my information if you need anything.

Summary: We spent 4 nights there, and were very impressed. Great hotel!  Main plus points: - All rooms are suites, which is a huge advantage when travelling with little children - Proximity to Disneyland  - Free parking - Great breakfast buffet, much better than what we're used to from other American hotels - Manager's reception with free drinks and snacks every evening - Nice pool and jacuzzi  - Great decorations of the internal courtyard - Decent bar area with interesting local beers  Can't think of many minus points really: - I guess it's natural that in the holiday season the breakfast area gets very busy and you sometimes had to wait for 10 minutes - When it's busy, it's also quite noisy (but the bedrooms are not facing the courtyard, so this didn't affect our sleep)
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review for the hotel. I am glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. One piece of advice is head to breakfast early each day before the crowd.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel if you are going to Disney
Summary: Nice Embassy Suites hotel with nice lobby and typical ES atrium style.  Rooms are spacious and clean.  Parking is OK, but it is in a crowded surface lot and is $15 per day.  Breakfast is good, but can get very crowded -- so go early.  This is a good location in Orange County.  A 5-10 minute drive to Angels Stadium and, although not walking distance to Disney (probably a couple of miles to main gate), just a few minutes away by car.  There are shuttles to the parks.  Would definitely recommend for those going to Disney.  If you are not going to Disney and are just looking for a good OC spot, you may want to stay a little further from the theme park.  This hotel is very nice and it will work, but be ready for the crowds that come to the area.
Manager Response: Thanks for the tripadvisor review. I noticed that you said you paid $15 a day for parking. I am sorry to hear that because we charge only $8 a day. If you can email me at Obed.Morales@hilton.com, I will get that corrected for you. Again thanks again and we hope to see you again.  Obed Morales General Maanger

Summary: We stayed there for 5 days with four of our grandchildren. We had a blast. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Kids loved the pool and the roaring Lion in the lobby. We loved the free hot breakfast every morning complete with made to order omelets. The suites have a bedroom with 2 beds and a living area with fold out couch. The hotel is only a few blocks from Disneyland. Thanks for the memories. We had a great time
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! We strive to be as family friendly as possible and we hope to see you and your family again. Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disney vacation
Summary: I can't say enough about this hotel!  My son and I had a wonderful time at Disneyland, and our stay here made it even better.  Our room was comfortable and exactly as advertised.  Didn't have linens for the pullout bed, but a call to the front desk fixed that quickly.  We arrived rather late, but the hotel restaurant was still open.  Good food, and kids ate free! Breakfast with made to order omelets was included and very good - just make sure to to early during peak seson.  It gets crowded fast!  Weeknights include A manager's reception with open bar and snacks.  You also buy pizza for $2 a slice for a quick dinner. The Anaheim Resort transportation stops right in front of the hotel and takes you directly to Disneyland.  Passes can be purchased at the front desk for $3-4 per
Manager Response: I am so happy to hear that you and your son had a great time at the hotel. We hope to see you again soon.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: Good place to stay fro Disney
Summary: The Emassy Suites was a good place to stay for the Disney experience.  Close emough to walk, but far enough away that you do not get too "Disney-fied"! The suites are spacious, comfortable and well equipped.  Free breakfast and drinks in the evening add to the experience. And don't worry about the queues for breakfast; they move faster than you think and are worth waiting for. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, and a lion in the lobby wihivh roars at the half hour. The water features can be a bit noisy, and the feel can be a bit like a well maintained council block.  But thta does not really detract.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review. Breakfast at times has long lines, but its worth the wait.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary Heading: We love this place - several years running
Summary: Somebody figured it out - the kids are happy; therefore, the parents are happy.  This is a great family hotel.  We've stayed here three times over the past four years.  Every visit is as great as the first.  We've had just one "issue":  one year the room we were assigned had not been cleaned, but the folks working this property have always stepped-up where they could.  Here's the plan:  get up around 8:00 and everybody goes down to the lobby/atrium dining area for a GREAT, fresh-made, cooked-to-order, free breakfast.  After spending the day at Disney/Universal/Et al,   the kids enjoy the pizza & soda and run around in the huge lobby/atrium area, the adults can relax around the lobby/atrium enjoying free drinks, popcorn, & chex mix (I think the pizza is $2 for a big slice).  The
Manager Response: Thanks Rick. I know making the kids happy always leads to having happy parents. I am glad to hear that you are a repeat customer and we look forward to your next visit.   Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Hi,  My husband and our 2 kids and my husband's sister stayed at the Embassy Suites last week so that we could visit Disneyland. From the moment we got there it was a disaster. I made my reservations over the phone I paid $10 a more a night because I was told that the "travelers package" had more benefits. These benefits were: self parking would be included, 4 shuttle passes for the shuttle that goes to DL and lastly Free WiFi. From the moment I got there not a single person I spoke to was willing to honor these benefits until at least 15 minutes of going back and forth. The room was so dirty I had to wash my children's feet before bed because the bottom of their feet would turn black from the carpet. Their were 5 of us in the room but they kept giving us 4 towels. On the first
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We are glad you chose our hotel during your recent stay in the area and we apologize for the housekeeping problems you encountered. Dirty rooms are not typical at our hotel and we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We will make every effort to ensure our rooms meet the highest housekeeping standards. We also regret we were not able to provide you with the quality of food you expected. We are constantly working to improve our menu offerings and your comments will help us improve in this area. We hope you will give us a second chance if you visit our area in the future.  Obed Morales General Manager

Summary: Stayed for 5 nights for a family/friends trip to Disneyland/Legoland.  Hotel room was great, 2 double beds in seperate bedroom, pull out sofa bed in living room, dining table, microwave, refriig, very modern.  Free breakfast was great, although very busy. Thought parking charge of $8 a night was too much since the parking lot was not gated or secured. Overall, exceeded out expectations.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lots of Kids, but Still Nice.
Summary: Be aware, when searching this address in GoogleMaps! We got off the 57 on the wrong Chapman and had to go all the way down Harbor!  My husband and I stayed here for one night and had a fantastic time. Be aware there's a parking charge: $8 a night. We were not here for Disney or a convention but we enjoyed walking the area very much in the morning. Elevators, as others have said, are slow, but we only had a problem once.  The pool area is very nice with chairs, lounges, and couches with music piped in. There were lots of kids in the pool, but we really enjoyed just sitting on one of the couches and enjoying the sunshine.  The manager's reception had popcorn and a pub mix available. Pizza was available for $2 a slice, we didn't try it. We did however enjoy some alcoholic drinks
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Deal breaker parking fees and no direct shuttle to Disney!.
Summary: The free breakfast doesn't make up for paying for parking at the Hotel then pay for transportation or Parking at Disneyland. Hellllooo ! Ill stay across the street with a 5  minute walk to the theme parks save on time , hassle of commuting all for a free breakfast. I was seriously considering this hotel for a two week stay again in December  but parking at $8.00 a night then another $15.00 at the Theme park plus the commute forget it!!!!  I would have stayed here if the parking was free or they had a Hotel shuttle and not the Anaheim Transit for 4 dollars per person. Geez they nickel and dime ya anyway they can.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have a family of five so we often stay at Embassy Suites.  We have stayed in many, in different cities and this was our least favorite.  I have to say that the fault doesn't so much lie with the hotel, but the guests.  This hotel is super busy with Disney guests and it is always swarming with people.  People are always traipsing around the hotel in wet bathing suits and there is garbage in the hallways, left there by the guests.  The staff probably can't even keep up.  The elevators are very slow.  The staff who work the breakfast look so harried, because they have to put up with huge lines of people who act like this free breakfast is going to be their last meal ever.  We stayed at the ES in San Diego, with a huge Sea World and convention crowd and it was not like this at
Manager Response: none

Summary: The other reviews on here are accurate, so I will just cut to the chase with some tips and information. One thing that nobody has mentioned that I think will be very helpful is that you should know that this hotel is a very family-friendly Disneyland hotel. I did not realize until I arrived that Harbor Blvd is nothing but hotel after hotel after hotel. Even though this hotel is technically located in Garden Grove, you are still right down the street from the Main Gate of Disneyland. You should also know that no matter what hotel you choose along Harbor Blvd, they ALL cater to Disney guests and they ALL have information on Disneyland. Inside this Embassy Suites, there is actually a "Disneyland" ticket counter located just across from the main check-in desk--you can't miss it. All
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved this hotel.  It was just a few blocks from Disneyland (drive, don't walk).  The breakfast buffet was great.  This was towards the end of our Arizona, Nevada, California vacation so I really needed to do laundry.  They had 2 laundry rooms which made it quick and easy to do while the kids rested.  We love Embassy Suites because our older daughter can sleep on the sleep away couch.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the hotel earlier this month for a friends wedding. The hotel was absolutely perfect to host our friends ceremony & reception. The atrium was gorgeous, the reception even more so & it was nice to have everything centralized in one place. I'm not very familiar with Embassy but I would definitely come back to this hotel & other Embassys. The guest rooms were spacious and it was nice to have the sleeping room separate from the living room. The breakfast in the morning was absolutely wonderful. To have such a large selection was so nice & the omelette station was an added plus. The evening reception with the free beverages was a pleasant addition to the whole stay! A location I would come back to for future trips & recommend to others people!
Manager Response: none

Summary: we stayed for 8 nights and the hotel was clean and friendly, we had one noisy neighbour who turned quite abusive on last night which was a shame, but one phone call to the reception and very promptly the woman was told to stay in her room and keep the shouting down.  The staff couldnt have been more helpful and friendly.  Having the washing / drying machines was brilliant as we had made two other stops in the US and a quick wash was needed, excellent facilities.  The kids loved the lion and fish and turtles!  kept them amused while my husband and I had an extra cup of coffee at breakfast, which was great and not too busy and we were there for July 4 weekend.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: NEVER BOOK YOUR WEDDING EVENTS HERE!!!
Summary: Totally bad experience with Hotel Management. DON'T BOOK YOUR EVENTS HERE ESPECIALLY WEDDINGS. Sara Keller was the catering event coordinator. Very disorganized and a total disappointment. She provided bad customer service and did not deliver (story kept changing). They should defiantly look into hiring a more skilled and knowledgeable individual that has good customer service skills!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Five years ago I moved away from this area and was back for my high school reunion and to visit family.  Being there a week, my husband and I wanted a bit more space than a regular hotel.  We also wanted a romantic vacation which is why we didn't stay with family.  This was great.  I was very picky about the location because Anaheim/Garden Grove definitely has some sketchy areas.  I knew I would feel safe here.  The rooms were comfortable and well appointed.  Disneyland was not an issue for me, but just know that it is not really within walking distance.  I believe there were shuttles but I didn't inquire about them.  There are plenty of local restaurants.   We only had their breakfast once since it was very crowded.  I don't knock the hotel for this since it is Anaheim in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: family of 4 stayed here over 4th July.  was a bit worried after some of the reviews but was pleasantly surprised.  Room was clean and spacious, bathroom bigger than normal.  Lobby etc was a bit hit with the kids.  Check was smooth and when we had a problem with the a/c staff were very helpful.  Breakfast was good although as usual omelette line was long even though we were there early.  2o mins walk to the parks which kids didn't mind even when we left the park at 11pm.  bus service was quick and efficient but we mad a mad dash on 4th to get there quick before mad rush from fireworks crowd so not sure how long we would have had to wait if we hadn't.  lots of dining options around the hotel.  didn't use the pool as we didn't take time out during the day from the parks, I think
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean & very convenient - a good value.
Summary: Stayed here June 2011 for a family trip to Disneyland.  The room was very clean, comfortable, and convenient for visiting the park - quick 5 to 10 minute trip on the shuttle.  Breakfast was pretty good, as well.  Included a hot breakfast (several options), fresh fruit, yogurt, and many baked good items.   Everyone from the two and six year olds to the adults  were satisfied.   Would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent!  We will definitely be back
Summary: This hotel was great!  The rooms were very spacious.  A two room suite with the bedroom in past the living room.  When closing the bedroom door, we didn't hear anyway hallway noise or noise from other rooms.  The complimentary breakfast was great!  The happy hour, while also being complimentary sounded like it would have been good too, but we didn't partake because we had plans when the happy hours were going on.  The pool area was beautiful and very clean.  The hotel was close to Disneyland, about 5 minutes, there is a shuttle that takes you to DIsneyland from the hotel which is what we did.  You have to pay for the shuttle, but it's still cheaper than paying for parking at Disney.  Overall we were very satisifed with this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - we will be back!
Summary: We stayed here June 19, 2011 through June 25, 2011.  Very nice hotel - well kept, friendly staff, and clean.  The rooms were nicely sized and worked well for our family of six.  The kids slept in the separate room with double beds and the wife and I slept out on the sleeper sofa.  For two folks nearing 40, the sleeper sofa was not bad...at least better than many I've slept on.  The two TV's worked out well so that my wife and I were able to watch one program while the kids watch something else in the other room.  Our travel agency provided us with bus passes for the Anaheim Resort Transit bus, which stopped in front of the hotel every 20-30 minutes from about 6:30 am (on Magic Mornings) until 12:30am (that's when the last bus left Disneyland).  The bus was a nice and easy way to
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights with a large family of 12.  We had 4 rooms.  We were somewhat disappointed that our request for at least 1 set of adjoining rooms was not honored as we had an infant and really wanted to have a room that opened to my parents room so they could easily watch our baby when we went back to the park late at night.  I love Embassy Suites because they have the separate sleeping room from the living room which is great when traveling with kids.  This is a great place to stay with a big group.  The free breakfast and the reception offered a great place for the family to meet up each day to socialize without having to spend any extra money.   The only thing about the breakfast that could be improved upon was the hours.  Disneyland opens at 7 AM on certain days
Manager Response: none
