Summary: Where do I begin? Saying the room was damp is putting it lightly. When I sat on the couch that looked like a Salvation Army Donation reject, my pants actually got wet. Once I got past that, I had to deal with the dirty bathtub...there was hair in it. I would have thrown up, had I thought the bathroom was clean enough to do so. Then the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, they put us in the wrong room type, and so on.   Other than being close to Disneyland, there is no logical reason a person or family would stay at this flea bag. Oh, and the lion scared our two year old so much that she asked if there were lions at each hotel we stayed at after this one. Dont waste your money, find another hotel.
Manager Response: Dear akmom8,  Thank you for sharing your feedback and taking the time to post your comments regarding your most recent stay!  First off, I am deeply sorry for the horrible experience and the negative impact it has left on you and your family, especially your two year old.  Guest reviews and feedback are extremely important to us whether good or bad because it allows us to learn and grow at the same time as well as communicate and improve moving forward.  Overall, guest experience is truly a top priority among our staff and team and we recognize that 95% of our guests are visiting us on vacation with children of all ages.  Our resident Lion, Leo, was added to our Embassy Suites family to enhance the experience of all our guests in a positive and fun way… not to terrify or scare the children in any way.  Over the years, Leo, has become loved by so many and has truly become a staple of our atrium area.  Please know that whenever we get any types of complaints or feedback from our guests whether about the condition of their room, location or their experience we always do our absolute best to make the bad experiences right for our guests and their families.  With regards to the hair you found in the bathtub, I’m hoping you allowed us the opportunity to make an attempt to make this situation right by expressing your concerns of the cleanliness with the hotel or with an Housekeeping Associate while you were here.  Because we are such a family friendly hotel, often times our guests (whether adults or children) enjoy spending a lot of time at our outdoor swimming pool… it is because of this that often times, there may be areas of the hotel that experience getting wet or damp from guests walking through public areas after exiting the pool.  Unfortunately, there are times when they may not have not been completely dried off but I can assure you had we known that the couch was wet, we would have immediately done our best to notify guests and made all attempts to dry and isolate the area.  Safety is high priority and often times the Lobby area where the couch is located does see traffic from guests attempting to get to the pool or leaving the pool area to get back to their suites.  Please know that I have shared your review with our entire staff and we have definitely learned from this experience and your comments and are diligently working on ways of improving our communication and service with our guests. Again, we apologize and we would like to thank you for taking the time to post your review.

The room was affordable, spacious, staff was friendly, room was clean.  We had no complaints and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.  This was our grand daughter,s first "hotel" and she loved the experience.

Summary: My family of four stayed here for 4 nights in May for our 1st Disneyland trip and it was great! Large room with plenty of space, fridge, coffee pot, microwave... Really good breakfast buffet every morning and happy hour every afternoon. The bus for Disneyland picks up literally right in front of the hotel and it only takes about 5 mins to the gates of Disney. We had nothing but helpful, friendly staff. We would definitely consider staying here again!

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, bit far from Disneyland with toddler
Summary: We love this hotel! Very clean, spacious suites, quiet, and friendly staff. Very large bedroom and living area, with plenty of room for our toddler to play and run around. Close to Target which was extremely useful. Serengeti Grill restaurant was fine - they offer a "kids eat free" deal - and room service was prompt. Shuttle to Disney ran every twenty minutes from the hotel to the park, but was unreliable on the return trip (more like every thirty minutes, and there was no set schedule). We found it better to drive and park at Downtown Disney, which was five to ten minutes' drive. The only slight hitch we had at the hotel was that they ran out of high chairs at breakfast during peak hours. Apart from this we could not find any fault at all. We had a great stay and would

Summary: I chose this hotel to stay at with my husband and 3 year old son for the first time in September after reading the reviews and we were not dissapointed! We have season passes to Disneyland so we have stayed at many hotels in the area and this is by far our new found favorite! Our last stay was at the Disney Grand and we liked  the Embassy much better! Although it is a bit far from the parks to walk its worth the drive and there is a bus that stops right in front of the hotel that will also take you to the parks for a small fee. Friendly staff, reasonable rates, extra large rooms, cleanest hotel room we have ever stayed at, nice pool & hot tub, beautiful atrium & koi pond, gift shop, nice complementary hot breakfast with made to order omlettes, managers reception every evening

Summary Heading: Not the best, but not bad

The lobby and atrium area was pretty cool with the water falls and streams that ran through the eating area.  Checking in was very frustrating!  It took 30 minutes to check in and there were no issues with the reservation or anything.  It just took them that long to check me in.  The room was small, especially the bedroom when compared to other Embassy Suites I’ve stayed at.  Over all I thought the room and bathroom was clean but was in need of some remodeling or updates.  There really weren’t a whole lot of choices for restaurants in the area.  If you wanted more choices, a cab or car ride is required.  The same goes for shopping.

Summary: We (2 adults and 2 children) stayed in a corner suite on the top floor for 3 nights visiting Disneyland.  The room has a microwave and fridge which are convenient.  The beds were comfortable.  Teh breakfast was very good.  We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: One of the Best Values in the area
Summary: We stayed here on August 21.  It is a typical Embassy Suites, but has always been a pleasant stay for us.  We have stayed at other hotels in the are and as far as value goes, it is hard to beat the Embassy Suites.    The parking charge is only $6 compared to $12 + at other hotels.  The transportation to Disneyland is via the ART shuttle, which is an extra charge.  The bonuses of the Embassy are the complimentary beverages during the manager's reception and the free breakfast.  It is nice to enjoy complimentary beer/cocktails after a day at Disneyland.  Usually this has not been too crowded.  The included breakfast is nice, but can be really crowded at times.  Go early to avoid the crowd.  We have stayed here a number of times and it tends to be one of our fall backs.  Though we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Typical quality Embassy Suites.  Room was clean.  I do not like paying for parking but $6 per night was manageable.  I wish Embassy Suites would offer free wireless internet.  Free hot breakfast was great but go early because there are a lot of families trying to get through breakfast and out to disneyland early so the breakfast buffet is crowded.  This hotel is a far walk to Disneyland but there is a shuttle service for a fee.  If you are looking to hang out at downtown disney after the parks close the shuttle is not doable since the last shuttle leaves shortly after the parks close.  I didn't know this so we were forced to walk back to the hotel after dinner one night.  Nevertheless, good value for the anaheim area.

Summary: We stayed here over the weekend for our anniversary and it was great.   Hotel is older but rooms are clean and very spacious. The lobby was great with beautiful coy ponds and a lion that roared every half hour - kids loved it.  The manager's special was great, free drinks and popcorn and pizza for $2 / slice. We got a 9th floor room that was in pretty good condition. I don't know what the other TA reviewers are talking about saying it is knocked about. I can only surmise that the 9th floor and above are reserved for loyalty club members and not as run down as lower floor rooms. Summary: I try to stay at Embassy Suites whenever possible because I have consistently had an excellent experience at each one I've stayed at. The front desk staff were very helpful.  Not only did we need help getting to Disneyland, but we also needed help finding someplace to buy baby supplies.  It doesn't make sense to pack 100 diapers if you're traveling someplace that has a Target within a few miles, so the front desk was very helpful in locating one. Summary: I am extremely fussy, so I was amazed to find not much to complain about with the Embassy Suites. There is an animated lion in the lobby that roars every 30 minutes. Summary Heading: Well-organized place with a need to update
Summary: Location is a short drive to Disneyland. We did not to expect to pay for parking at ES, but we paid $6/day. We chose to pay the extra $20 for a firework view, would have been nice if it came with the whole package. Breakfast is not of the highest quality, but it IS breakfast and ES seems to have the plan down. They are very quick, they work fast and provide many choices. They even suggest the best times to go down to avoid long lines. Excellent job on getting us through quickly. Same goes for the beverage hours in the middle of the day. Staff were prepared for a crowd and, considering, the many things that could go wrong for the zilion of us that were there for the long weekend, I think they did quite well! Thank you! Room service was quick as was our housekeeping requests.

Summary: I booked this hotel through Orbitz where they (Orbitz) does not charge you for cancellation fees. However, this hotel charges you 100% for your cancellation, I am not sure if that is only for Orbitz reservations or not. It doesn't matter, the staff at Embassy Suites (Nicole and manager Lawrence) surely don't care. The concert I was attending in June (U2 360 Tour) was cancelled until 2011. Again, Nicole and Lawrence at the Embassy Suites don't care. NO REFUNDS allowed! Good to know to never use this chain, you may have to cancel for unforeseen reasons, again, they don't care.
Manager Response: First off, I want to thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback and I completely understand your frustration with the cancellation policy through Orbitz.  Orbitz is a 3rd party company that sells hotel rooms at a discounted rate. Unfortunately, when guests book through Orbitz, there is a no cancellation policy, so there is a risk involved in obtaining the lower rate. We think it is very important for our guests to understand cancellation policies of the 3rd party booking engines before choosing where to book their reservations.  Reservations that are booked on the Embassy Suites Brand website allow cancellations with no penalty, as long as you do so 24 hours before your arrival date. This policy does exclude the Advance Purchase Rate.

Summary Heading: Good Family Hotel with Comfortable Beds & Great Free Food/Drinks

Great price (booked package through Costco), nice large room with all amenities, comforable bed (even the small sofa sleeper), breakfast with hot omelets, free drinks & popcorn daily at mgr's reception. ART pick up right out front. Can be noisy with atrium but we were lucky to be a little tucked away. No balcony or fireworks view so I was a little disappointed. Staff isn't great for customer service at desk or restaurant but we didn't have big complaints. Fridge didn't close tight so we lost some food and milk but still pleased with our experience.

Summary Heading: Great for kids,lovely rooms, can be noisy- but family friendly

The next week some sort of band from a similar age group stayed and a few teens decided to hang outside our door at 12am and have a loud gossip, even though I rang down nothing was done and they continued to chat and run up and down.. however annoying this was we could understand as it is a teen and kid friendly hotel, so don't let that put you off - unless you are an older traveller looking for peace and quiet....  you probably should go to the hyatt next door.  We stayed here with small children and after
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful remarks which I will share with our entire team. We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: Had a conference last week in Anaheim, and while the conference hotel was the Hilton Convention Center Hotel at $199/night, booked the Embassy suite 0.8 miles away. Summary Heading: They charge for Wireless Internet and for Parking

We came to Disneyland in the past and stayed at Motel 8, which had the same type of service, free parking and free wirelles internet.

The rates include accommodations,  20% off Room Charge, Complimentary High-Speed Internet, Cooked-to-Order Breakfast, Evening Manager's Reception, Bottle of Water & Snack, and Complimentary Parking.   We hope you had a wonderful Disneyland Vacation and we would love to see you on your next visit!

Summary Heading: unbelievable value for money, perfect for any family.

It certainly set us up for a full day of exploring and enjoying Disneyland!  We were disappointed to miss out on 'happy hour' each afternoon at the bar!  The only drawback was the sofabed.  The mattress was more comfortable on the floor.  Apart from that we enjoyed our stay and plan to visit again this September (2010).  I hope they still have the 'Africa' scene near the dining area! Summary: We stayed at Embassy Suites for 4 nights -- 3 adults and 3 kids (ages 4 and under) while visiting Disney. The hotel's location was excellent (close to Disney) and check-in was painless. You may need to look for a bellhop who may not be stationed outside when you drive up. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job in maintaining it during our stay--especially with messy toddlers and an infant! I loved the daily included breakfast which included great variety--hot and cold cereal, made to order omelets, eggs/breakfast potatoes/meats and I was overall impressed with the quality given the value you get from the hotel cost. I usually expect some duds but even the mini-muffins were moist and coffee hot and strong. Also, the kiddies liked the fish pond and were enthralled
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, very clean, friendly staff & complimentary breakfast was perfect.
Summary: Great stay overall. The staff was friendly & our room was cleaned & turned over perfectly every day. The hot complimentary breakfast was perfect to get our day going. Plus it saved us a ton on food expense at Disneyland where a pancake breakfast for one could cost $8 easily. The ART to Disneyland picked up right at the entrance of the hotel & was perfect especially when you have little ones like us. The shuttle distance from the hotel to Disneyland was about a 10 minute ride & the shuttle drops you off close walking distance to the entrance of the park. One disadvantage of the hotel was that on the Friday & Saturday we were there, it was literally impossible to catch an elevator down. We stayed on the 9th floor and on our 1st morning were waiting almost 15 minutes to catch an
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fair hotel with very poor service
Summary: We stay at Embassy Suites allot because we like the buffets when traveling with our the 3 children. Usually the service is adequate at most of the ones that we have stayed at including the one in San Diego just before staying here. Unfortunately the service here was horrible. From the lack of attention at the front desk, the inability to provide any guidence to local attractions and the downright rood attitude from the attendant at the transportation booth. Definately get a rental car because you will not want to have to deal with the bus service from the hotel. From what would have been an average stay at a typical Embassy Suites (clean room, decent buffet) was ruined by the poor customer service at this hotel. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a great place to stay before hitting the parks.  The breakfast and snacks in the afternoon are a fantastic addition and cut down on some of the cost of going to the theme parks.  It is a quick bus ride over to Disney.  The bus picks up right in front of the hotel.  I love the suites.  We put the kids to bed on the pull out couch and we went to our room to relax and watch tv.  It was nice to go to our separate quarters after a full day of running around.  Everything is clean and well maintained and the lobby is beautiful.  It maintains the feel of going to the theme parks with the koi ponds and turtles in the water features of the lobby.  It is not so over the top to be a turn off to business travelers.  The only problem we have with this hotel is the SLOW elevators
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Exceptional service, extras worth the trip!
Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for three nights on a family trip to Disneyland. At first the distance to the park was an issue when booking ,but after enjoying the free breakfast with made to order omelettes and afternoon reception with free drinks (alcoholic and other), we certainly didn't mind the shuttle ride to Disney parks. We usually stay across the street from the park and pay for breakfast at IHOP or such, but why when you can get your breakfast for free! And better breakfast than most I've paid for! Room was nice , two seperate rooms and plenty of room to spread out! Only drawback to stay was no shade umbrellas or trees at pool area, since it was over 100 degrees all the days we were there, the pool was a nice option only at night after the blazing hot sun was down.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is still one of the safest bets on the Disneyland strip as far as Hotels go.    It is consistantly clean & comfortable.    Location is nice, near many restaurants and not so close to the Disney Property that there is constant traffic.  The property has done some minor improvements recently, new carpeting in the corridors along with replacing/refinishing some of the furnishings in the rooms.    The rooms still look pretty good.   Our room had a new sofa/chair and was spotless thanks to an outstanding housekeeper.     The service at the hotel was well described by a previous reviewer as "polite but not friendly"; which I found to be accurate.   However, I did encounter some issues with some of hotel's desk staff that I feel are unforgiveable.   I called the desk on two
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visited Anaheim for the first time and when checking in at this hotel we recieved the warmest welcome ever . We were checked in by a gentleman named Brian and he is a true embassador for this hotel . All the staff were extemely friendly and treated you as a person . There was a gentlman who was on the front door by the name of Paul who would always ask how your day had been and was always happy to give advice on where to travel , 10/ 10 . The amenities at the hotel from the computers to the swimming pool were excellent . The only thing we were disappointed in was the sofa bed in our suite , the mattress on it was that thin you could feel every part of the metal frame , however we were given extra quilted mattress covers to make it more comfortable . ( Thankyou ) In summing up
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family stayed here from September 7-12, my husband and I and our 2 boys (5 and 1 1/2).  This is our 5th stay here at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South.  We love it so much that we come back to stay everytime we're in Disneyland.  Our check in went smooth as usual, although I was a little disappointed that we had to pay for parking this time, but at $6/day I couldn't really complain when I see othe hotels charge upwards of $15/day for parking.  We requested and got the same room that we have at every visit, my kids like seeing the same framiliar layout, it makes us feel at home.  The breakfast area was well stocked as usual and the staff always friendly and efficient.  The housekeeping staff were also great as usual, leaving items that we would request such as extra towels.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The front desk staff though polite are not friendly. They need to smile. Some was cleaning the room above ours (11th floor) it woke us and the other two rooms our family had reserved. The time being 1:30am, we were uncertain as to what the noise was. The next morning we asked the young girl at the front desk what was going on the 12th floor. She told us that she was not on and if we had questions about noise we need to report it immediately so they can be asked to quite down. She made no attempt to investigate our complaint only dismissed it. With the economy the way it is these days you would think reserving 3 rooms would rate atleast a "I'll look in to it". What we found from the staff was the hotel was cleaning rooms above us. We have stayed at this hotel twice before and
Manager Response: GuyPO15,  We truly appreciate you for taking the time to provide us your feedback on your most recent stay. It is feedback from our guests that help us to improve areas within our hotel. Please rest assured that we will address your concern especially your interaction with our personnel regarding noise complaints. I apologize on behalf of our entire team and look forward to providing you excellence service during your next visit. Thank you for your loyalty from all of us here at Embassy Suites Anaheim South.  Yours in Hospitality,  Dominic Acolino

Summary Heading: Not as bowled over 2nd time round
Summary: Our family stayed here on August 23 for 5 nights. This was our second stay in this hotel, the first time being 4 years ago.  However, I doubt if we would return again.  Although we did not have major problems, the hotel seemed to have lost  some of it's sparkle since our first stay.  The first thing that hit me was how dark and dingy everything seemed. IMO the public areas could do with some colour and light injected into them in order to lift the mood a bit. Even the rooms, although very clean and tidy seemed really dull and the lighting bad.  It was quite depressing and a relief to get out of the hotel into the sunshine!  I agree also with a previous poster that the breakfast did not seem as well stocked and fresh as it was during our previous visit.  Another issue during our
Manager Response: holidaynut,  Thank for your feedback and for taking the time to write on your most recent stay. It is commentary from our guests that help me identify areas of improvement. I am pleased  and excited to say that we are currently in the planning phase of renovating our guest rooms in the near future. Your comments are of great value to me and hope that we can gain your trust in a return visit on your next trip to Anaheim. Thanks for your loyalty to the Anaheim Resort from all of us here at Embassy Suites Anaheim South.  Yours in Hospitality, Dominic

Summary: My wife and I stayed 3 nights with my daughter and her 2 daughters.  Our experience confirmed the high ratings in the other reviews -- helpful staff, good breakfast included, reasonable parking charge, nice happy hour, sizable rooms, etc.  I'd add only the following:  The pool is very large and welcoming for the essential mid-day break from the park; the business center (which is free) is far better equipped than in many hotels that purport to cater primarily to business travelers, not vacationers, and the adjoining Buce de Beppo Italian restaurant has great pasta at good prices.   (Obviously it's a matter of taste, but we found the ART shuttle better than driving --- much shorter walks, just as fast, and no park-closing rush.  But we were there on relatively low attendance days
Manager Response: none

Summary: Where to start? The hotel staff were incredibly helpful, the second we first walked into the lobby area, we were stunned, the staff at the front desk helped us with our room, a safe, and  any questions we had, and within minutes we were in our room.   The room was large and perfect for our needs, the view was not the best, but that did not matter to us at all. The bedroom, livingroom and the bathroom were all spotlessly clean, with the housekeeping staff cleaning everything every day.   The bed in the main bedroom was enormous! It was a very comfy bed, however the pillows were dull and lifeless. When we asked for more pillows, they arrived in minutes.  The pullout bed in the living room, was not terrbly comfortable, but it was still fine to sleep on, and was very simple to
Manager Response: none

Summary: This trip was the second time my family has stayed at this property in the past year. We were impressed the first time with its proximity to Disneyland and its sizable rooms. Thankfully, neither of those has changed.   The room this trip (916) seemed very clean, as was the bathroom. The only real issue I had was with the pull-out sofa bed where my children slept. The mattress seemed old and worn, like it was in need of replacement (just sitting on it proved that point). It had a very thin, worn-looking mattress cover on it, with (overstretched and useless) elastic bands on the corners to keep it in place. The only bedding provided was a flat sheet that had been folded into the sofa. I called housekeeping at 11 o'clock at night to request a fitted sheet, blanket and extra pillows
Manager Response: ValleyMom,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback on your most recent stay. Summary Heading: We'll never stay anywhere but Embassy suites again!
Summary: This hotel completely changed the way we viewed hotels.  Absolutely amazing service, delicious food, spacious rooms, comfortable beds- and for an extremely good price.  My boyfriend and I figured we saved over $80 a day between the overwhelmingly large breakfast choices and happy hour drinks and appetizers! Coupled with a room that felt clean,  the service with a smile, and never a wait for anything- plus the shuttle to Disneyland we took multiple times daily was never crowded and easy to schedule into our itinerary.  Thank you again Embassy Suites- we can't wait to travel now knowing we'll be staying at your hotel!
Manager Response: Jenn,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel.  I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and will be returning in the future.  Our complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast and Manager's Reception are definitely a favorite among guests.  We strive to provide the best service possible and will continue to ensure that is exactly what you receive during your next visit!  Yours in Hospitality,  Kamran Enayat

Summary: We stayed here with our kids when we went to Disneyland in April 2009.  After researching different hotels near the park this was by far our best value.  I wanted something that included breakfast & had a suite which all Embassy Suites do!  We had originally tried to find something closer to the park, but most of the hotels were a bit older & had mixed reviews.  We stay in Embassy Suites all over & thought this would be the best choice for us.  We weren't disappointed.  The rooms were great.  Exactly what we wanted.  The front desk was fantastic.  My husband was having a lot of back pain & they arranged a massage for him.  We also had an awful experience with the driver we hired to pick us up at the airport & they found someone to take us back at the end of our trip.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed here in April of 2007 and May of 2008.  This is by far the best Embassy that is out there!  It is busy at times with families making a trip to see Mickey but always clean, great service and the best Embassy breakfast.  By far, my top Embassy pick.  Great rate plus with the big breakfast that took care of our breakfast & lunch so we would snack at the park, leave for dinner and saved us $$$$.   They also have pizza during the manager's reception that can make for an easy dinner that doesn't break the bank.   We've stayed here a total of 10 nights between the 2 years and never had any problems
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review Embassy Suites Anaheim - South.  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you continue to choose our property for your family vacations.  We appreciate your feedback as we are always looking for ways to improve our service and guest experience.  We look forward to having you back in the future.  Yours in Hospitality,  Kamran Enayat

Summary Heading: moderate size rooms, otherwise great experience
Summary: located half a mile from main entrance, parking moderately charged, since we were six people it worked out better driving over than taking transportation to Disney. Rooms were  pleasant. not to big but good for three people, forget privacy if you go with teenagers, or book separate rooms. Nicely built garden like inside, with a very good breakfast in an extremely pleasant area, buffet like but this is the way we like it. Pleasant pool and jacuzzi area. Would go back if in the area. We got our money s worth. No free room internet which is rather expansive, but available for free at room in first floor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I looked aroung A LOT for different hotels but we always come back to the Embassy.  We took a family vacation to Disneyland for three days with a 2 year old and a 1 year old.  Our major concern with this hotel was that it is not walking distance.  You need to take the ART which I think is about $4 per person or drive.  The hotel charges $6 for parking at the hotel.    With the little kids we wanted a suite so when the kids nap we have somewhere to watch TV and hand out.  The Embassy has free drinks and popcorn from 5:30 - 7:30pm and $2 pizza everynight.  This helped keep the costs down when it came to food.    The suite was a very good size and also came with a microwave.  Plenty of room for the kids to run around but not have to trip on them.  The made to order breakfast was
Manager Response: none

Summary: Embassy Suites Anaheim South This review describes our experiences for a 5-night stay at Embassy Suites Anaheim South from July 6 through July 10 2009.  Front Desk/Check-In This area can be a bit of a log-jam as families typically congregate with their luggage in the entry way to the hotel. Our check-in experience was fast (we arrived about 10:00 pm) and we were placed in a “theme park view” room on the 9th floor (of 14 I believe). We were told we could see fireworks from Disneyland from that vantage point. That was a nice consideration, even though we knew we wouldn’t be in the room on any of the days at fireworks time. It turns out my wife did not like the airiness of the atrium and the height of our room (9th floor) something akin to a fear of heights. So we promptly returned

Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel and we were equally impressed this time as we had been the first time.  The staff are friendly, efficient and cheerful and no request is ignored or delayed - we requested additional bedding for our room and it arrived within minutes with extra pillows and towels as well.  The rooms are spacious and clean, linens are crisp and fresh and the beds are comfortable.  As expected in early July, the hotel was very busy but I was never awoken or kept awake by noise and I am a light sleeper - the rooms appear to be fairly noise-resistant.  The breakfast experience can take some getting used to as it is very busy but the omelet  chef is a pleasure to watch and be served by - he can cook 10 different omelets and still smile and joke with people -
Manager Response: none

Summary: we arrived here after the hyatt didn't give us our suite that was booked over a month in advance. we had no reservation here, but when we told them of our nightmare with hyatt, they went above and beyond. the staff was so friendly and helpful. anytime we called downstairs for anything, they saw to our needs within minutes. at one point they called our room to see if our food had arrived, and if we were enjoying it. make sure that you take advantage of the free breakfast..i couldn't believe my eyes when i saw it. all of the room service room was amazing. we were there for a wedding, and the bellboy who carried our luggage the day before inquired as to how the wedding was when we checked out. it was completely comfortable there, other than the room being a bit small for the amount

Summary Heading: Great hotel!  Would highly recommend and definitely would stay again!
Summary: We have just returned from a 4-night stay at the Embassy Suites South in Garden Grove.  I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel.    The room was spacious enough for our family of 6 with 2 double beds and a pull out sofa bed in the living area.  There is a mini fridge and sink along with a small table and chairs for either dining or filling out the postcards to send back home.  The bathroom was large with the usual complimentary toiletries provided.  (don't believe everything you hear about hotels cutting back on the free stuff)    The free breakfast is simply AMAZING, especially when traveling with children.  There's an omelet station as well as scrambled eggs, sausage links, bacon, french toast sticks, pancakes, toast, bagels, muffins, doughnuts...  Beverages
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The Embassy Suites EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS!
Summary: At first I was bummed out because I missed the deadline to book a room at the disney hotel but in the end everything worked out. This hotel exceeded my expectations. Rooms were clean and well kept. Furniture and carpet seem new and well kept. Pool was fantastic. The kids had a great time in the pool and by the ponds, especially because of the lion. :) My husband and sister were pleased with the generous breakfast and breakfast options. The hotel service was excellent! Me and my family used the hotel shuttle to get to Disneyland and even the shuttle driver was pleasant. The bed and pillows were super comfy and clean. I really got a chance to relax and my kids got a chance to explore and have fun in the pool and in the rooms. In overall, I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a wonderful time here. My 6 yr old dd loved seeing "Leo" the lion roar and the fish in the stream. The breakfast was wonderful! There were soda, booze and snacks early evening for free. Pizza for 2.00 a slice then too. The rooms were clean and quite. DD got up in the morning and watched tv while we slept undisturbed.  I wish we could stay here everytime. My only small fault is that it has a very mediocre pool and spa. I wish that area was spruced up a little and the spa cleaned more.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Can't go wrong with this Embassy Suites
Summary: So, my mom and I decide to take a short trip to Disneyland, during her visit to Las Vegas. We've both used other Embassy Suites in the past, so we settled on this one, based on the location and reviews. Let me tell you, we were not disappointed.  The rooms were spacious and clean. The breakfast was plenty and delicious (although there usually was a nice line to the buffet). The location is right around the corner from Disneyland. The staff (with one exception) was helpful and nice. And to top all of this off, the price was right as well. :) Although you will have to rent a car (or bring your own) if you're staying here, the location is less than a 10 minute drive.  I would recommend anyone to stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent choice when traveling with toddlers
Summary: We had just a few days at this hotel but I was impressed.  We arrived late and was delivered a crib for my daughter within minutes.  The mattress is just cardboard so we folded the quits to make it soft, she slept fine.  The suites are great size, including the bathroom.  Its wonderful to have the two rooms when kids are around so they can sleep and you can relax in the living room.  The breakfast was pretty good, and the shuttle right outside was extremely convenient to get into Disney.  We came back and had supper in the dining room and the service was nice and the food was pretty good and not overly priced.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Pros – Very close to Disneyland and California Adventure.  The hotel’s lobby  was nicely done with a koi pond, bridges and a waterfall.  There was a lion that roared every hour atop a tall rock formation that my son enjoyed.  The room was large with lots of room for the family.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The Cons – The breakfast was nothing to rave about.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 5 nights for our Disneyland trip, extended family with 3 kids.  They did not have many connecting rooms, but we got two rooms beside each other which was great.  The breakfast buffet was great, and is a good way to fill up before heading to the theme parks... Just be sure to get your breakfast early to avoid the long lines.   The parking was not free.... the hotel gives you a tag to put on your car, and it was i think $12 a day.  I wish they would have had free internet, and the workout room is pretty small.  Otherwise we really enjoyed our stay, the kids were at the pool and hot tub quite a bit in the evenings.  The shuttle to Disneyland was always on time, and it is great that the hotel was the first stop so there was always room on the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel. The highs: Beautiful atrium with the fish ponds and roaring animated lion for the kids, large suite with well-separated bedroom and living areas, 2 TVs, free parking, Starbucks in Hyatt lobby next door, 1 mile to Disneyland. Free breakfast that included a few healthy options, such as yogurt, toast, and cereal was nice. The lows: very few, a small and crowded pool, 2 of the 4 business computers did not work. We only used the pool the day when we arrived because most of the daylight hours are spent away from the hotel at the theme and water parks. So that's probably the reason for the small size. It's not well-advertised that you can get on the internet free in the business center, otherwise it's $10/day on their wireless network. The speed worked
Manager Response: none

Summary: my favorite part of this hotel was the beutiful atrium, with the great buffet downstairs, was not crazy about the pool becaue it was a little small, the room was big but had a tiny bed and the shower curtain was moldy, overall this was a pretty good hotel. also is not to far awy from disneyland!

Summary: I'd read the other reviews and wasn't completely sure what to expect from this hotel, but for what they deal with, they do an excellent job.  The omlet guy told me their were 700 guests under the age of 18 at the hotel, yet the meals we're not as bad as you would think, it all runs pretty smooth.  If you're staying at an Embassy this close to Disney, you know who will be staying there.  For the most part the guests we're all courteous, making room for each other on the shuttles and staying in line, same at breakfast.  The pizza at the reception is a brilliant idea.  Only issue we had at the hotel since we were on the 11th floor was with parents who weren't paying attention to their children who would push every elevator button and then get off on the second floor. Summary: My wife, 3 kids and I and stayed here for 5 nights and had an amazing time. The staff went out of thier way to make us feel comfortable. From bell service, to housekeeping, to the special Disneyland desk, they were friendly accomodating and patient (VERY important with 3 young children). The lion in the atrium was fun for the kids, and as at all the Embassy suites I have stayed at, the breakfast and reception were well done. big pizza slices for 2 bucks, and free drinks after a day at Disneyland was a nice way to settle into evening. The rooms were spacious and clean. we had a few special requests and they were taken care of quickly and efficiently. Summary: We stayed here in August as a family of 4 for 2 weeks and would definitly recommend it. The rooms are great for a family as you have a seperate lounge area, also two tvs. The bathroom was of a good size, modern and very clean. The free breakfast is great, although it does get busy if you go down later, but you can always take it up to your room with you. There was a washing machine and tumble dryer on floor nine, again this does get busy but go first thing in the morning or late at night. There is a lovely Italian resturant in the hotel car park, must go there food was gorgeous. Dont go to any of the resturants with valet parking(very expensive) Supermarket just across the road and a dollar shop. Summary: This hotel is relatively close to Disney.  They have an inexpensive shuttle to Disney as well. The service was good. Rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was well organized. - not too crowded and much variety in food choices.  Overall, a good hotel for family vacations to Disney.  Will stay there again.

Summary: Having to book last minute travel to a conference at a different hotel was not easy when the conference hotel was booked. i did some research and found that the Embassy Suites Anaheim South was right next door to where I needed to be. Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my second time staying at the Embassy Suites in Anaheim South. Both times I was stuck facing the vacant driving range behind hotel. I love the decor of the lobby. The lion roaring and the koi fish swimming is always nice. Cook to order breakfest and a managers reception is a nice touch as well. Being located in what I believe is a perfect location. Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites the week of Thanksgiving.  I had made reservations about a month before the stay and was monitoring the rates.  We booked directly with Embassy since all the third party vendors had the same rate.  A few days before leaving on the trip I noticed the rate dropped and called the hotel for a rate adjustment. There was also a safety latch on each door along with a peep hole.  Our room was on the 6th floor corner room.  We could only see the top half of the fireworks.  There were trees blocking our view in the distance.  The suite was very clean.   We did

Summary Heading: loved it best hotel ever stayed at!!
Summary: we went to disneyland and stayed at that hotel and we loved it were going in 2009 on my brithday the breakfest was awsome and free the beds are comferble and the dinner was like 2.00 a slice of pizza or something like that and free drinks and free snacks you can bring up to your room there was a lion and see through elavaters and we took a shuttle bus to disneyland it was so fun and a excellent hotel we went in are pjs to get are breakfest and no one stared of anything.

Summary: Friendly and helpful staff made the stay that much better.  The breakfast is better than most hotels.  They have omelettes cooked to order, eggs cooked to order, cereal, pastries, fruit, pancakes, etc.  Make sure you get there at least 15 minutes before they close it because once it is closing time for breakfast, they put everything away quickly.  We found it was easier to take it up to the room and eat when it was really crowded.    Gift shop is a joke.  My family started getting a cold and I went to buy them medicine in the gift shop.  I paid $13.00 for Sudafed and $10.00 for Childrens Tylenol. What a rip!!!  The beds are comfortable but if you get the room with the 2 doubles, it can be tight if sleeping 2 to a bed.  Luckily they have a pull out sofa that kids seem to enjoy
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Embassy Suites offers great value for families and people travelling in groups.  Both the bedroom area and the living room area are very spacious.  While the hotel is not one of the newest in the area, it is well-kept and provides great complimentary breakfast and reception hour in the evenings.  The fitness center on site is above average, too.  Parking is free and the price is very reasonable for families and groups on vacation.  The hotel is also within walking distance to chain restaurants such as Buca di Beppo and Red Robin.

Summary: Just got back from staying three nights at the Embassy Suites.  We arrived at 10:30 am, tired from driving 6 hours we hoped that we might check in early.  They were very accomodating and were able to get us in a room; we had booked a king bed, but they would not be available until 3:00 so they offered us two doubles, we happily accepted.  We also were able to get this room to adjoin with our daughter and her family.  Our 15-month old grandson was delighted to go from room to room!  As previously noted in other reviews, the fire alarm went off at about 10:00pm, scared the crap out of us!  After several minutes, they confirmed that it was a false alarm, kind of a nuisance if this happens very often!  Breakfast was very good, lots of choices, from cereal to omelettes, to pancakes!

Summary: this property is so dialed in to the family/disney experience it made it so wonderful to stay here and we will definitely come back on our next trip to the area.    it was our 1st family trip to disneyland and although we thought it would be inconvenient to stay a bus ride from the park all of the amenities offered at the embassy far surpassed any worry about the twice daily shuttle ride.  plus, when you ask our son what his favorite ride at disneyland is, he will tell you the bus ride to the park.  the rates are much more reasonable than onsite hotels, the free breakfast is completely fabulous, and having the kids sleep in the separate living room gave us all a chance to get a good night's sleep required to have fun doing a full day at disneyland.  everyone staying here is on

Summary: Me & my husband stayed here for 11 days on 28/8 - 8/9/08 and we had the best time ever.  The staff were fab and our room on 12th floor was fab too we had a view of the fireworks every night going off in Disney.  I would just like to say a great big thanks to Lesaley who is the front desk supervisor for making our stay so special I lost my mum back in the Uk while we were staying here and she had lots of stuff sent up to the room to try and make me feel better and I really appreciated that she is so special to us. managers reception was fab 5.30 - 7.30 pm every night we made a new drink called the vodka sunrise and it was my fave.  Can not fault this hotel at all it is 5 mins from Disney 45 mins from Hollywood and LA and 1 hour away from San Diego you will not have a bad time

Summary: We stayed for 7 nights at the end of August and although my wife thought that the room was not as clean as it could have been and that the bath tap dripped it was a very nice hotel. No problem with check in and the staff were polite and helpful. We had a room with a view of Disney fireworks on the 11 floor. The business centre was very convenient for checking e mails etc but free internet access would have been better. The breakfast was okay but having the same choice of food for 7 mornings became a little boring, but service was good if not busy at weekends. I made the most of the manages evening each night and had a few cups of free beer!!!!! nice touch Embassy. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Summary Heading: Probably would not stay here again unless I wanted to walk to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights and when we arrived, the room they gave us was nonsmoking but reeked of a party: cigarettes and booze.  The front desk staff was not interested in helping us and the manager was not much better.  The bellman was great though! We finally got moved.  Rooms are typical for ES but small.  There is a Bucca di Beppo next door which is great for meals.  The location is close to DL which is the reason most people are there.  We spent one night at the ES Anaheim North and prefered it.  The rooms are much bigger.  It is not too far from DL and they do have a shuttle.  The rooms are also cheaper, so if you don't mind driving an extra 5 minutes, it shouldn't be a problem.  ES South is a decent place but for the price I would go to the other one.

The sheets are very soft and not of a cheap nature. Refridgerater also has a freezer. The breakfast is great. You cant get a better place to eat. However there coffee is the worst ever. You cant walk to Disneyland it is to far. AAA members get free parking at Disneyland if you buy your tickets at AAA.  They. cant get you in your room earlier then check in either so dont arrive early or you will wait. The rooms are insulated really well and I neever heard anything. The breakfast is very good, cooked to order omelets, eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, yogurt, cereal, coffee, fruit, donuts, yum! Not to mention the managers reception every evening with free snacks, sodas & adult beverages. All free. Wonderful deal & great way for the kids to relax from the parks. Summary: Hotel appears relatively new.  Rooms were clean and parking was free.  The free breakfast was somewhat of a zoo and the quality of the food marginal at best - you get what you pay for. Summary: We stayed here from August 1st through the 6th. We were on the 5th floor. The hotel is pretty, has a safe feeling, staff is very friendly from housekeeping to the front desk, rooms are nice, big and clean, great to have a door to close so you can get dressed and ready in private. It was myself (a 40 year old mom), two teenagers and a 10 year old. There was plenty of room for all of us, and it was very comfortable. The two T.V.'s worked really well. I slept well in the double bed and didn't find it too hard myself. My ten year old slept well in the other bed. I'm not sure why Embassy Suites doesn't have queen beds to offer like many other hotels and motels. If my husband had gone with us on the trip it would have been more uncomfortable to sleep in a double bed with two people.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family  of four stayed here from July 31st to the 4th of August.  It was crowded, as all of Anaheim is right now, but we did not feel overwhelmed while in the hotel.  Yes, there is a wait for breakfast in the rush after 9am, but the hotel gives you times to avoid the crowds.  Also, the elevators are crowded & slow, but it doesn't help when kids are in them without parents and push every floor button!  The rooms are well kept, a bit on the "brown safari" theme, but clean and well serviced with linens, towels, cups, etc.   To sum up, for 129 per night, we were very satisified with the facilities, the staff are always seen cleaning and saying good morning, etc.  I would recommend this hotel to families.  The room is nice since it is a suite with two rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a nice place for families. But don't be confused, it is not a luxury hotel or resort by any stretch of the imagination. In my opinion it is barely 3 star. It also can be quite pricey. I paid $150 per night for two people - those aren't low rates in Anaheim. Having stayed in many Anaheim properties, including the Disney-owned ones, I definitely prefer Marriott or Starwood properties over Hilton (which owns Embassy Suites, Doubletree, etc.)   The beds were classic "old hotel" style meaning they were hard. Embassy has adopted none of the new standards pioneered by Marriott and Starwood (much more comfortable and higher quality beds, high quality sheets and bedding, use of white to imply cleanliness, etc.) Given the clear standards of their competitors (particularly
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here June 5-7 for our first trip to Disneyland. Having stayed at Embassy Suites properties before & travelling with a little one, we were quick to book this hotel. You can't beat the size of the rooms, the buffet breakfast and the nightly cocktail reception. The rooms were clean, the food was plentiful, parking was free and the employees were very friendly.   The shuttle to Disneyland ran every 10 minutes and had plenty of room on it throughout the day (we made several trips for "nap time").  As the other reviewers have pointed out, the elevators are slow but we had a room on the 2nd floor and just walked. The only other thing I would point out is that if you have an atrium view, be aware of the noise from the waterfalls (especially if you're a light sleeper).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed a week at the Embassy Suites Anaheim South during the 4th of July. Hotel was packed but still had a pleasant stay.  Always found somewhere to sit at the great buffet breakfast.  Elevators were always packed.  Pool was simple but heated and the kids still had a great time.   Beds were hard as a rock and the pillows were horrible!  This hotel did help us to save a lot of money with the comp breakfast and evening drinks and snacks.  Not to mention the kids loved getting their own drinks, food, etc.

Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites South in July of 2005.  The facility is gorgeous, and although it is not for those on a truly tight budget, it is good value for those who can afford it, given the size of the rooms, the quality of the amenities, the complimentary breakfast and reception.  However, service leaves A LOT to be desired.  The elevators are slow; the number of laundry facilities are inadequate for the number of units; and the front desk's attitude is more lackadaisical than service-oriented.  Of more concern, the fire alarm malfunctioned TWICE in the middle of the night while we were there, and the guests were evacuated for what turned out to be a technical problem that we were told keeps happening and for some reason hasn't been repaired yet.  Of even more concern

Summary: We stayed at this beautiful hotel July 7-9 and were extremely pleased. The hotel was sold out (as we kept trying to add another night), and in the morning there were throngs of people trying to get to breakfast at the last minute (even though they serve for 3 1/2 hours!) The staff worked hard to keep everything clean and the delicious bountiful buffet was always well stocked. Every employee we encountered was extremely friendly and anything we needed was taken care of quickly and with a smile. There was always someone around to answer our questions - we really felt "taken care of". The hotel is beautiful and our suite was very spacious. We kept wondering how they kept the hotel looking so clean with all the people there. By far the best hotel we have stayed at so far.

Summary: We did a lot of research before leaving on our Disneyland trip this June.  Although we had read great things about this place,  it even exceeded our expectations.    Our room was large,  lots of space to move around in the bedroom even though it had two queen size beds.  Having two TV's was great,  our kids had the bedroom and my husband and I used the fold out bed in the living room, so they enjoyed having their own space and watching tv in the morning. It was nice to have a fridge and microwave in the kitchen area as well. Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in May for a trip to Disneyland.  The rooms were very modern and clean.  The breakfast was a great feature with plenty of choices including fruit, cooked to order omlettes, and the usual breakfast fare.  The daily manager's reception in the evening was a nice touch.  The staff was friendly and always willing to answer any questions.   We would stay here again.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel the week leading up to Memorial Day.  We were warmly received and asked repeatedly if we were having a good time and was everything alright.  The room were kept very clean.  Requests for extra pillows an extra towels were promptly filled.  they provided enough soap and shampoo for three guests to shower twice daily.  The breakfast buffet and the free evening cocktail sessions were well organized and executed.    Located close to Disney with a shuttle available for transport.  Only knock is the wireless internet signal is weak on the upper floors.  They need a repeater to make it worth the charge.

Summary: We just returned from a 4 day stay at this incredible hotel. The hotel is beautiful with a marble floor lobby (gorgeous fresh flowers!), and an incredible Atrium with streams and waterfalls. Summary Heading: Great place for families, but pricey...
Summary: Typical Embassy Suites--great hotel w/ large suite rooms, famous cook-to-order breakfast and cocktail hour, kids loved the "rainforest" theme.  Room services was fairly decent too, as we used it a few times  My only complaint was the price - upwards of $150/night.  Our trip was last minute, so I couldn't be extremely choosy--but I would rather have stayed less nights at the Grand Californian than a week at Embassy Suites.  At least then it would feel "more Disney," walking in and out of the park instead of waiting for shuttles, going to the room for lunch or naps instead of schlepping a bag around all day long...

Summary Heading: Very family oriented and good value

For us it was great as we have a 7 and 9 year old.  The rooms are very nicely decorated and for the most part, very comfortable. Summary: Embassy Suites South Anaheim was great spot to stay for Disneyland trip. Room was clean, modern, comfortable, large. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Summary: Stayed 6 nights in December 2004 with my husband.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  Disneyland is a manageable walk away or there is the regular shuttle service.  Great bar in the lobby and Manager offers free drinks and pizza between 5:00pm and 7:00 pm every day.  Wonderful place to stay.

Summary Heading: A Great Place to Stay in Anaheim
Summary: We stayed there about one year ago for the USA National Cheer Competition. The hotel was sold out and mostly populated by cheer competition participants and their families. Summary Heading: Australia to Embassey Suites - Loved it - Great for familys
Summary: We had a great family holiday at the embassy suites. Our 2 boys aged 10 & 8 had a ball. Our day always started with a big breakfast before heading off to disneyland. The kids loved all the bacon and doughnuts.   We had a couple of swims in the pool, which is nice and clean.  For dinner we found a very nice family run Mexican Restaurant within 200m. Go out the front, turn right down to the traffic lights cross over and is in the small group of shops where the Pizza Hut takeaway is.  We also had some food delivered on a couple of nights after some tiring days of walking. One of them was some of the best Chinese we have had.  We would love to go back in a few years, the rooms were very spacious. With 2 double beds and a sofa bed. We booked on line and got some good rates.

Summary: Friendly service, great breakfast. Beds were OK, not great, but rooms spacious, happy hour was nice with popcorn, snacks and free soft drinks. Reasonable prices for the on the premises restaurant. Pizza deal for large pizza for family only 14.99. Highly recommend. Shuttle was $3/per person, kids free.

Summary: My wife, children aged 15 and 11 and myself spent 4 days at the Embassy Suites Hotel in December.  The rooms are large, very well presented and immaculately clean and the 4 of us were easily able to avoid tripping over each other.  The bathroom is also large and luxurious.  The hotel serves a great breakfast, certainly too much for someone like me who normally survives on cereal and a soy milk, but the children indulged themselves.  The hotel also has a first class gym and pool, and the ground floor restaurant can do a very reasonably priced meal for those who, like us, didn't feel like going out looking for somewhere to eat after an exhausting day at Disneyland.  I did a lot of research before choosing this hotel and it certainly paid off.

Summary: Best room we have stayed in anywhere - very large room with 2 double beds, table and 4 chairs, 2 TV's, sofa area, kitchenette and bathroom.  Shuttle bus to theme parks.  Would recommend this hotel - very impressed.  All positives - no negatives.
